question: Why is interest earned on my CPF LIFE premium not included as part of the amount paid to my beneficiaries when I pass away?
answer:
['CPF LIFE is a longevity insurance scheme that provides you with a monthly payout for as long as you live. When you join CPF LIFE, your CPF LIFE premium will be paid with your CPF savings. Projected interest earned on your CPF LIFE premium is factored into your monthly payouts from the start.
Your CPF LIFE payouts will be drawn from your CPF LIFE premium first. When your CPF LIFE premium is exhausted, you will then draw your monthly payouts for as long as you live from the interest that you and other CPF LIFE members have accumulated.
The lifelong payouts under CPF LIFE for all members are made possible through this method of interest accumulation. That is why interest does not form part of the amount paid to the beneficiaries of CPF LIFE members when they pass away.
If you pass on before your CPF LIFE premium is exhausted, the CPF LIFE premium balance (if any) together with any remaining CPF savings will be distributed to your loved ones.']

question: Are my CPF savings affected by Temasek's performance?
answer:
['Your CPF savings are not affected by Temasek√¢¬Ä¬ôs performance.
Your CPF savings are invested in Special Singapore Government Securities (SSGS), issued and guaranteed by the Singapore Government. The SSGS returns are guaranteed regardless of Temasek√¢¬Ä¬ôs performance over any period.']

question: How do CPF interest rates compare with other countries' pension systems?
answer:
['CPF interest rates are fair and attractive.
Your CPF savings earn up to 3.5% per year in the Ordinary Account and up to 5% per year in the Special, MediSave and Retirement Accounts on the first $60,000 of combined CPF balances. Members aged 55 and above get an extra 1% on the first $30,000 of their combined CPF balances (i.e. up to 6% per year). You do not bear any investment risk on your CPF savings.
In comparison, citizens in some other countries have to choose their own pension investment plan and expose their retirement savings to market risks. Their retirement nest egg could be affected during a financial crisis or sustained period of low interest rates.
Nevertheless, if you are a financially-savvy member who wishes to invest your CPF savings for higher returns and are willing to bear the investment risk, you may do so through the CPF Investment Scheme.']

question: Why am I not allowed to withdraw my CPF savings in a lump sum if I have savings above the prevailing Full Retirement Sum before turning age 55?
answer:
['The CPF system is designed to help all Singaporeans save for retirement. The more you set aside in your CPF for retirement, the higher your monthly CPF payout which you can enjoy starting from your Payout Eligibility Age.
As your personal circumstances, including the means to support yourself financially in retirement besides your CPF savings, could change, it would not be prudent to make significant lump sum CPF withdrawals too far in advance of your retirement.
Meanwhile, you can choose to tap on your CPF savings to meet expenditure needs such as housing.']

question: Why do I need CPF LIFE?
answer:
['Nobody can predict how long anyone will actually live. Therefore, planning how much of your retirement savings to use for living expenses is a dilemma √¢¬Ä¬ì Spend too much and you might not have enough if you live longer than you thought; spend too little and you might deprive yourself from fully enjoying your hard-earned savings.
With increasing advances in technology and healthcare, you are likely to live longer than your grandparents√¢¬Ä¬ô or parents√¢¬Ä¬ô generation. Therefore, you cannot predict how long you will live by looking at how long your parents or grandparents live. Otherwise, you may underestimate your lifespan and find your savings depleted with many more years to live when you are no longer able to work.
With CPF LIFE, you do not need to worry about being caught in such a situation but have the assurance of having a steady stream of income, no matter what age you live to.']

question: Do I have to join CPF LIFE?
answer:
['You will be automatically included if you are a Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident born on 1 January 1958 and after\*, and have at least $60,000 in your CPF retirement savings when you start your monthly payouts.
*\*If you are born between 1 January 1958 and 30 April 1961, and had at least $40,000 in your Retirement Account when you reached 55, you would have to join CPF LIFE.*']

question: How does the CPF LIFE Escalating Plan work?
answer:
['The CPF LIFE Escalating Plan is a suitable option if you want to protect your retirement income from rising prices. Under this plan you'll receive payouts that increase by 2% each year. Although the payouts start lower, they will eventually become higher than the Standard Plan and Basic Plan payouts. The Escalating Plan gives you peace of mind knowing that you can generally maintain your standard of living even as the cost of living goes up during your retirement years.
For example, if you start with a monthly payout of $1,000 when you turn 65, it will increase by 2% each year and reach around $1,500 when you are 85. The 2% increase takes place every year in the same month that you receive your first payout.
Under this plan, all your Retirement Account savings will be deducted as CPF LIFE premium when you join CPF LIFE, which can be anytime from 65 to 70.
Your CPF LIFE monthly payouts will first be paid from your CPF LIFE premium. When your CPF LIFE premium is depleted, you will continue to receive the monthly payouts from the interest that you and other CPF LIFE members have accumulated, no matter how long you live.']

question: Why is the increase in CPF LIFE Escalating Plan payouts fixed at 2% per year and not matched to actual inflation rate?
answer:
['CPF LIFE Escalating Plan payouts are not specifically matched to actual inflation in each year so that the increase in payouts is predictable and stable.
By fixing the increase at 2% per year, CPF LIFE can provide some protection against inflation while keeping premiums at a more affordable level. Additionally, the 2% increase is meant to be a conservative estimate of the average inflation rate over time, which can vary from year to year.']

question: I know that CPF LIFE Basic Plan is a legacy option. But why did Government introduce Basic Plan previously? Can I switch to another plan?
answer:
['When CPF LIFE Basic Plan was first introduced in 2009, it was better than the previous default monthly payout scheme which did not provide payouts for life. However, to better suit Singaporeans√¢¬Ä¬ô needs, we have since introduced Standard and Escalating plans.
Basic Plan is kept as a legacy plan. Monthly payouts under the Basic Plan start lower than Standard Plan and will get progressively lower [when your combined CPF balances eventually fall below $60,000](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-does-the-cpf-life-basic-plan-work-).
If you're on the Basic Plan or other legacy plans such as the Balanced, Plus and Income plans, you can consider switching to the√Ç¬†[Escalating Plan](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-does-the-cpf-life-escalating-plan-work-)√Ç¬†to benefit from increasing payouts or the [Standard Plan](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-does-the-cpf-life-standard-plan-work-) to enjoy higher and level payouts. You can√Ç¬†[make the switch](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ChangeLifePlan/CoverPage) before age 80.
Do note that once you have switched to the Standard or Escalating Plan, you'll not be able to switch back to a legacy plan.']

question: Can I switch from a legacy plan (Basic, Balanced, Plus or Income Plan) to the Standard or Escalating Plan?
answer:
['If you're currently on any of the legacy plans such as the Basic, Balanced, Plus, or Income plans, you have the option to switch to either the√Ç¬†[Escalating Plan](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-does-the-cpf-life-escalating-plan-work-)√Ç¬†or [Standard Plan](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-does-the-cpf-life-standard-plan-work-).√Ç¬†Switching to the Escalating Plan will give you increasing payouts over time, while switching to the Standard Plan will give you higher and level payouts. You can√Ç¬†[make the switch](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ChangeLifePlan/CoverPage) before age 80.
It is also important to note that once you have switched to the Standard or Escalating Plan, you cannot switch back to a legacy plan.']

question: How are the CPF LIFE premium and payout for each plan calculated?
What are CPF LIFE premiums invested in and are the investments safe?
answer: ['CPF LIFE premiums are invested in Special Singapore Government Securities (SSGS), which are safe instruments because they are issued and guaranteed by the Government, and shielded from financial market fluctuations.']

question: What happens to the interest earned on my CPF LIFE premium?
answer:
['The interest earned on your CPF LIFE premium benefits you in two ways:
1. It is factored into your monthly payouts and you receive a higher payout from the start.
2. The interest accumulated on your CPF LIFE premium, along with the premiums of other CPF LIFE members, ensures that you can continue receiving payouts no matter how long you live, even if your CPF LIFE premium balance is depleted.']

question: When do I have to choose my CPF LIFE plan?
answer:
['You only need to [choose your CPF LIFE plan](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/cpflifeapp) when you wish to start receiving your CPF LIFE monthly payouts.
If you're [automatically included in CPF LIFE](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/do-i-have-to-join-cpf-life-),√Ç¬†you can start your payouts any time from 65 to 70 and choose your CPF LIFE plan then. If you do not choose a plan before 70, you will be automatically placed on the CPF LIFE Standard Plan and your payouts will start at 70.
If you're not automatically included in CPF LIFE, you can choose your CPF LIFE plan when you wish to join the scheme, any time from 65 to one month before you turn 80.
To help you better decide on which CPF LIFE plan is suitable for you, find out more details on√Ç¬†[what are the CPF LIFE plans available](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/what-are-the-cpf-life-plans-available).']

question: Can I change my plan type after I have joined CPF LIFE?
answer:
['You can request to change your CPF LIFE plan type within 30 days from the date of your first\* policy letter. This request can be made via [My Mailbox](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/mymailbox).
A [change of CPF LIFE plan type](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ChangeLifePlan/CoverPage) beyond the 30 days grace period is possible if
1. You are on a legacy plan (Basic, Balanced, Plus or Income Plan) and wish to change to the Escalating Plan or Standard Plan; or
2. You wish to change from Standard to Escalating Plan
Otherwise, changing of CPF LIFE plan after the grace period is not allowed as this will affect the payouts of other members on the scheme.
As changing of CPF LIFE plan is irrevocable, we encourage you to consider your options carefully.
*\*The letter sent to you when your original CPF LIFE plan was first issued.*']

question: When will I receive my CPF LIFE monthly payouts?
answer:
['You will receive the monthly payouts in your bank account generally on the 2nd or 3rd day of each month, if your bank supports Fast And Secure Transfer (FAST).
Otherwise, you will receive your payouts later, via Inter-bank GIRO (IBG).
If you wish to receive your monthly payouts earlier, you can update your bank account with CPFB to a FAST bank account via the [CPF website](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/changebankaccount).']

question: How can I update my bank details for my CPF LIFE monthly payouts?
answer:
['You can update your bank details for your CPF LIFE monthly payouts via the [CPF website](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/changebankaccount).
It is important to ensure that your bank account details are updated promptly to avoid any delay or disruption in receiving your CPF LIFE payouts.']

question: I have not joined CPF LIFE yet. How can I increase my future monthly payouts?
answer:
['There are a few ways to increase your future CPF LIFE monthly payouts:
1. **Topping up your Retirement Account (RA) under the Retirement Sum Topping-up Scheme** You or your loved ones can make cash top-ups and CPF transfers to your RA up to the current Enhanced Retirement Sum by logging in with your Singpass at [cpf.gov.sg/rstuform](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/tools-and-services/forms-e-applications/cash-top-ups-and-cpf-transfers-for-retirement). The more RA savings you use to join CPF LIFE, the higher your monthly payouts.
2. **Deferring your monthly payouts (up to 70)** Consider deferring your payouts if you are still working or have other income. Your monthly payouts will increase by up to 7% for each year that you defer. If you choose to defer until 70, you could get up to a 35% increase in payouts as your CPF savings would have accumulated more interest. You will only need to decide your CPF LIFE plan when you wish to start your payouts. The latest age you can start your payouts is 70, after which they will automatically begin.
3. **Monetising your property** If you own a property, you can also consider [monetising your property](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-can-i-monetise-my-property-and-which-option-is-suitable-for-me).
You can use the [CPF LIFE Estimator](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/lifeestimator) to find out how much RA savings you need, or the age you need to start your payouts to get your desired monthly payout.']

question: I have already joined CPF LIFE. How can I increase my monthly payouts?
answer:
['If you have already joined CPF LIFE, you can consider the following options to increase your monthly payouts:
1. **Using√Ç¬†your withdrawable CPF savings to increase your CPF LIFE premium** If you are born in 1958 or after, you can withdraw additional amount of up to 20% of your retirement savings from 65, which includes the first $5,000 that you can withdraw at any time from 55. If you are born in 1957, you can withdraw additional amount of up to 10% of your retirement savings from 65, as you can already withdraw up to 10% of your CPF savings from 55. You can use this√Ç¬†[withdrawable amount](/member/faq/retirement-income/retirement-withdrawals/how-much-cpf-savings-can-i-withdraw)√Ç¬†to increase your CPF LIFE premium. If you would like to do so, please write in to us via√Ç¬†[My Mailbox](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/mymailbox).
2. **Topping up and increase your CPF LIFE premium** You or your loved ones can make cash top-ups and CPF transfers to your Retirement Account (RA) up to the current Enhanced Retirement Sum by logging in with your Singpass at√Ç¬†[cpf.gov.sg/rstuform](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/tools-and-services/forms-e-applications/cash-top-ups-and-cpf-transfers-for-retirement). The more RA savings you use to join CPF LIFE, the higher your monthly payouts.
3. **Deferring your monthly payouts (up to 70)** Consider [deferring your payouts](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/can-i-still-defer-to-receive-higher-cpf-life-payouts) if you are still working or have other income. Your monthly payouts will increase by up to 7% for each year that you defer.
4. **Monetising your property** If you own a property, you can also consider [monetising your property](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-can-i-monetise-my-property-and-which-option-is-suitable-for-me).
If you wish to enquire on your revised payout, please write in to us via√Ç¬†[My Mailbox](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/mymailbox).']

question: I am going to start / I have started receiving my CPF LIFE monthly payouts. Can I still defer to receive higher payouts?
answer:
['The latest age that you can defer your CPF LIFE monthly payouts to is 70. Your monthly payouts will increase by up to 7% for each year of deferral.
**If you were born in 1957 or after:** You can use the **[Plan my monthly payouts](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/payout)** service to defer your payouts after 65, up to 70.
**If you were born before 1957:** You can use the **[Apply to Defer CPF LIFE Payout](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/deferlifepayout)** form to defer your payouts after 65, up to 70.']

question: Can I defer the start of my CPF LIFE monthly payouts beyond 70?
answer:
['The purpose of CPF savings is to provide members with monthly payouts in their retirement. Hence, you will have to start your CPF LIFE monthly payouts, including any Additional Monthly Payouts (AMP), latest by age 70.
We understand that some members think of their savings in CPF as an investment to enjoy the interest rates. If you have no immediate need for the payouts, you can consider investing them outside the CPF system. Do note that investing outside of CPF carries a certain level of risk and requires careful consideration.']

question: How will my CPF LIFE monthly payouts be adjusted and when will payout adjustments be effected?
answer:
['We want to ensure that your CPF LIFE monthly payouts are sustainable over the long term. As such, our actuarial consultant reviews them yearly and take into account the following:
* Deviations in mortality experience. If more people live longer than expected in the long term, the monthly payouts might be lower, and vice versa.
* Deviations in interest rates. If interest rates are higher than expected, the monthly payouts might be higher, and vice versa.
The revised payout, if any, will take effect every July of the year. We will notify you if there is an adjustment in your monthly payouts. Rest assured that any changes are expected to be small and gradual.']

question: How will changes to my Retirement Account affect my CPF LIFE monthly payouts?
answer:
['Changes to your Retirement Account (RA) can affect your monthly payouts. This is because your RA savings is [one of the factors in determining your CPF LIFE payouts](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-are-the-cpf-life-premium-and-payout-for-each-plan-calculated).
Outflow from your RA, such as lump sum withdrawals will reduce your CPF LIFE monthly payouts. On the other hand, inflows to your RA, such as top-ups, interest earned or refunds from selling your property or investments will be automatically used to increase your CPF LIFE premium, and allow you to receive higher monthly payouts.
If you have started receiving your CPF LIFE monthly payouts, we will inform you of any revision in your monthly payouts in the following month after the outflow/inflow of funds.']

question: Can I cancel my CPF LIFE plan after I have joined?
answer:
['You can only cancel your CPF LIFE plan if you are withdrawing your CPF savings for the following reasons.
* You have a reduced life expectancy due to a medical condition, as certified by an [accredited doctor](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/retirement-withdrawals/who-is-considered-an-accredited-doctor). Severe medical conditions that cause you to be permanently unfit for work or to lack mental capacity permanently can also be considered.
* You have [closed your CPF account](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/account-services/account-closure/closing-your-account-when-you-leave-singapore) as you are a non-Singapore Citizen or a non-Permanent Resident.
* You are fully exempted from setting aside the retirement sum in your Retirement Account because you are receiving a monthly pension / annuity payout.
Upon cancellation of your CPF LIFE plan, you will receive a refund of your CPF LIFE premium balance. If your CPF LIFE premium has been fully paid to you as monthly payouts, there will be no remaining premium balance to refund.']

question: I have joined CPF LIFE, what will happen when I pass away?
answer: ['When you pass away, we will pay your CPF LIFE premium balance (if any) together with any remaining CPF savings to your beneficiaries.']

question: Who are my beneficiaries?
answer: ['Your beneficiaries are persons whom you have nominated to receive your CPF savings, including any CPF LIFE premium balance, when you pass away. If you have not nominated anyone to receive your savings, we will pay them to the Public Trustee for distribution according to the intestacy laws. You can [make a nomination online](https://cpf.gov.sg/makecpfnom) by logging in to *my cpf*Online Services with your Singpass.']

question: How much CPF LIFE premium balance will my beneficiaries receive when I pass away?
answer:
['After you pass away, your beneficiaries will receive your CPF LIFE premium balance, which is the total CPF LIFE premium that you have paid minus the total payouts you have received, together with any remaining CPF savings.
For example, if you paid a CPF LIFE premium of $200,000 and pass away after receiving a monthly payout of $1,000 for 10 months, we will pay your CPF LIFE premium balance of $190,000 (i.e. $200,000 - [$1,000 x 10 months]), together with any CPF savings to your beneficiaries.
On the other hand, if you pass away before receiving any payouts, we will pay your CPF LIFE premium balance of $200,000, together with any remaining CPF savings to your beneficiaries.']

question: What is the minimum monthly payout I have to receive from my pension/annuity to withdraw all my retirement savings?
answer:
['The [minimum monthly payout](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/member/faq/retirement-income/documents/payout-benchmark.pdf) you have to meet for you to [withdraw all your retirement savings](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-do-i-apply-to-withdraw-my-retirement-savings-if-i-have-a) depends on your birth date and gender. This is computed with reference to the monthly payouts you can receive under CPF LIFE Standard plan with your [Full Retirement Sum](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-are-the-retirement-sums-applicable-to-me-).
If your pension/annuity monthly payout is less than the minimum monthly payout, you can withdraw a partial amount of your retirement savings.']

question: When can I start my monthly payouts if I am not on CPF LIFE?
answer:
['You have the flexibility to decide when to start your monthly payouts, anytime from 65 to 70.
Note: If you are born before 1958, you are past your√Ç¬†[**payout eligibility age**](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-is-my-payout-eligibility-age)√Ç¬†and can choose to√Ç¬†[**start your payouts**](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-do-i-start-my-monthly-payouts-if-i-am-not-on-cpf-life)√Ç¬†anytime.']

question: How and when will I receive my monthly payouts?
answer:
['You will receive the monthly payouts in your bank account generally on the 2nd or 3rd day of each month, if your bank supports Fast And Secure Transfer (FAST).
Otherwise, you will receive your payouts later, via Interbank GIRO (IBG).
If you wish to receive your monthly payouts earlier, you can update your bank account with CPFB to a FAST bank account by submitting an [online application](https://cpf.gov.sg/startnonlifepayout), or by following the steps below:
1. Login to *my cpf* digital services with your Singpass
2. Click on My Requests > Retirement > √¢¬Ä¬úStart Monthly Payouts√¢¬Ä¬ù']

question: When is the latest age to start my monthly payouts?
answer:
['The latest age you can start your monthly payouts is 70.
Find out [what happens if we don√¢¬Ä¬ôt receive your instruction to start your monthly payouts](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/what-happens-if-i-am-not-on-cpf-life-and-i-do-not-start-my-monthly-payouts-by-70).']

question: Can I defer my monthly payouts beyond 70 if I am not on CPF LIFE?
answer:
['You will not be able to defer your monthly payouts beyond 70. The purpose of your retirement savings is to provide you with a stream of retirement income.
If you have no immediate need for the payouts, you can consider investing them outside the CPF system. Do note that investing outside of CPF carries a certain level of risk and requires careful consideration.']

question: How are monthly payouts calculated if I am not on CPF LIFE?
answer:
['If you're not on CPF LIFE, your monthly payouts are calculated to last for up to 20 years based on the current base interest rate of 4% per annum of your Retirement Account savings.
As Singaporeans live longer, more than half of those aged 65 today are expected to live more than 20 years. To protect you against the risk of outliving your payouts, the√Ç¬†[**extra interest**](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/growing-your-savings/earning-higher-returns/earning-attractive-interest)√Ç¬†paid by the Government (up to 2% per year) on your retirement savings is used to extend your payouts beyond 20 years, up to age 90\* or another five years, whichever ends later.
![How are monthly payouts calculated if I am not on CPF LIFE?](/content/dam/web/member/faq/retirement-income/images/Payout_Calculation.jpg)\*Up to age 90, or another five years, whichever ends later.√Ç¬†You can use the [payout estimator](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/RetirementSumSchemePayoutEstimator/RetirementSumSchemePayoutEstimator) to estimate the amount of monthly payouts you can receive from your retirement savings.']

question: How much monthly payout will I receive if I am not on CPF LIFE?
answer:
['If you've reached age 65, you can check your monthly payout in your [Retirement dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/retirement).
If you√¢¬Ä¬ôve not reached age 65, we will notify you three months before your 65th birthday regarding your options on your monthly payout and the decisions that you need to make.
Do note that if you are born in 1958 or after, you may be [automatically included](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/do-i-have-to-join-cpf-life-) in [CPF LIFE](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/cpf-life), which provides lifelong monthly payouts.']

question: Do I really need to be concerned about outliving my monthly payouts?
answer:
['Yes, you should be concerned about outliving your monthly payouts. As we cannot predict how long we will live, it is not easy to determine how much we need for our retirement. For example, spending too much might result in you not having enough, while saving too much could end up depriving yourself.
With advancements in technology and healthcare, we can expect to live longer than previous generations. However, many people tend to underestimate their lifespan and fail to save enough for their retirement.
To enjoy peace of mind in your retirement years, you can join CPF LIFE which provides monthly payouts no matter how long you live.
On the other hand, if you are not on CPF LIFE, your monthly payouts will stop once your CPF savings run out.']

question: What is the latest age to join CPF LIFE?
answer:
['If you√¢¬Ä¬ôre [not automatically included in CPF LIFE](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/do-i-have-to-join-cpf-life-), the latest age to join CPF LIFE is one month before you turn 80.
If you√¢¬Ä¬ôre automatically included in CPF LIFE, find out [when you have to choose your CPF LIFE plan](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/when-do-i-have-to-choose-my-cpf-life-plan).']

question: I am under a legacy plan (i.e. Basic, Balanced, Plus or Income Plan). What are my options if I want to switch my CPF LIFE plan and/or increase my monthly payouts?
answer:
['If you are on a legacy plan (i.e. Basic, Balanced, Plus or Income Plan), your monthly payouts will get progressively lower when your combined CPF balances eventually fall below $60,000. To avoid a drop in your monthly payouts in the future, you may consider [switching your CPF LIFE plan to Escalating or Standard Plan](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/can-i-switch-from-a-legacy-plan-to-standard-or-escalating-plan)√Ç¬†before age 80.
To increase your monthly payouts, you may consider doing the following:
* Use your withdrawable CPF savings to increase your CPF LIFE premium
* Make a cash top-up and/or CPF transfers into your Retirement Account
* Defer your monthly payouts (up to 70)
[Find out more about these options to increase your monthly payouts.](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/i-have-already-joined-cpf-life-how-can-i-increase-my-payouts)
If you want to know how your monthly payout will change if you switch your CPF LIFE plan and/or enhance your payouts, please book a [1-to-1 CPF Retirement Planning Service (CRPS) consultation](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/crpsappt) with us at any CPF Service Centres. Personalised information will be used to explain your monthly payout options so you can make an informed decision.']

question: What other sources of lifelong income must I have to withdraw my retirement savings?
answer:
['You can withdraw your retirement savings if you have a pension or annuity that provides you with monthly payouts for life. The amount of retirement savings you can withdraw will depend on the monthly payout you receive from your pension/annuity. [Find out more](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/what-is-the-minimum-monthly-payout-i-have-to-receive).
Pension
Generally, only pensions under the Singapore government will be considered.
Annuity
Only annuities (bought using cash or [CPF Investment Scheme](/member/growing-your-savings/earning-higher-returns/investing-your-cpf-savings/cpf-investment-scheme-options))√Ç¬†administered by Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) registered insurance companies and satisfy the stringent requirements under the Insurance Act will be considered. You must also be the policyholder and sole insured person of the annuity policy.
Investment instruments such as endowments and bonds are not allowed as they generally do not provide the policyholder with a lifelong income.']

question: I am reaching age 65. How do I start my monthly payouts?
answer:
['We will send you a notification three months before your 65th birthday, to guide you to explore [your monthly payouts options](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/monthly-payout-options-upon-reaching-65) and submit your instructions through the [Plan my monthly payouts](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-much-payouts-i-can-receive) service.
If you do not submit any instructions on your payouts by 70, your monthly payouts will automatically start in the month of your 70th birthday.']

question: I am reaching age 65 and received an email message from CPFB on my monthly payout details. How do I verify that the email is legitimate?
answer:
['To verify whether the email you received from us is legitimate, please check the following:
1. The sender's email address is correctly spelt and ends with @cpf.gov.sg or @e.cpf.gov.sg.
2. You are directed only to our official CPF website (link starting with cpf.gov.sg)
3. The content of the email: Look for any signs of phishing attempts, such as urgent language, threats, or requests for personal information.
The Board will only send digital notifications to the email address registered in our records. You may verify or update your contact details in√Ç¬†[CPF Account settings](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/account-settings)√Ç¬†with your Singpass.']

question: How can I submit my instructions on CPF LIFE monthly payouts?
answer:
['You may refer to the steps below to submit instructions on your CPF LIFE monthly payouts.
**For members born in 1957 and after**
You can submit your instructions via the [**Plan my monthly payouts**](https://cpf.gov.sg/payout) service.
**For members born before 1957**
**If you are not on CPF LIFE**
You can apply to join CPF LIFE at any time from 65 to one month before you reach 80 via the [**Apply for CPF LIFE**](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/cpflifeapp)√Ç¬†form.
**If you are an existing CPF LIFE member**
There is no need to apply to start your monthly payouts. Payouts will automatically be paid to you from the month you turn 65. If you wish to defer payouts, you can do so via the [**Apply to Defer CPF LIFE Payout**](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/deferlifepayout) form. Please note that you may only defer your CPF LIFE monthly payout up to age 70.
If you deferred your payout previously and would like to start your payout now, you can do so via the [**Apply to Start CPF LIFE Payout**](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/startlifepayout) form.']

question: I am unsure whether to start my monthly payouts now. How can I find out how much monthly payouts I can receive?
answer:
['You may use the [Plan my monthly payouts](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/payout) service√Ç¬†to find out more about your monthly payout details, provide your payout instructions and confirm your bank account details.
The Plan my monthly payouts service is available to you three months before you reach 65, and is for members born in 1957 and after.
With this service, you can find out your estimated monthly payouts when you:
* start at 65 or defer to a later age
* join CPF LIFE and/or
* use more of your CPF savings to increase your monthly payouts.']

question: How do I start my monthly payouts if I am not on CPF LIFE?
answer:
['**If you are born before 1957 and turned 65 before 2022:**
* To start payout:
1. Login to *my cpf* Online Services with your Singpass
2. Click on My requests > Retirement > "[Start Monthly Payouts](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/startnonlifepayout)"
* To join CPF LIFE:
1. Login to√Ç¬†*my cpf*√Ç¬†Online Services with your Singpass
2. Click on My requests > CPF LIFE > "[Apply for CPF LIFE](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/cpflifeapp)"
**If you are born in 1957 and after, and turned/are turning 65 in 2022 and after:**
1. Login to√Ç¬†*my cpf*√Ç¬†Online Services with your Singpass
2. Click on My Requests > Retirement > √¢¬Ä¬ú[Plan my monthly payouts](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/payout)√¢¬Ä¬ù']

question: Why should I consider monetising my property?
answer: ['You can consider this option if your property can be an additional source of retirement income. It is an option to consider if your CPF and personal savings are not enough to provide you with your desired monthly payouts in retirement. Find out more about the [different ways you could monetise your property](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-can-i-monetise-my-property-and-which-option-is-suitable-for-me).']

question: How can I monetise my property and which option is suitable for me?
answer:
['Here are some ways to monetise your property for additional source of retirement income:
**Silver Housing Bonus scheme** If you own an HDB flat and do not mind moving to a 3-room or smaller flat, you can consider the [Silver Housing Bonus scheme](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/what-is-the-silver-housing-bonus-scheme).
**Lease Buyback Scheme** If you prefer to live in your existing flat, you can consider the [Lease Buyback Scheme](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/what-is-the-lease-buyback-scheme).
**Rental** You can consider renting out a spare bedroom, or your entire property if you have an alternative accommodation. If you own a HDB flat, find out more about√Ç¬†[renting out a flat/bedroom](https://www.hdb.gov.sg/residential/renting-out-a-flat-bedroom).
If you own a private property, consider speaking to a financial institution or advisor to learn about the different products available in the market that can help you monetise your property and supplement your retirement income, while ageing in place.
As with all important financial decisions, it is important to understand the nature of the monetisation option, and assess your situation and retirement needs before deciding if the option is suitable for you.']

question: What is the Silver Housing Bonus scheme?
answer:
['The Silver Housing Bonus scheme (SHB) enables you to supplement your retirement income if you're moving to a 3-room or smaller flat.
By participating in the SHB scheme, net proceeds from selling your current flat will be used to top up your Retirement Account to boost your lifelong monthly payouts under [CPF LIFE](/member/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/cpf-life). You can also enjoy a cash bonus of up to $30,000.
Find out more about the [SHB scheme](https://www.hdb.gov.sg/residential/living-in-an-hdb-flat/for-our-seniors/monetising-your-flat-for-retirement/silver-housing-bonus).']

question: How do I apply for Lease Buyback Scheme or Silver Housing Bonus scheme?
answer:
['You can apply for the Lease Buyback Scheme or the Silver Housing Bonus scheme through HDB:
[Silver Housing Bonus scheme](https://www.hdb.gov.sg/residential/living-in-an-hdb-flat/for-our-seniors/monetising-your-flat-for-retirement/silver-housing-bonus)
[Lease Buyback Scheme](https://www.hdb.gov.sg/residential/living-in-an-hdb-flat/for-our-seniors/monetising-your-flat-for-retirement/lease-buyback-scheme)']

question: I live in a private property. Are there ways for me to monetise my property without selling my home?
answer:
['You can consider speaking with your financial institution or advisor on the available products in the market that allow you to monetise your private property to supplement your retirement income while ageing in place.
As with all important financial decision, it is important to understand the nature of the product and assess your own risk tolerance and retirement needs/preferences before deciding if the monetisation option is suitable for you.
Alternatively, you can consider renting out a spare bedroom, or your entire property if you have an alternative accommodation. This can provide you with an additional source of retirement income.']

question: I am currently receiving Additional Monthly Payout (AMP). Will my AMP be converted to higher CPF LIFE monthly payouts automatically?
answer:
['You will continue to receive Additional Monthly Payout (AMP).
Starting from November 2021, any new Retirement Account inflows will automatically be used to increase your CPF LIFE premium. This will allow you to receive higher monthly payouts for life, providing you with greater financial security during your retirement years.']

question: Currently CPF Board does not allow members above 80 to join CPF LIFE.  What will happen to my Retirement Account inflows after I turn 80?
answer:
['If you are currently under CPF LIFE, your Retirement Account inflows will automatically be used to increase your CPF LIFE premium even after 80, so that you will receive higher CPF LIFE monthly payouts for life.
The cut-off age of 80 only applies to members who are not under CPF LIFE.']

question: How will the auto-disbursement of Special Account and Ordinary Account savings benefit me?
answer: ['To minimise any disruption to your payouts, we will automatically disburse your Special Account and Ordinary Account savings when your Retirement Account savings are depleted.']

question: Can I choose to retain my Special Account and Ordinary Account savings instead of automatically disbursing them as payouts when my Retirement Account is depleted?
answer:
['No, you cannot choose to retain your Special Account (SA) and Ordinary Account (OA) savings. CPF is designed to provide you with an income in retirement. The auto-disbursement of your SA and OA savings ensures that you continue to receive a steady stream of retirement income even when your Retirement Account has been depleted.
With the monthly payouts, you also have greater flexibility for your daily living expenses or your monthly housing instalments (if applicable).
If you wish to retain the monies in your CPF accounts to earn higher interest, you should consider options outside of CPF.']

question: Is there an age limit for existing CPF LIFE members to increase their CPF LIFE premium?
answer: ['Existing CPF LIFE members can increase their CPF LIFE premium at any age which will help to increase their CPF LIFE monthly payouts.']

question: What happens if I am not on CPF LIFE and I do not start my monthly payouts by 70?
answer:
['We will start your payouts automatically when:
i) you turn 70 or
ii) [from your next birth month\* if you are already above the age of 70.](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/why-is-there-a-need-to-auto-start-the-monthly-payouts-for-members-who-are-born-before-1948)
We will pay them into your bank account in our records. If you have not given us your bank account details before, we will write to you to ask for your bank account details nearer to-date.
\*Applicable only for members born before 1948']

question: Can I opt out of receiving CPF monthly payouts and withdraw all my retirement savings?
answer: ['Yes, you can opt out of receiving CPF monthly payouts and√Ç¬†[**withdraw your retirement savings in full if you have other sources of lifelong income.**](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/cpf-life/exemption-from-cpf-life) Alternatively, you can consider enjoying lifelong payouts under CPF LIFE, in addition to your other sources of retirement income. Find out [why CPF LIFE is attractive](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-is-cpf-life-attractive-).']

question: How can I increase or prolong my monthly payouts if I am not on CPF LIFE?
answer:
['If you're not on CPF LIFE, you have a few options to increase or prolong your monthly payouts from your retirement savings:
1. Boost your retirement savings by [making cash top-ups or CPF](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/tools-and-services/forms-e-applications/cash-top-ups-and-cpf-transfers-for-retirement) transfers.
2.√Ç¬†[Start your monthly payouts later](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/mymailbox) (up to age 70) to increase your retirement savings with [interest rates](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/growing-your-savings/earning-higher-returns/earning-attractive-interest) of up to 6% per annum.
Note: If you've started your payouts, you can request to defer them until age 70 to give your savings more time to grow. If not, you do not need to submit a request.
3.√Ç¬†[Join CPF LIFE](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/cpflifeapp) to receive monthly payouts for as long as you live.']

question: How long does it take to process my application to start my monthly payouts?
answer:
['Please refer to the table for our normal processing time for applications to start monthly payouts from retirement savings:
| | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Service** | **For** | **Normal Processing Time** |
| [Plan my monthly payouts](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/payout) | Members born in 1957 and after | Three days to two weeks\*√Ç¬†*\* Your application may take up to two weeks to process if you have submitted multiple payout decisions via the Plan my monthly payouts service.* |
| [Start Monthly Payouts](https://cpf.gov.sg/startnonlifepayout) | Members born before 1957 | To start your monthly payouts next month, apply **at least three working days before end of the month**. |
Monthly payouts will start at 65 or within one month (whichever is later) after your instruction is processed.']

question: Why am I not allowed to use my bank account with a non-local bank to receive my monthly payouts?
answer:
['We can better protect you from scams by only accepting bank accounts from banks that offer automated verification. This ensures payments are made only to your bank account.
Currently, only POSB, DBS, OCBC and UOB have such an arrangement with us. We'd be happy to work with other banks to set up similar arrangements.']

question: How do I change my bank details for my monthly payouts?
answer:
['You can update your bank account for your monthly payouts by submitting an [online application](http://cpf.gov.sg/startnonlifepayout)√Ç¬†or by following these steps:
1. Login to *my cpf* digital services with your Singpass
2. Click on My Requests > Retirement > √¢¬Ä¬úStart Monthly Payouts√¢¬Ä¬ù']

question: I am not on CPF LIFE. How will my monthly payouts be adjusted if there are changes to my retirement savings?
answer: ['We will review your payouts monthly to take into account the changes to your retirement savings. Your payouts will be revised in the following month after the inflows or outflows are made to your retirement savings.']

question: How much can I withdraw if my pension/annuity monthly payout is less than the minimum monthly payout?
answer:
['If your pension/annuity monthly payout is less than the√Ç¬†[minimum monthly payout](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/member/faq/retirement-income/documents/payout-benchmark.pdf), you will be able to withdraw a partial amount of your retirement savings.
Your remaining retirement savings will be streamed out as√Ç¬†[monthly payouts](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/cpf-life)√Ç¬†to complement the monthly payouts you receive from your pension/annuity.']

question: Can I still make top-ups or receive top-ups to my retirement savings if I have withdrawn my savings using my pension/annuity?
answer: ['No, you cannot top up or receive top-ups to your retirement savings if you have already withdrawn your retirement savings using your pension/annuity. However, you can top up your retirement savings if you choose to join [CPF LIFE](/member/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/cpf-life).']

question: What happens if I surrender my pension/annuity after I have withdrawn my savings?
answer:
['If you surrender your pension/annuity after you have withdrawn your retirement savings, the surrender value of your pension/annuity, up to [your Full Retirement Sum](/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-are-the-retirement-sums-applicable-to-me-)√Ç¬†with accrued interest, will be refunded to your Retirement Account. Any excess amount will be refunded to you in cash.
It's important to note that you will not be able to use your annuity to obtain a loan. This is because we need to ensure that we can refund the surrender value when you surrender your annuity.']

question: When can I apply to withdraw my retirement savings if I have a pension/annuity?
answer:
['You can apply for withdrawal of your CPF retirement savings if you have a pension/annuity, as long as you are:
i. 55 or above; and
ii. currently receiving lifelong monthly payouts from your pension/annuity.']

question: How do I apply to withdraw my retirement savings if I have a pension/annuity?
answer:
['The procedure to withdraw your retirement savings using your pension/annuity depends on the country which you are residing in.
If you are residing in Singapore
[Make an appointment](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/Appointments/CreateAppointmentCover) to visit our CPF Service Centre and bring along:
i. Identity card for verification; and
ii. Documents of your pension/annuity
| | |
| --- | --- |
| **Type of lifelong income** | **Documents required** |
| Pension | Original pension letter bearing the Pension Office√¢¬Ä¬ôs letterhead, dated within six months, stating:i. you are receiving a guaranteed monthly pension amount;ii. the pension is payable for life;iii. the conditions which the pension may be revoked or terminated; andiv. amount of guaranteed lifelong monthly pension you are receiving.√Ç¬†You can visit the [Pensioner√¢¬Ä¬ôs Portal](https://www.agd.gov.sg/pensioners-vendors/pensioners/pensioners-portal) for more information. |
| Annuity | Original annuity policy(ies) and its terms and conditions bought using cash or CPF monies under CPF Investment Schemes. The annuity must be issued by MAS-registered providers and satisfy the stringent requirements under the Insurance Act.√Ç¬†Upon the approval of your application, we will request the insurance company to include the following endorsement in the policy contract:√Ç¬†*"Where the Annuitant cancels the policy for cash surrender value, the Company is required to refund to the Annuitant√¢¬Ä¬ôs CPF account an amount determined by the Board in accordance with the laws in force at the time the refund is required to be made.**Where a loan of the cash surrender of the policy is granted to the Annuitant, the Board shall have a first charge on the policy to secure the refund to the Annuitant√¢¬Ä¬ôs CPF account of an amount determined by the Board in accordance with the laws in force at the time the refund is required to be made. The Company shall not be entitled to use part or all of any annuity payment to repay the outstanding loan."*√Ç¬†You will need to submit a certified true copy of the endorsement to us. We√¢¬Ä¬ôll process your application after receiving the endorsement. |
If you are residing overseas
Write in via [My Mailbox](http://cpf.gov.sg/mymailbox)√Ç¬†with the supporting documents for our assessment.
Upon our assessment, please bring along your identity card for verification, the supporting document(s) stated above, and the application form to any of the [Singapore Overseas Missions](/member/faq/account-services/distribution-of-cpf-savings-upon-member-s-passing/what-is-a-singapore-overseas-mission-).']

question: Can I use multiple policies to withdraw my retirement savings if I have more than one source of lifelong income?
answer: ['Yes, if you have multiple policies that provide you with lifelong income, you can use them to apply for withdrawal of your retirement savings.']

question: How long does it take to process my application to withdraw my retirement savings using my pension/annuity?
answer: ['We will pay your retirement savings to your bank account generally within seven working days after we have received all necessary information. However, we may require more time if we need additional information/documents such as outstanding tax liabilities with IRAS.']

question: How can I check the status of my application to withdraw my retirement savings using my pension/annuity?
answer: ['If your application to withdraw your retirement savings using your pension/annuity is approved, you will receive a withdrawal advice by mail after we have processed the payment to your bank account. Alternatively, you can also check the status of your application by logging on to [cpf.gov.sg](https://www.cpf.gov.sg).']

question: I am reaching 65. What are the monthly payout options that I can choose from?
answer:
['You have the flexibility to start receiving your monthly payouts anytime between 65 and 70. However, if you do not submit any instructions on your payouts by the time you turn 70, your monthly payouts will automatically start on your birthday month.
In addition, you may have some CPF savings which are withdrawable for your immediate needs. Instead of withdrawing the amount in a lump sum, you can consider the following:
1. Use the withdrawable amount (in part or in full) to increase your monthly payouts; or
2. Retain the savings in your CPF account to earn interest, and withdraw them when the need arises.
If you choose to retain your CPF savings, any [additional withdrawable savings from 65](/member/faq/retirement-income/retirement-withdrawals/how-much-cpf-savings-can-i-withdraw) in your Retirement Account will be transferred to your Ordinary Account in the month you start your payouts, for your future withdrawal.
Eligible members can use the [Plan my monthly payouts](/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-much-payouts-i-can-receive) service to√Ç¬†find out more about their monthly payout details, provide their payout instructions and confirm their bank account details.']

question: How will I benefit from this change?
answer:
['If you√Ç¬†are not on CPF LIFE and are currently receiving monthly payouts of less than $350, you will receive at least $350 from June 2023 onwards.
If you are already receiving monthly payouts of $350 or more, there will be no change to your payouts. There is also no change to the CPF withdrawal rules.']

question: With the increased minimum payouts, what happens when I have exhausted my CPF savings?
answer:
['Your payouts will continue until your CPF savings are exhausted.
While CPF is important for seniors to fund their retirement, many seniors are likely able to rely on a combination of other means such as private savings and family support.
The Government will also continue to provide targeted support for seniors with less resources to rely on in retirement. The [Silver Support Scheme](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/sss), which covers a third of all seniors aged 65 and above, provides quarterly cash supplements of up to $900 to eligible seniors. Other forms of Government support such as the [Workfare Income Supplement](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/wis) and [ComCare](http://www.msf.gov.sg/what-we-do/comcare) are also available to provide financial resources to eligible seniors in their retirement.']

question: When will I receive the new monthly payout of at least $350?
answer:
['You will start receiving your new monthly payout of at least $350 from June 2023 onwards.
However, if you do not have enough CPF balances to receive the monthly payout of at least $350, you will receive your monthly payout when your Retirement, Special and Ordinary accounts savings add up to at least $350 or once a year in January.']

question: Can I request not to increase my monthly payouts to $350?
answer:
['No, you cannot receive monthly payouts of less than $350.
Your CPF savings are meant to provide you with a steady stream of retirement income. Raising the minimum payouts help members who are not on CPF LIFE to receive meaningful payout, so as to better cope with the increasing cost of living.
If you have no immediate need for the payouts, you can consider investing them outside the CPF system. Do note that investing outside of CPF carries a certain level of risk and requires careful consideration.']

question: Do I need to submit a request for the minimum payout of $350 to be paid?
answer: ['No, you do not need to submit any request. The minimum payout of $350 will automatically apply to you if you are not on CPF LIFE and are currently receiving monthly payouts of less than $350. This will take effect from 1 June 2023.']

question: Will I be affected by this policy change if I am on CPF LIFE and receiving payouts of less than $350 per month?
answer:
['No, you will not be affected by this policy change if you are on CPF LIFE.
If you wish to increase your payouts, you can consider [making top-ups (via cash or CPF transfer)](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/tools-and-services/forms-e-applications/cash-top-ups-and-cpf-transfers-for-retirement) to your Retirement Account (RA).
Find out more [how you can increase your monthly payouts if you are on CPF LIFE](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/i-have-already-joined-cpf-life-how-can-i-increase-my-payouts).']

question: When will the change to annuitise non-withdrawable Ordinary and Special Account savings as CPF LIFE monthly payout take effect?
answer: ['The change will take effect from October 2023 to make it easier for existing CPF LIFE members to enjoy higher monthly payouts. It is applicable to existing CPF LIFE members who have not met their Full Retirement Sum.']

question: Will I receive notification in advance about my Ordinary and Special Account savings being annuitised and streamed out as higher monthly CPF LIFE payouts?
answer: ['If you are among those whose Ordinary and Special Account savings will be annuitised, we will send you a notification about one month before the annuitisation.']

question: Why is there a need to annuitise the non-withdrawable Ordinary and Special Account savings as CPF LIFE monthly payout?
answer:
['If you have not met your Full Retirement Sum, your Ordinary and Special Account (OSA) savings may not be withdrawn as a lump sum and are meant to be streamed out as monthly payouts.
Currently, if you are an existing CPF LIFE member, you need to instruct us to annuitise your OSA savings to receive higher CPF LIFE monthly payouts.
With the changes from October 2023, we will automate this process and make it easier for you to enjoy higher CPF LIFE monthly payouts.']

question: How will the annuitisation of the non-withdrawable Ordinary and Special Account savings as CPF LIFE monthly payout affect my eligibility to withdraw or service the housing commitments that are financed by my Ordinary Account savings?
answer:
['Your eligibility to make lump sum withdrawals from your Ordinary and Special Account (OSA) will not be affected. This is because only the OSA savings that cannot be withdrawn in a lump sum will be annuitised to provide you with higher CPF LIFE monthly payouts.
The purpose of your CPF savings is to provide you with a stream of retirement income. If you still have housing obligations after starting your monthly payouts, you can use your monthly payouts or monies in excess of your Full Retirement Sum after this transfer to meet your housing needs.']

question: Can I request to retain the non-withdrawable Ordinary and Special Account savings in the CPF accounts and not annuitise and stream them out as CPF LIFE monthly payouts?
answer: ['The non-withdrawable Ordinary and Special Account savings cannot be taken out in a lump sum and are meant to be streamed out as monthly payouts in the first place.']

question: Can I request to retain the Ordinary and Special Account savings in the CPF accounts for future housing needs?
answer:
['No, your CPF savings are meant to provide you with a stream of retirement income.
If you still have housing obligations after starting your monthly payouts, you can use your monthly payouts or monies in excess of your Full Retirement Sum after this transfer to meet your housing needs.']

question: How much will my CPF LIFE monthly payouts increase after my non-withdrawable Ordinary and Special Account savings are annuitised?
answer: ['After your non-withdrawable Ordinary and Special Account savings are successfully annuitised, we will send you a notification to inform you of the revised CPF LIFE monthly payout.']

question: Why is there a need to auto-start the monthly payouts for members who are born before 1948?
answer:
['CPF savings are designed to provide members with monthly payouts during retirement. In the past, many members did not remember to start their monthly payouts. Hence, a change was introduced in 2018 which automatically starts monthly payouts for members who turn 70 (born in 1948 or later). This change was welcomed as it allowed members to enjoy CPF savings without any extra hassle.
It is timely to extend this automatic commencement of monthly payouts to members born before 1948.']

question: Can I choose to retain my savings in CPF instead of having them automatically disbursed as payouts?
answer:
['As the purpose of CPF savings is to provide you with monthly payouts in your retirement, you cannot retain your savings in CPF indefinitely. We will automatically disburse your CPF savings as monthly payouts latest by age 70.
If you have no immediate need for the payouts, you can consider investing them outside the CPF system. Do note that investing outside of CPF carries a certain level of risk and requires careful consideration.']

question: Can I start to receive my monthly payouts before it auto-starts?
answer: ['Yes, you can start your monthly payouts any time by submitting a [request](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/startnonlifepayout).']

question: What do I need to do after I have received the notification on the auto-start of my monthly payouts?
answer:
['You don√¢¬Ä¬ôt need to do anything if you have already provided a bank account to receive your monthly payouts. Your payouts will be credited into the designated bank account automatically.
However, if you don't have a bank account or would like to change the bank account that you've previously provided, you can submit a [request](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/ChangeBankAccount).']

question: I am the appointed deputy/donee for my next of kin. How can I receive monthly payouts on behalf of my next of kin?
answer:
['If you are the appointed deputy or donee, you may request to receive your next of kin√¢¬Ä¬ôs monthly payouts on his behalf.
You can [make an appointment](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/contact-us/visit-us)√Ç¬†to visit any of our CPF Service Centres and bring along the following original documents:
1. A Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) or Order of Court;
2. A medical report from an accredited doctor stating that the member lacks mental capacity permanently;
3. Your NRIC/Foreign Passport; and
4. Trust bank account passbook/statement.
Please ensure that you have all the necessary documents so that you can receive your loved one√¢¬Ä¬ôs payouts smoothly.']

question: I am on CPF LIFE even though I am a foreigner. Can I continue to keep my CPF LIFE Plan?
answer:
['The purpose of the CPF system is to help Singapore Citizens (SC) and Permanent Residents (PR) retire with peace of mind. In line with this, CPF members who are not SC or PR will have to close their CPF accounts and their participation in CPF schemes such as CPF LIFE will cease.
You may close your CPF account and transfer your CPF savings to your bank account at any time. If you do not do so by 31 March 2024, your CPF account will be automatically closed on 1 April 2024.
Find out more about [closing your CPF accounts](/member/faq/account-services/account-closure-for-non-singapore-citizens-and-non-permanent-residents).']

question: What is the Retirement Account for?
answer:
['The savings in your Retirement Account (RA) is meant to provide you with payouts in retirement. You can start your payouts anytime from your [payout eligibility age](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-is-my-payout-eligibility-age) of 65.
Find out [how your RA is created when you turn 55](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-happens-to-my-cpf-savings-when-i-turn-55).']

question: What happens to my CPF savings when I turn 55?
answer:
['When you turn 55, we will transfer your CPF savings, up to your Full Retirement Sum (FRS), to create your Retirement Account (RA). The savings in your RA is meant to provide you with payouts in retirement.√Ç¬†[Your Special Account (SA) savings will be transferred first](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/why-are-my-special-account-savings-transferred-before), followed by your Ordinary Account (OA) savings.
If you do not have enough RA savings to make up the FRS and have used your CPF savings for your property, we will use your CPF savings withdrawn for your property (including accrued interest) to meet your FRS. The maximum amount that can be used is your Basic Retirement Sum. When you sell your property, you will have to restore your RA up to your FRS with your sales proceeds.
[It is not mandatory for you to top up your RA if you are unable to set aside your FRS.](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/do-i-need-to-top-up-my-retirement-account-and-will-i-receive) However, you may wish to [top up your RA](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/growing-your-savings/saving-more-with-cpf/top-up-to-enjoy-higher-retirement-payouts) for higher monthly payouts. You can also enjoy [tax relief](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/growing-your-savings/retirement-sum-topping-up-scheme/what-are-the-conditions-for-me-to-enjoy-tax-relief-) for cash top-ups up to the FRS.
***Did you know?*** *You can use the* [*CPF LIFE Estimator*](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/LifeEstimator/LifeEstimator) *to estimate how much you need to top up to reach your desired monthly payouts.*
If you are born in 1958 or after and wish to start your monthly payouts, there will be√Ç¬†[another transfer of your SA and/or OA savings, up to your FRS, to your RA](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/why-is-there-another-transfer-of-monies-from-sa-oa-to-ra-before), if you have not met your FRS. This transfer allows you to receive higher monthly payouts.
Find out more about the√Ç¬†[retirement sums](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-are-the-retirement-sums-brs-frs-ers-).']

question: In setting aside the Full Retirement Sum in my Retirement Account, why are my Special Account savings transferred before my Ordinary Account savings?
answer:
['The savings in your Special Account (SA) are meant for your retirement needs, while your Ordinary Account (OA) savings can be used to meet other shorter-term expenditure needs such as housing. Hence, when you turn 55, SA savings are first transferred to your Retirement Account (RA) to help you set aside the retirement sum which will eventually be streamed out as monthly payouts when you reach your [payout eligibility age](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-is-my-payout-eligibility-age).
***Did you know?****If you wish to earn higher* [*interest*](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/growing-your-savings/earning-higher-returns/earning-attractive-interest) *on your OA savings (which earns at least 2.5% interest per annum) and boost your monthly payouts, you can* [*make a CPF transfer*](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/tools-and-services/forms-e-applications/cash-top-ups-and-cpf-transfers-for-retirement) *to your RA (which earns at least 4% interest per annum), up to the current Enhanced Retirement Sum. Do note that for CPF transfers to RA, your SA savings (if any) will be transferred first followed by your OA savings.*']

question: Do I need to top up my Retirement Account and will I receive monthly payouts if I am unable to set aside my Full Retirement Sum?
answer:
['It is not mandatory for you to top up your Retirement Account (RA) if you are unable to [set aside your Full Retirement Sum (FRS)](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-happens-to-my-cpf-savings-when-i-turn-55). You can still receive monthly payouts anytime from your payout eligibility age, and the payout amount will be based on your RA savings.
However, you may wish to [top up your RA](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/growing-your-savings/saving-more-with-cpf/top-up-to-enjoy-higher-retirement-payouts) for higher monthly payouts. You can also enjoy [tax relief](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/growing-your-savings/retirement-sum-topping-up-scheme/what-are-the-conditions-for-me-to-enjoy-tax-relief-) for cash top-ups up to the FRS.
***Did you know?*** *You can use the*[*CPF LIFE Estimator*](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/LifeEstimator/LifeEstimator)*to estimate how much you need to top up to reach your desired monthly payouts.*
If you receive contributions, government grants or other refunds in your CPF accounts after 55, they will be transferred to your RA up to your FRS (or√Ç¬†[Basic Retirement Sum](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-are-the-retirement-sums-brs-frs-ers-)√Ç¬†if you own a property) on your next withdrawal.
If you are born in 1958 or after and wish to start your monthly payouts, there will be√Ç¬†[another transfer of your SA and/or OA savings, up to your FRS, to your RA](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/why-is-there-another-transfer-of-monies-from-sa-oa-to-ra-before), if you have not met your FRS. This transfer allows you to receive higher monthly payouts.']

question: Will my CPF savings withdrawn under the CPF Investment Scheme be used to make up my Full Retirement Sum when I turn 55?
answer:
['No, your CPF savings withdrawn under the CPF Investment Scheme will not be used to make up your [Full Retirement Sum (FRS)](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-are-the-retirement-sums-brs-frs-ers-). Your FRS is made up using your Special Account (SA) and Ordinary Account (OA) savings.
Find out√Ç¬†[**how your FRS is set aside when you turn 55**](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-happens-to-my-cpf-savings-when-i-turn-55).']

question: What are the retirement sums - Basic Retirement Sum (BRS), Full Retirement Sum (FRS) and Enhanced Retirement Sum (ERS)?
answer:
['Planning for your retirement is easier with the retirement sums √¢¬Ä¬ì Basic Retirement Sum (BRS), Full Retirement Sum (FRS), and Enhanced Retirement Sum (ERS). They provide a guide on the CPF savings you need to reach your [desired monthly payouts in retirement](/content/dam/web/member/retirement-income/documents/CPF_LIFE_Payout_Examples.pdf).
The BRS is meant to provide you with monthly payouts in retirement to cover basic living needs, excluding rental expenses.
The FRS is two times of BRS and can provide you with higher monthly payouts that also cover rental expenses. That is why when you turn 55, your CPF savings up to your FRS is set aside in your Retirement Account (RA) to provide you with monthly payouts in retirement.
If you own a property in Singapore with remaining lease that lasts you until you are 95 or older, you have the flexibility to meet your FRS with a mixture of property (up to half your FRS) and cash, and can apply to [withdraw part of your RA savings down to your BRS using your property](/member/faq/retirement-income/retirement-withdrawals/conditions-to-withdraw-part-of-ra-savings-using-my-property).
If you wish to receive even higher payouts for your desired retirement lifestyle, you can choose to set aside more by [making a top-up](/member/growing-your-savings/saving-more-with-cpf/top-up-to-enjoy-higher-retirement-payouts), up to the current ERS. The ERS is increased yearly for those who wish to receive higher payouts.
See what are the [retirement sums applicable to you](/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-are-the-retirement-sums-applicable-to-me-).
Ultimately, how much you set aside depends on your CPF balances and desired monthly payouts. It√¢¬Ä¬ôs important to plan ahead by assessing how much payouts you need to meet your expenses in retirement. Find out using the [CPF LIFE Estimator](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/lifeestimator).']

question: What are the retirement sums applicable to me?
answer:
['Your Basic Retirement Sum (BRS) and Full Retirement Sum (FRS) will be determined when you turn 55 and will remain the same for the rest of your life.
To help you better plan for your future, here are the retirement sums that are applicable to members who turn 55 from 2023 to 2027:
| | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **55th√Ç¬†birthday in the year of** | **Basic Retirement Sum (BRS)** | **Full Retirement Sum (FRS)****2 x BRS** |
| 2023 | $99,400 | $198,800 |
| 2024 | $102,900 | $205,800 |
| 2025 | $106,500 | $213,000 |
| 2026 | $110,200 | $220,400 |
| 2027 | $114,100 | $228,200 |
See the [Full Retirement Sums since 1995](/content/dam/web/member/retirement-income/documents/RetirementSum.pdf). You can also find out more [how the retirement sums are determined](/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/how-are-the-retirement-sums-determined-) and [why the retirement sums are increasing yearly](/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/why-are-the-retirement-sums-increasing-yearly).
For higher payouts, you can also [top up your Retirement Account](/member/growing-your-savings/saving-more-with-cpf/top-up-to-enjoy-higher-retirement-payouts) up to the current Enhanced Retirement Sum (ERS) if you are 55 and above. The current ERS for 2023 is $298,200.']

question: How are the Basic Retirement Sum and Full Retirement Sum determined for each cohort?
answer:
['The Basic Retirement Sum (BRS) takes reference from a person's expenditure from a lower-middle retiree household, according to the latest [Household Expenditure Survey (HES)](https://www.singstat.gov.sg/publications/households/household-expenditure-survey). It assumes that the member owns a property that lasts him up to 95 and he does not need to pay rent in retirement.
The Full Retirement Sum (FRS) is set at two times of the BRS.
The [BRS or FRS you need to set aside depends on when you turn 55](/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-are-the-retirement-sums-applicable-to-me-) and is fixed for the rest of your life.
Find out [why the retirement sums are adjusted yearly for successive cohorts](/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/why-are-the-retirement-sums-increasing-yearly).']

question: Does the interest earned on my retirement savings form part of the retirement sum that I am required to set aside at age 55?
answer: ['No, the interest earned on your retirement savings does not form part of the retirement sum that you are required to set aside at 55.']

question: Why are the retirement sums increasing yearly?
answer:
['The increase in retirement sums is due to the following:
1. **Increase in cost of living** As prices of goods and services rise over time, we will need to save more for retirement to ensure that our savings will still be sufficient to cover higher expenses in the future.
2. **Increase in life expectancy** As people are living longer, we will need more savings to last throughout our retirement.
3. **Increase in standard of living** As incomes increase over time, our basic retirement expectations and expenses will also naturally increase. Setting aside more savings allows us to receive higher monthly payouts to afford higher retirement expenses in future.
However, if you are already 55, the yearly increase won't affect you. The [retirement sum you need to set aside](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/web/sg/en/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-are-the-retirement-sums-applicable-to-me-.html) depends on when you turn 55 and is fixed for the rest of your life.
It's important to keep in mind that the amount needed for retirement has increased over the years. For example, if the Full Retirement Sum had remained unchanged from $30,000 when it was first introduced in 1987 (previously known as the Minimum Sum), it would only provide a monthly payout of about $300 today. This amount would not be enough to cover daily living expenses and rent.
Overall, the goal of increasing retirement savings is to help individuals build a financial foundation that will enable them to support themselves through retirement.']

question: How can I find more information to better understand the CPF rules which will affect me when I turn 55?
answer:
['You will receive a letter from CPF Board a few months before your 55th√Ç¬†birthday, providing you with more information.
The letter will give you details on how to make an appointment to attend the CPF Retirement Planning Service (CRPS), which is a one-to-one session where you will get personalised information about the CPF rules that will affect you when you turn 55.
If you prefer, you can also view your [personalised retirement planner online](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/CRPS), which is an available option starting from six months before your 55th birthday.
Finally, you can attend our [talks](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Seminar/MemberEvents) to learn more about planning for your retirement.']

question: What is my payout eligibility age?
answer:
['Your payout eligibility age is the age where you can start receiving your retirement monthly payouts.
If you were born in 1954 or later, your payout eligibility age is 65. This means that you can start receiving your monthly payouts any time between the ages of 65 and 70.
If you were born before 1954, the table below shows your payout eligibility age.
| | |
| --- | --- |
| **Year of birth** | **Payout eligibility age** |
| Before 1944 | 60 |
| 1944 to 1949 | 62 |
| 1950 and 1951 | 63 |
| 1952 and 1953 | 64 |
Please note that√Ç¬†[your payout eligibility age is not linked to your retirement or re-employment age](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/is-the-payout-eligibility-age-linked-to-the-retirement-re-employ). You can still receive payouts from your payout eligibility age even if the retirement age or re-employment age is raised.']

question: Is the payout eligibility age linked to the retirement/re-employment ages?
answer:
['The CPF payout eligibility age is not linked to either the retirement or the re-employment age.
Today, you can start your CPF payouts at any time from age 65. There is no link to the current retirement age of 63\* or the re-employment age of 68. Even if the retirement age and the re-employment age are raised, the CPF payout eligibility age would remain unchanged.
*\* Retirement age was raised from 62 to 63 and re-employment age from 67 to 68 from 1 July 2022.*
For more information:
Information on the√Ç¬†[CPF Payout Eligibility Age](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-is-my-payout-eligibility-age)
Information on the√Ç¬†[retirement age](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/retirement)
Information on√Ç¬†[re-employment age](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/re-employment)
(source:√Ç¬†[Factually](https://www.gov.sg/article/is-the-cpf-payout-eligibility-age-linked-to-the-retirement-re-employment-ages)√Ç¬†website)']

question: Why doesn't CPF Board start my payouts automatically at 65?
answer:
['We understand that every member has unique retirement goals and needs. That's why we don't assume that everyone wants to start their payouts at 65. In fact, starting payouts later can have benefits on your retirement savings.
Your CPF savings earn [interest rates\* of up to 6% per annum](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/growing-your-savings/earning-higher-returns/earning-attractive-interest), which means the longer you wait to start your payouts, the more your retirement savings will grow. This increase in savings will result in higher monthly payouts under CPF LIFE.
Starting payouts automatically at 65 means denying members these benefits.
That's why we always encourage our members to instruct us when they want to start their payouts. You are the best judge of your own circumstances to make an informed decision.
***Here's an interesting fact:**√Ç¬†For every year that you defer your [CPF LIFE](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/cpf-life) payouts, your monthly payout increases by up to 7%. This means that if you defer for 5 years, your monthly payout could increase by up to 35%. Hence take your time, weigh your options, and make the decision that's best for you and your retirement goals.*
\* Based on the interest rate floor of 4% per annum on Special/Retirement Account.']

question: How long will my monthly payouts last if I am not on CPF LIFE?
answer:
['If you are not automatically included in√Ç¬†[**CPF LIFE**](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/cpf-life)√Ç¬†and did not√Ç¬†[**opt to join CPF LIFE**](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/how-can-i-submit-my-instructions-on-cpflife-monthly-payouts)√Ç¬†to enjoy lifelong payouts, you will receive monthly payouts which will stop when your CPF savings run out. Your monthly payouts are calculated to last you up to 20 years, with the extra interest earned on your retirement savings helping to extend the payout duration up to 90 years old.
Find out [**why you should be concerned about outliving your savings**](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/retirement-income/monthly-payouts/i-am-concerned-about-outliving-my-cpf-savings--what-are-my-optio).']

question: Why is there another transfer of monies from my Special Account (SA) and/or Ordinary Account (OA) to my Retirement Account (RA) before I start my monthly payouts?
answer:
['As Singaporeans are now working longer, CPF contributions made after age 55 become an essential part of their retirement savings.
