question: Can MediSave be used for a deceased member's last hospitalisation bill?
answer:
['The deceased member's MediSave can be used fully, without being subjected to the existing MediSave withdrawal limits to pay the last medical bill, if the member has passed away during his hospitalisation.
If the deceased member had not signed the Medical Claims Authorisation Form (MCAF) before his death, his spouse, parent or child aged 21 and above, or Donee/Deputy appointed under the Mental Capacity Act, has to quickly sign the MCAF on behalf of the deceased member to authorise the hospital to submit a claim, before the deceased's CPF funds including MediSave, is disbursed to his nominees or the Public Trustee Office.
If the deceased member does not have a spouse, parent or child aged 21 and above, or Donee/Deputy, a next of kin (NOK) who has been taking care of the deceased can inform the hospital of his intention to sign the MCAF on behalf of the deceased member. The hospital will then seek approval from MOH on behalf of the NOK, before the NOK signs the MCAF.
If more than one MediSave Account (MA) holders had authorised the use of their MediSave to pay the medical bill of the deceased member before his demise and one of the MA belongs to the deceased, the protocol on the use of MediSave from the various accounts are as follows:
1. The deceased member's MediSave will be used first to pay off the last medical bill without being subject to the MediSave withdrawal limits.
2. If the deceased member's MediSave is not sufficient to pay the last medical bill, the MediSave from the other account holder(s) can then be used, provided that the MediSave withdrawn from the deceased member's account does not exceed the MediSave withdrawal limits.
View example whereby the MediSave Withdrawal Limit has been reached
Patient passes away with a final hospitalisation bill of $5,000, after staying in the hospital for five days without surgical treatment.
Patient's MediSave Balance = $4,000
$4,000 can be paid from the patient's MediSave and the remainder of $1,000 must be paid by cash. The patient's spouse, child, parent, grandchild or sibling's MediSave cannot be used as the maximum MediSave Withdrawal Limit of $2,300 has been reached.
View example whereby MediSave Withdrawal Limit has not been reached
Patient passes away with a final hospitalisation bill of $5,000, after staying in the hospital for five days without surgical treatment.
Patient's MediSave Balance = $1,500
$1,500 can be paid from the patient's MediSave and a further $800 can be paid from the MediSave of the patient's spouse, child, parent, grandchild or sibling, up to the maximum MediSave Withdrawal Limit of $2,300. The remaining $2,700 of the bill needs to be settled with cash.']

question: Why are MediSave withdrawal limits imposed?
answer: ['MediSave is a national medical savings account to help Singaporeans pay for their hospitalisation expenses, especially in old age. In line with this, MediSave withdrawal limits are set to strike a balance between helping Singaporeans afford the co-payment for their ongoing treatments, and ensuring that they have sufficient savings for their future healthcare needs.']

question: What is the healthcare hotline?
answer: ['For healthcare-related enquires, you may call us at 1800 222 3399 /65 6222 3399 (overseas) from Mondays to Fridays, 8.30am to 5.30pm (GMT+8, excluding public holidays). Alternatively, you can also [write to us.](http://cpf.gov.sg/writetous)']

question: How will the revised chemotherapy benefits under MediShield Life and MediSave impact my claims from 1 September 2022?
answer:
['Each cancer drug treatment on the Cancer Drug List (CDL) will have its own MediShield Life claim limits and MediSave withdrawal limits.
You may refer to the [MOH website](https://go.gov.sg/moh-cancerdruglist) for the list of cancer drug treatments that are claimable under MediShield Life and MediSave, and their respective claim and withdrawal limits. Please also consult your doctor if you wish to find out whether the treatment that you are currently undergoing is on the list.
The CDL will only come into effect for Integrated Shield Plans (IPs) on 1 April 2023. If you have an IP, you will continue to be covered under your current policy terms until it is renewed on or after 1 April 2023.
For example, if your IP is up for renewal on 1 November 2023, the CDL and its revised limits will only apply then. Insurers may decide to cover treatments beyond the CDL under their riders, though the extent of coverage may vary. Your insurer should inform you of the details of your IP and rider coverage by end 2022.']

question: Does the Cancer Drug List also apply to inpatient cancer drug treatments under MediShield Life and MediSave?
answer:
['No, inpatient cancer drug treatments are currently covered separately under the inpatient claim limits, together with other costs incurred during the inpatient stay.
The MediShield Life inpatient daily ward and treatment charges claim limit is $1,000 per day for the first two days and $800 per day for the third and subsequent days of normal ward stay. The MediSave inpatient daily hospital charges withdrawal limit is $550 for the first two days and $400 for the third and subsequent days of the ward stay.']

question: How are claim limits for MediShield Life and MediSave determined when more than one cancer drug is used in the treatment?
answer:
['Patients who need more than one cancer drug treatment on the Cancer Drug List (CDL) in a month may claim up to the higher of the MediShield Life, MediSave and Integrated Shield Plan (IPs) claim limits applicable for the individual treatments.
For example, if a patient uses both Treatments **X** (MediShield Life claim limit of $2,000 & MediSave withdrawal limit of $600) and **Y** (MediShield Life claim limit of $1,000 & MediSave withdrawal limit of $600) in a month, the patient may claim no more than $2,000 from MediShield Life and withdraw no more than $600 from MediSave in that month.
Please consult your doctor if you wish to clarify the claim limit that will apply for your treatment.']

question: If my treatment is not on the Cancer Drug List (CDL), will I still be covered under MediShield Life and MediSave?
answer:
['MediShield Life and MediSave will only cover treatments on the Cancer Drug List (CDL) from 1 September 2022.
For Integrated Shield Plans (IPs), the CDL will only come into effect from 1 April 2023 onwards, when an existing policy is renewed, or a new policy is purchased. If you have an IP that is being renewed between 1 April 2023 and 30 September 2023, and are on a course of cancer drug treatment as of 31 March 2023, insurers have committed to preserve your current IP coverage until 30 September 2023.
Riders will cover treatments beyond the CDL, though the extent of coverage may vary. Your insurer should inform you of the details of your IP and rider coverage by end 2022.']

question: What if I need a treatment which is not on the Cancer Drug List (CDL), or is on the CDL but unsubsidised, and I cannot afford the treatment without insurance?
answer:
['We encourage you to discuss with your doctor if there are suitable alternative treatments on the Cancer Drug List (CDL) that are subsidised and covered by insurance. However, if switching treatments is not feasible, there is support to help you if you face difficulty affording your treatment.
If you are a subsidised patient, you can approach a Medical Social Worker (MSW) in your public healthcare institution (PHI) for financial assistance such as MediFund. If you are a private patient, you can approach your doctor to refer you to a PHI for subsidised care. The PHI√¢¬Ä¬ôs medical team will review your treatment plan and provide financial counselling (e.g., eligibility for subsidies) before you decide whether to transfer.
To help existing patients during this transition, MOH will provide additional financial support for all PHI patients without an Integrated Shield Plan (IP), and who had started treatments that are unsubsidised or not on the CDL before 1 September 2022. Insurers, on their part, will continue their current coverage until 30 September 2023 for patients with IP that are being renewed between 1 April 2023 and 30 September 2023, and who are on a course of cancer drug treatment as of 31 March 2023.']

question: What is the MediSave Grant for Newborns?
answer:
['The MediSave Grant for Newborns is a grant given to all Singapore Citizen newborns in the child√¢¬Ä¬ôs MediSave Account. Parents can use it to help defray their child√¢¬Ä¬ôs healthcare expenses, such as MediShield Life premiums, recommended childhood vaccinations, hospitalisation, and approved outpatient treatments.
For more information on the MediSave Grant for Newborns, please visit [madeforfamilies.gov.sg](https://www.madeforfamilies.gov.sg/support-measures/raising-your-child/healthcare/medisave-grant-for-newborns).']

question: I am making a reimbursement claim from my insurer/employer for my medical bills. Is it compulsory for me to provide a hardcopy healthcare payments and claims statement to them?
answer: ['CPF Board does not require any documents from your insurer or employer to process the reimbursement. You need not provide hardcopy healthcare payments and claims statement to make a reimbursement claim. If your insurer or employer requires such a statement, they should accept a digital copy.']

question: Can I make a one-time authorisation to use my MediSave for my loved one√¢¬Ä¬ôs medical expenses in different Medical Institutions without signing a new form at each Medical Institution?
answer: ['You will need to authorise the use of your MediSave for your loved one√¢¬Ä¬ôs medical expenses by signing the Medical Claims Authorisation Form (Single Institution) at each Medical Institution. This is to reduce the likelihood that your MediSave is used for subsequent treatments at the same institution and/or other institutions without your knowledge.']

question: What is the Basic Healthcare Sum?
answer:
['![4 things Singaporeans should know about the Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS)](/content/dam/web/member/healthcare/images/BHS%20infographic_May2023.jpg)
The Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS) is the estimated savings you need in your MediSave Account√Ç¬†for your basic subsidised healthcare needs in old age.
For CPF members below age 65,√Ç¬†the BHS will be adjusted annually to keep pace with the expected growth in MediSave use by the elderly. This ensures that the BHS will stay relevant for each cohort when they arrive at retirement age.
Once CPF members reach age 65, their BHS will be fixed for the rest of their lives.√Ç¬†**For CPF members aged below 65 in 2023** The prevailing BHS is $68,500, and will be adjusted yearly. **For CPF members who turn 65 in 2023** The cohort BHS is $68,500 and it will remain fixed for the rest of their lives. The following table summarises the BHS for respective cohorts aged 65 and above in 2023:
| **Age in 2023** | **Year when cohort turned age 65** | **Cohort BHS****(fixed for life)** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 65 | 2023 | $68,500 |
| 66 | 2022 | $66,000 |
| 67 | 2021 | $63,000 |
| 68 | 2020 | $60,000 |
| 69 | 2019 | $57,200 |
| 70 | 2018 | $54,500 |
| 71 | 2017 | $52,000 |
| 72 and above | 2016 or earlier | $49,800 |']

question: Is there a maximum amount that I can save in my MediSave Account?
answer:
['You can save up to the prevailing Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS) in your MediSave Account if you have not turned age 65. The BHS from 1 January 2023 is $68,500 for all CPF members aged 65 years old and below in 2023. The BHS applicable to you will be adjusted yearly to account for increasing life expectancy and healthcare costs until the year you turn age 65. For instance, if you are aged 65 in 2023, the BHS that is applicable to you will be $68,500 for the rest of your life. The following table summarises the BHS for respective cohorts aged 65 and above in 2023:
| | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Age in 2023** | **Year when cohort turned age 65** | **Cohort BHS****(fixed for life)** |
| 65 | 2023 | $68,500 |
| 66 | 2022 | $66,000 |
| 67 | 2021 | $63,000 |
| 68 | 2020 | $60,000 |
| 69 | 2019 | $57,200 |
| 70 | 2018 | $54,500 |
| 71 | 2017 | $52,000 |
| 72√Ç¬†and above | 2016 or earlier | $49,800 |']

question: If I work after age 65, do I still need to contribute to my MediSave Account?
answer: ['As long as you continue to work, you will need to contribute to your MediSave Account (MA). The contributions will accumulate in your MA up to the Basic Healthcare Sum. Your MediSave savings will help you with your medical expenses during retirement.']

question: How is the Basic Healthcare Sum determined?
answer: ['The Basic Healthcare Sum is an estimate of your likely medical expenses from age 65 onwards. It is determined based on past trends in MediSave use by the elderly. It is meant to cater for your own basic subsidised healthcare expenses, as well as health insurance and long-term care insurance premiums during old age.']

question: Why is the Basic Healthcare Sum adjusted yearly?
answer:
['To ensure that the Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS) remains relevant for every cohort, we need to adjust it regularly to keep pace with the growth in MediSave use by the elderly, especially with rising healthcare costs and expansions in MediSave uses. The BHS is adjusted yearly for cohorts below age 65.
The BHS for each cohort is fixed from age 65 onwards and the same BHS applies to them for the rest of their lives. This will help members save enough for their basic subsidised healthcare needs in old age, while providing some certainty on the amount they need to set aside in their MediSave Account for their old age.']

question: What is the Basic Healthcare Sum when I turn 65 years old?
answer:
['![4 things Singaporeans should know about the Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS)](/content/dam/web/member/healthcare/images/BHS%20infographic_May2023.jpg)
For each cohort turning 65 years old, their applicable Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS) will be fixed at that year's amount for the rest of their life. For instance, if you are aged 65 in 2023, the BHS applicable to you is $68,500 and it will remain unchanged for the rest of your life.
The following table summarises the BHS for respective cohorts age 65 and above in 2023:
| | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Age in 2023** | **Year when cohort turned age 65** | **Cohort BHS****(fixed for life)** |
| 65 | 2023 | $68,500 |
| 66 | 2022 | $66,000 |
| 67 | 2021 | $63,000 |
| 68 | 2020 | $60,000 |
| 69 | 2019 | $57,200 |
| 70 | 2018 | $54,500 |
| 71 | 2017 | $52,000 |
| 72√Ç¬†and above | 2016 or earlier | $49,800 |']

question: Do I have to top up my MediSave Account to the Basic Healthcare Sum if I withdraw my CPF savings from age 55?
answer: ['You do not have to top up your MediSave Account when you withdraw your CPF savings from age 55.']

question: If I do not have the Basic Healthcare Sum when I reach my Payout Eligibility Age and I intend to start receiving my retirement payouts, do I need to top up my MediSave Account?
answer: ['You will not need to top up your MediSave Account to the Basic Healthcare Sum in order to receive your retirement payouts.']

question: As an employee, how much do I contribute to my MediSave Account (MA)?
answer: ['You√Ç¬†contribute a portion of your monthly CPF contributions to your MediSave Account√Ç¬†(MA) depending on your age group. You can refer to the [CPF contribution and allocation rates](/employer/employer-obligations/how-much-cpf-contributions-to-pay).']

question: I am a government pensioner receiving lifelong medical benefits. Is the Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS) applicable to me?
answer: ['The Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS) for government pensioners will differ from other CPF members in their cohort, depending on the coverage of their Post-Retirement Medical Benefits Schemes. The BHS is not applicable to government pensioners under the Fixed Amount on Ward Charges Scheme (FAW). The working contributions allocated to their MediSave Account and MediSave top-ups will be√Ç¬†channelled to their other CPF accounts. Pensioners under the Co-payment on Ward Charges Scheme (CPW) have a lower BHS than other CPF members in their cohort. Thereafter, any working contributions allocated to their MediSave and MediSave top-ups will be√Ç¬†channelled to their other CPF accounts. Pensioners under the Comprehensive Co-Payment Scheme (CCS) and MediSave-cum-Subsidised Outpatient (MSO) Scheme will have the same BHS as other CPF members in their cohort. Dependants of pensioners will have the same BHS as all other CPF members in their cohort.']

answer:

question: I have saved the Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS) in my MediSave Account. What happens to my MediSave savings above the BHS?
answer:
['MediSave Account savings above the Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS) will be√Ç¬†channelled to your CPF Special Account (SA) or Retirement Account (RA), depending on your age. The BHS cap and√Ç¬†channelling are designed to avoid over-saving in MediSave Account and to supplement the member√¢¬Ä¬ôs retirement savings, which can be withdrawn according to the CPF withdrawal rules. For members who have met the Full Retirement Sum (FRS)\* in their SA or RA, the savings in excess of the BHS will be√Ç¬†channelled to the Ordinary Account (OA). Savings in the OA can be used for other purposes such as housing repayment.

question: What happens if I do not have the Basic Healthcare Sum when I turn age 65?
answer: ['The Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS) is the estimated savings you will need for your basic subsidised healthcare expenses in old age. If you have less than the BHS at age 65, you are not required to top up your MediSave Account (MA). However,√Ç¬†you may choose to top up your MA using cash if you would like to build up your healthcare savings.']

question: If I am 66 years old in 2023 and my applicable Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS) is $66,000. Am I allowed to maintain more than my applicable BHS in my MediSave Account?
answer: ['You can only save up to your applicable Basic Healthcare Sum (BHS) in your MediSave Account (MA). The BHS is designed to be enough for your basic subsidised healthcare needs in old age and to avoid over-saving in the MA.']

question: Who needs to declare their health status under MediShield Life and CareShield Life?
answer:
['All new Permanent Resident (PR) applicants who have received In-Principle Approval for their Singapore Permanent Residence application are required to declare their health condition before proceeding to complete Formalities with ICA.
The health status declared will not affect their application for Singapore Permanent Residence.
All PR applicants, regardless of age, will be covered under MediShield Life. However, if the PR applicant is found to have serious pre-existing health conditions, he/she may be subjected to Additional Premiums of 30% for MediShield Life for 10 years, because of his/her higher health risks.
If the PR applicant is born in 1979 or earlier and obtained permanent residency status on or after 1 October 2020, he/she will be insured under CareShield Life if he/she is not severely disabled. *From 1 November 2021, PR applicants may be required to go for disability assessment under CareShield Life before being allowed to complete Formalities with ICA.*']

question: Do I need to apply for MediShield Life?
answer:
['Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents are automatically covered under MediShield Life. No application is required.
You will receive a cover issuance or renewal notification about one month before the start or renewal of your MediShield Life cover. The notification will inform you of your MediShield Life premiums and subsidies. If you have children under 21 years old, you will receive their MediShield Life notifications.']

question: Why does my child not have a MediShield Life cover to claim for the hospitalisation bills incurred before he passed away?
answer:
['We are sorry to hear of your child's demise. The MediShield Life claims can be submitted by the medical institution and will be processed if your child was a Singaporean/Singapore Permanent Resident.
Please contact us at 1800-222-3399 or [write to us](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/writetous) with your child's details.']

question: Who can pay for my MediShield Life premiums using their MediSave?
answer:
['Your spouse, parent, child, sibling or grandchild can help pay for your MediShield Life premiums using their MediSave.
Other family members (e.g. uncle, aunt, in-laws) can be your payer, if you meet the following conditions:
i. You are financially dependent on them,
and
ii. You and your spouse, parent, child, sibling or grandchild do not have sufficient MediSave for your MediShield Life premium
Your potential payer can take over paying your premium by submitting a [Change of Payer for MediShield Life Cover](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ChangePayerOfMediShieldCoverToMyself/Information).']

question: How long does it take to process applications relating to Healthcare?
answer:
['Please refer to the table below for the normal processing time of our various Healthcare services.
| | |
| --- | --- |
| **Service** | **Normal Processing Time** |
| Top up or voluntary contribution to MediSave Account (to pay MediShield Life Premiums) | **PayNow QR**: Generally processed almost instantly*Please note that payment via eNETS Debit has been discontinued from 23 April 2023.√Ç¬†[Find out more](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/electronic-services/why-is-payment-via-enets-discontinued).* |
| Change of Payer for MediShield Life Cover | **Online:** Within three working days |
| Stop Premium Payment for Dependant(s)' MediShield Life Cover |
| Make A Health Declaration for new Permanent Residents Applicant | **Online**: Within seven working days |
| Make A MediSave Claim | **Online**: Within three working days from the day we receive the claim from the medical institution |
| Make A MediShield Life Claim | **Online**: Within seven working days from the day we receive the claim from the medical institution/ insurer |
| Apply for MediSave/MediShield Life Reimbursement from Employers/Insurers | **Online:** Within five working days |
| Top Up My/My Loved Ones√¢¬Ä¬ô MediSave Account using CPF | **Online**: Immediate |']

question: What happens to my MediShield Life cover if my premium payer passed away?
answer: ['When your premium payer passed away, you will automatically be made the payer for your own MediShield Life cover. If you have insufficient MediSave, you will be notified to top up your MediSave or arrange for another family member to pay your premiums.']

question: How much can I claim from MediShield Life?
answer: ['MediShield Life has features such as claim limits, deductible and co-insurance. As such, the amount you can claim from MediShield Life for your bill can only be finalised after the Board processes the completed claim information submitted by the medical institution. In the meantime, you can use the [MediSave / MediShield Life Calculator](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/esvc/web/schemes/medisavecalculator/step1) to estimate the maximum amount you can withdraw from your MediSave and / or claim from MediShield Life.']

question: I intend to visit a clinic/hospital. How do I know if I can use MediShield Life coverage in that clinic/hospital?
answer:
['You can refer to this [list of medical institutions participating in MediShield Life](/content/dam/web/member/healthcare/documents/list-of-medical-institutions-medisave-medishield-life.pdf)√Ç¬†(PDF, 0.4MB).
To make a claim, please inform the staff handling your hospital admission or outpatient treatment that you wish to do so. The staff will submit your claim for you after your authorisation.']

question: I wish to check the amount claimed from my MediShield Life coverage for my recent hospitalisation. How can I do so?
answer:
['You can view the details of your MediShield Life claims (with transaction dates within the last 15 months from the date of enquiry) at [cpf.gov.sg/healthcare](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/healthcare):
1. Login to your Healthcare dashboard under *my cpf* digital services with your Singpass
2. Proceed to 'Latest healthcare payments and claims'
3. Select and view the details of your recent healthcare payments and claims. To view more claims, click on "View past 15 months".
4. Click on 'View details' under MediShield Life to view the claim details.']

question: For those with serious pre-existing conditions, why do they have to pay Additional Premiums for MediShield Life?
answer: ['Those with serious pre-existing conditions pay a higher MediShield Life premium as a reflection of the higher risks they pose to the pool and to fund part of their coverage. The Government will support most of the cost of extending MediShield Life coverage to all Singapore Residents.']

question: Can I change my address to receive MediShield Life letters to one not registered under ICA/OSCARS as I am concerned of missing letters or others opening my letters?
answer:
['MediShield Life letters are sent to your residential address registered with the Immigration & Checkpoints Authority (ICA)'s√Ç¬†One-Stop Change of Address Reporting Service (OSCARS). It is an offence for another person to wilfully open letters not addressed to them or to intentionally prevent letters from reaching the recipient under the Postal Services Act.
As part of our efforts to facilitate timelier and up-to-date notifications, you will start to receive MediShield Life notifications digitally in place of hardcopy letters from end 2021.
To receive timely notifications on MediShield Life matters, update your contact information with the following steps:
1. On the CPF homepage ([cpf.gov.sg](http://cpf.gov.sg)), click √¢¬Ä¬úLogin√¢¬Ä¬ù to log on to *my cpf* digital services with Singpass
2. Click the dropdown button from the top right panel and select "Account settings"
3. Select √¢¬Ä¬úUpdate√¢¬Ä¬ù to update your contact information. An SMS or email One-Time PIN (OTP) will be sent to your new mobile number or email address for verification before the changes take effect.
You can also log in to [Healthcare dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/dashboards/healthcare) to check your MediShield Life premiums and subsidies.']

question: What are the exclusions under the MediShield Life Scheme?
answer: ['The following treatment items, procedures, conditions, activities are not covered by MediShield Life and cannot be claimed (Applicable for admissions or treatments received on or after 1 March 2021): √¢¬Ä¬¢ Ambulance fees √¢¬Ä¬¢ Cosmetic surgery √¢¬Ä¬¢ Dental work (except due to accidental injuries) √¢¬Ä¬¢ Vaccination √¢¬Ä¬¢ Infertility, sub-fertility, assisted conception or any contraceptive operation, including their related complications √¢¬Ä¬¢ Sex change operations, including their related complications √¢¬Ä¬¢ Maternity charges (including Caesarean operations) or abortions, including their related complications, except treatments for serious complications related to pregnancy and childbirth √¢¬Ä¬¢ Treatment of injuries arising from the insured√¢¬Ä¬ôs criminal act √¢¬Ä¬¢ Treatment of injuries arising directly or indirectly from nuclear fallout, war and related risk √¢¬Ä¬¢ Treatment of injuries arising from direct participation in civil commotion, riot or strike √¢¬Ä¬¢ Expenses incurred after the 7th calendar day from being certified to be medically fit for discharge from inpatient treatment and assessed to have a feasible discharge option by a medical practitioner √¢¬Ä¬¢ Surgical interventions, including related complications, for the following rare congenital conditions which are severe and fatal by nature: Trisomy 13, Bilateral Renal Agenesis, Bart√¢¬Ä¬ôs Hydrops and Anencephaly √¢¬Ä¬¢ Optional items which are outside the scope of medical treatment √¢¬Ä¬¢ Overseas medical treatment √¢¬Ä¬¢ Private nursing charges √¢¬Ä¬¢ Purchase of kidney dialysis machines, iron-lung and other special appliances √¢¬Ä¬¢ Treatment which has received reimbursement from Workmen√¢¬Ä¬ôs Compensation and other forms of insurance coverage']

question: When will my MediShield Life coverage cease?
answer:
['Your MediShield Life cover will be terminated when you pass away or renounce your Singapore citizenship/Permanent Residency. Premiums for the unused period will be refunded to the premium payer√¢¬Ä¬ôs MediSave Account.
The payer may view the refunded premium (if any) at [Transaction history](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/statements/transaction-history)√Ç¬†statement under √¢¬Ä¬úContributions / Government Cash Grant / Government Top-up".']

question: What is the MediShield Life deductible?
answer:
['The deductible is the fixed amount payable by the insured each policy year before any payout from MediShield Life. The deductible is payable only once every policy year. The deductible paid can be accumulated if there is more than 1 claim in the policy year. The deductible ranges from $1,500 to $3,000 of the claimable amount depending on age and ward class as shown in the table below.
![MediShield Life deductible amount based on age range and ward class](/content/dam/web/member/healthcare/images/FAQ_MediShieldLifeDeductibleTable.jpg)']

question: What is the hotline for MediShield Life?
answer: ['For MediShield Life enquiries, contact us at 1800 222 3399 /65 6222 3399 (overseas) from Monday to Friday, 8.30am to 5.30pm (GMT8 / excluding public holidays). You can also [write to us](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/writetous).']

question: Who manages MediShield Life?
answer: ['MediShield√Ç¬†Life is administered by the√Ç¬†Central Provident Fund Board on behalf of√Ç¬†the Ministry of√Ç¬†Health.']

question: What are the hospitalisation and outpatient treatment benefits under MediShield Life?
answer:
['MediShield Life covers expenses incurred for hospitalisations and certain approved outpatient treatments, such as kidney dialysis, cancer drugs and radiotherapy for cancer.
The benefits under MediShield Life are shown in [these tables](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/healthcare-financing/medishield-life/what-medishield-life-covers-you-for).√Ç¬†They are designed to cover subsidised bills incurred for hospitalisations in Class B2/C wards and subsidised outpatient/day surgery treatments in public hospitals. Patients who seek non-subsidised treatments in Class A/B1/B2+ ward types in public hospitals or private hospitals will also be able to benefit from MediShield Life. However, as such non-subsidised bills are much higher, MediShield Life will cover a smaller portion of the bill.']

question: Can you explain the various premium components and computation for my MediShield Life Cover?
answer: ['You can refer to the [MediShield Life Information Booklet](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/member/healthcare/documents/InformationBookletForTheNewlyInsured.pdf) for more information on the premium components and computation for more information.']

question: What is the rationale for imposing Goods and Services Tax (GST) on MediShield Life premiums?
answer: ['We have a broad-based Goods and Services Tax (GST) system, with minimal exemptions as this approach helps to keep the GST rate relatively low. GST is a tax on domestic consumption of goods and services, and is payable on insurance contracts such as health, motor, and fire insurance. GST is therefore payable on premiums for MediShield Life.']

question: How do I take over my/my dependant(s)' MediShield Life premium payment or change payer?
answer:
['If you have a valid Singpass and sufficient funds in your MediSave Account, you can submit a√Ç¬†[Change of Payer for MediShield Life Cover](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ChangePayerOfMediShieldCoverToMyself/Information) request online to take over your/your dependant(s)' MediShield Life premium payment. Please refer to the steps below:
1. Go to the main page of [CPF website](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member)
2. Hover the cursor over to √¢¬Ä¬òCPF overview√¢¬Ä¬ô tab
3. Click on √¢¬Ä¬òForms√¢¬Ä¬ô hyperlink
4. Scroll down to √¢¬Ä¬òHealthcare Financing√¢¬Ä¬ô -> Select √¢¬Ä¬òMediShield Life√¢¬Ä¬ô -> under √¢¬Ä¬òChange of Payer for MediShield Life Cover√¢¬Ä¬ô, click on √¢¬Ä¬òApply Online√¢¬Ä¬ô
5. Singpass login is required
6. Click on √¢¬Ä¬òStart√¢¬Ä¬ô
7. Select the relevant option from
i. Myself
ii. My spouse, Parent, Child, Sibling or Grandparent
iii. My Other family member (s) such as Grandchild, Uncle, Aunt, In-Law
8. Click √¢¬Ä¬òNext√¢¬Ä¬ô
9. Input the √¢¬Ä¬òNRIC/CPF Account Number of Insured√¢¬Ä¬ô
10. Click √¢¬Ä¬òNext√¢¬Ä¬ô
11. Verify and declare the information is correct
12. Click √¢¬Ä¬òSubmit√¢¬Ä¬ô
If you need help with the request, contact us at 1800 222 3399 or [write to us](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/writetous).']

question: How can I find out more information about my dependants' MediShield Life covers?
answer:
['If you are the premium payer for your dependants' MediShield Life covers, you will be notified about a month before the renewal of their covers.
You can also log in to [Healthcare dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/dashboards/healthcare) 'Coverage and premium details' for information on your and/or your dependants' MediShield Life premiums and subsidies.
If you are not the payer of your dependant(s)' MediShield Life cover(s), they or their payers will need to log in to Healthcare dashboard to check their coverage and premium information.']

question: How can I find out if I am covered under a medical insurance plan?
answer:
['You are covered under MediShield Life if you are a Singaporean or Permanent Resident.
If you are covered under an Integrated Shield Plan (IP), your premium payer will be notified by your private insurer with details about your premiums and subsidies. You will receive applicable subsidies for the MediShield Life portion of your IP, if you meet the eligibility criteria.
You can log in to√Ç¬†[Healthcare dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/dashboards/healthcare) 'Coverage and premium details' to check the coverage and premium information for yourself and the dependant(s) you are paying premiums for.']

question: Why are MediShield Life premiums increasing as we get older?
answer:
['MediShield Life premiums are age-based (i.e. set in line with the risks for each age group).
With an ageing population, it is important to try to avoid intergenerational cross-subsidy, where the young has to pay for the old. If premiums were not priced by age, premiums will keep escalating as a growing number of elderly would need to be supported by a decreasing number of younger policyholders. This will impose an increasing burden on future generations and will not be sustainable. Instead, the Government provides subsidies and premium assistance to those who are unable to afford their premiums.
MediShield Life is different from the social insurance schemes in other countries, where the insurance contributions paid by the working population (e.g. through payroll taxes) are used to fund payouts, which are mostly used by the elderly or sick.']

question: What are the different MediShield Life premium subsidies and am I eligible for them?
answer:
['Log in to [Healthcare dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/dashboards/healthcare) 'Coverage and premium details' to check how much MediShield Life subsidies you can receive.
The Government offers the following subsidies to keep MediShield Life premiums affordable:
(a) Premium Subsidies for lower- to middle-income Singapore Residents (from 15% - 50% of premiums)
You will be assessed based on your household monthly income per person, annual value of residence and multiple property ownership. You can update your household information via the [Household Check e-Service](https://household-check.moh.gov.sg/)√Ç¬†to receive accurate premium subsidies.
(b) Pioneer Generation Subsidies for the Pioneer Generation (from 40% - 60% of premiums)
(c) Merdeka Generation Subsidies for the Merdeka Generation (from 5% - 10% of premiums)
(d) COVID-19 Subsidies for Singapore Citizens from 1 March 2021
This is a one-off COVID-19 subsidy for all Singapore Citizens for two years. The subsidy covers 70% of the net premium increase in the first year, followed by 30% of the net premium increase in the second year.
You may refer to the [MediShield Life Information Booklet](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/member/healthcare/documents/InformationBookletForTheNewlyInsured.pdf) for more information on the premium computation breakdown and details of the various components.']

question: How do I ensure I am notified of my MediShield Life premiums payable?
answer:
['To ensure that you are notified of your MediShield Life premiums payable, you can [update your residential address with ICA](https://www.ica.gov.sg/documents/ic/update_residential_address "update your residential address with ICA")√Ç¬†or at the nearest Neighbourhood Police Post. Once updated, participating government agencies and statutory boards like the CPF Board will be informed of the change in address through the One-Stop Change of Address Reporting Service (OSCARS).
You can also log in to [Healthcare dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/dashboards/healthcare)√Ç¬†'Coverage and premium details' for information on your and/or your dependants' MediShield Life premiums and subsidies.
You will receive digital notifications regarding your MediShield Life if you have registered your email address and mobile telephone number. For example,
a. If your email address is registered with CPF Board, you will be notified via email;
b. If your email address is not registered, but your mobile number is registered with CPF Board, you will be notified via WhatsApp or SMS depending on whether you have given consent to receive WhatsApp notifications;
c. Additionally, if you have installed the CPF Mobile app and enabled push notifications on your mobile phone, you will receive the CPF Mobile app push notification alerts. This is an additional notification alert.
You can log in to the CPF website and update your contact details under [Account Settings](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/account-settings).
If you do not have the CPF Mobile app, and did not register your email or mobile number with us, you will continue to receive hardcopy MediShield Life letters.']

question: Why did MediShield Life premiums have to increase in 2021 especially during the economic downturn?
answer:
['Premiums did not change for the first five years of MediShield Life, in line with the Government√¢¬Ä¬ôs earlier commitment. They need to be adjusted for the MediShield Life Fund to remain solvent and sustainable.
Premiums are priced by actuaries based on established actuarial principles, taking into account claims experience such as utilisation rates and cost of medical treatment, scheme benefits, among other factors.
There are three main reasons for the premium increases:
(1) The number of claimants has increased by about 30% and the annual payouts have increased by about 40% over the last four years. This accounted for the bulk of the premium increases i.e. about two-third;
(2) One-quarter of the premium increases is from refreshing the claim limits; and,
(3) The remaining 8% (or one-twelve) of the premium increases supports the benefit enhancements including those implemented since 2018, such as the extension of coverage to inpatient hospices and serious pregnancy complications.
The Government has committed up to $2.2 billion in premium subsidies and support over the next three years, to help Singapore Residents with their premiums.
Premium payment will be deferred until end December 2021, for those who have insufficient MediSave balances and are unable to pay their premiums due to the economic impact of COVID-19. If you need more help, you can also apply for [Additional Premium Support](https://www.moh.gov.sg/cost-financing/healthcare-schemes-subsidies/medishield-life/medishield-life-faqs#aps) for assistance with your premiums.']

question: Why is there an increase in premiums for everyone when most of us do not make claims from MediShield Life?
answer: ['MediShield Life is a health insurance scheme. It works by pooling financial resources from individuals in similar age cohorts to protect us from large hospital bills. Large hospital bills are rare, but the cost can be very high for those among us who fall seriously ill. Through MediShield Life, we can each pay a small amount yearly to not have to worry about a large bill if we are hospitalised.']

question: What are MediShield Life premium rebates?
answer:
['Members pay higher premiums during their working ages. In return, they enjoy premium rebates that reduce the premiums they pay after age 66.
The premium rebates you receive depend on how long you have been insured under the scheme. The earlier you join the scheme, the higher the premium rebates you will receive.
![MediShield Life premium rebate table](/content/dam/web/member/faq/healthcare-financing/images/Imagepremiumrebatetable1.png)![MediShield Life premium rebate table](/content/dam/web/member/faq/healthcare-financing/images/Imagepremiumrebatetable2.png)']

question: Can the premium recovery measures for MediShield Life be waived?
answer:
['Premium recovery measures cannot be waived as premiums must be paid timely. These measures are only imposed if the member defaults on premium payments repeatedly.
By paying on time, members do not cause others to shoulder their premium debts. You can write to us at [cpf.gov.sg/writetous](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/writetous)√Ç¬†if you need assistance with premium payments.']

question: How much MediSave can I use to pay for my family member's outstanding MediShield Life premiums?
answer: ['You can pay the insured√¢¬Ä¬ôs full outstanding MediShield Life premium using your MediSave.']

question: Can I claim tax relief for top-ups to my MediSave Account to pay MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['Top-ups to MediSave Account to pay MediShield Life premiums are considered voluntary contributions.
Eligible members will enjoy tax√Ç¬†relief. You can refer to the [IRAS website](https://www.iras.gov.sg/taxes/individual-income-tax/employees/deductions-for-individuals/personal-reliefs-and-tax-rebates/compulsory-and-voluntary-medisave-contributions#title2) for details on the eligibility criteria and amount of tax relief for voluntary MediSave contributions.']

question: How do I track the status of my request to pay for my dependant's MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['You can log in to [My Activities](http://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/MyActivity/MyActivity)√Ç¬†to track the status of your request to pay your dependant(s)' MediShield Life premiums.
For subsequent policy renewals, you will receive a premium notification about a month before the policy is renewed. You can also log in to√Ç¬†[Healthcare dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/dashboards/healthcare)√Ç¬†'Coverage and premium details' for information on your and/or your dependants' MediShield Life premiums and subsidies.']

question: How do I stop the MediShield Life premium payment for a dependant's premium?
answer:
['To stop paying MediShield Life premiums for your dependant(s), submit a√Ç¬†[Stop Premium Payment for Dependant(s)' MediShield Life Cover](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/StopPremiumPayment/StopPremiumInformation).√Ç¬†Your dependant(s) will take over paying his/her own premium from the next policy year.
If your child is under 21 years old, you will not be able to submit an online stop premium payment request unless the child has sufficient savings in his/her MediSave Account, or another family member takes over the premium payment. Parents are responsible for their children's MediShield Life premiums until they turn 21 years old. If you have been discharged from the liability of maintaining your child after your divorce, please [write to us](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/writetous) and provide the relevant court documents.
If you have questions, you can call us at 1800 222 3399 or [write to us](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/writetous).']

question: Am I paying double premiums for my MediShield Life and Integrated Shield Plan?
answer:
['You are not paying double premiums for your MediShield Life and Integrated Shield Plan (IP). There is also no duplicate coverage if you have purchased an IP through a private insurer. An IP consists of a MediShield Life component and an additional private insurance coverage component (please see below illustration).
![No double premiums for MediShield Life and IP](/content/dam/web/member/faq/healthcare-financing/images/Imagedoublepremiums.jpg)']

question: How was I identified to pay my family member's MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['You had previously used your MediSave to help pay the insured√¢¬Ä¬ôs medical expenses or health insurance premiums. To encourage family responsibility, we will notify family members that they can use their MediSave to help their family member with insufficient MediSave. This makes it convenient for the majority of members who wish to help their family members pay their MediShield Life premiums. To date, more than 90% of family members approached have accepted the arrangement.
Family members who are identified as potential payers will be notified one month before premium deduction takes place. You may reject this payment arrangement by submitting "[Stop Premium Payment for Dependant(s)' MediShield Life Cover](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/StopPremiumPayment/StopPremiumInformation)" or call us at 1800-222-3399.
You can later decide to pay for your family member's MediShield Life premiums by submitting a ["Change of Payer for MediShield Life Cover"](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ChangePayerOfMediShieldCoverToMyself/Information).
.']

question: Can I pay my MediShield Life premiums by instalment through GIRO?
answer:
['MediShield Life premiums are generally paid using MediSave. You can use your own or your family member's MediSave Account to pay your premiums.
GIRO instalment payment is only extended, as a concession, to members with insufficient MediSave to pay their premiums.']

question: How often do I have to pay MediShield Life premiums?
answer: ['MediShield Life cover is renewed yearly. Payers are notified about one month before cover renewal date and premiums are collected within a month after the cover is renewed.']

question: If there are insufficient funds in my MediSave Account, can I use my Ordinary Account/Special Account monies to pay for my MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['No, as savings in the Ordinary and Special accounts are primarily for your housing and retirement needs, while your MediSave is for your healthcare needs.
If you do not have sufficient MediSave to pay your premiums, you will be invited to apply for [Additional Premium Support (APS)](https://www.moh.gov.sg/cost-financing/healthcare-schemes-subsidies/medishield-life/medishield-life-faqs#aps).']

question: What if I am unable to pay for my MediShield Life or CareShield Life (if applicable) premiums?
answer:
['The Government helps Singaporeans with their MediShield Life (MSHL) and CareShield Life (CSHL) (if applicable) premiums through Premium Subsidies for the lower- to middle-income, Pioneer Generation and Merdeka Generation seniors. Those who are less well-off will qualify for higher Government subsidies. Your family members can also help pay for your MSHL and CSHL premiums with their MediSave. They can do so by submitting a Change of Payer request for:
* [MediShield Life](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ChangePayerOfMediShieldCoverToMyself/Information)
* [CareShield Life](https://www.careshieldlife.gov.sg/eservices/careshield-life/change-premium-payer.html)
Additional Premium Support (APS) helps members who cannot afford their premiums after Government subsidies and have limited family support. Members who need APS may call 1800-222-3399 (or +65 6222 3399) from Monday to Friday, 8:30am to 5:30pm (GMT+8). No one will lose their MSHL and CSHL (if applicable) coverage due to financial difficulties.']

question: Why am I identified to pay for my own MediShield Life premiums when my payer has been paying my premiums?
answer: ['You have been identified to take over paying your own premiums because there are sufficient funds in your MediSave Account. This helps to preserve your previous payer√¢¬Ä¬ôs MediSave for his/her own healthcare needs. We have notified your previous payer. If the previous payer or a new payer wishes to help with your premium payment, he/she can submit a√Ç¬†[Change of Payer for MediShield Life Cove](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ChangePayerOfMediShieldCoverToMyself/Information)r.']

question: How do I view the details of my outstanding MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['You can log in to [Outstanding MediShield Life premium](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/dashboards/healthcare/outstanding-medishield-life-premium)√Ç¬†to view the breakdown of your outstanding premiums, interest and/or penalties.
If you do not have any outstanding premium for the previous policy years, but your dependants have, you will see a blank section below the premium summary table. Your dependants can view the breakdown of their outstanding premiums by logging into their own Healthcare dashboards.
If you and your dependants (if any) do not have outstanding premium, you will not be able to view this page.']

question: When will the deduction from my MediSave Account take place after I submit the Change of Payer request?
answer:
['If the insured(s) has(have) outstanding MediShield Life premiums, the deduction will be made soon from your MediSave Account after you have submitted the request.
Thereafter, the insured(s)' MediShield Life premiums will automatically be deducted from your MediSave Account once a year, within a month after the Insured(s)√¢¬Ä¬ô renewal date.']

question: I am (i) residing overseas or (ii) have renounced my Singapore Citizenship/Permanent Resident status. How do I pay my CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['You can pay your CareShield Life/ElderShield/MediShield Life premiums by:
1) Asking a Singapore Citizen/Permanent Resident family member to perform a Change of Payer to take over the premium payments using his/her MediSave.
MediShield Life:√Ç¬†[**Change of Payer for MediShield Life Cover**](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ChangePayerOfMediShieldCoverToMyself/Information) CareShield Life/ElderShield:√Ç¬†[**Change of Payer for CareShield Life/ ElderShield**](https://careshieldlife.gov.sg/change-payer)
2) Telegraphic Transfer Please note the following:
i. Indicate √¢¬Ä¬úCSHL/ESH/MSL for <premium payer√¢¬Ä¬ôs name, CPF Account Number/NRIC>√¢¬Ä¬ù. For example, CSHL/ESH/MSL for XXXX, S1234567B. Note: Remittance amount should include the total outstanding premiums and any prevailing bank charges. Charge Type should be √¢¬Ä¬òOUR√¢¬Ä¬ô for bank account holder to bear all charges.
ii. Our bank details are as follows: Oversea-Chinese Banking Corporation Limited OCBC Centre 65 Chulia Street Singapore 049513 SWIFT CODE: OCBCSGSGXXX Bank Code: 7339 Beneficiary Name: Central Provident Fund Board Beneficiary Account No: 501-600001-001']

question: How can I make a voluntary top-up to my MediSave Account using e-Cashier if I do not have a Singapore contact number?
answer: ['You can key in "1111 1111" to proceed with your e-Cashier payment into your MediSave Account if you do not have a Singapore contact number.']

question: How do I check if my MediSave top-up is successfully credited?
answer: ['You can log in to view your [Contribution history](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/statements/contribution-history)√Ç¬†to check if your top-up has been credited into your MediSave Account. The top-up would be shown as 'VOLUNTARY CON TO MEDISAVE A/C' or 'HEALTHCARE TOP-UP'.']

question: Why do my household members have different subsidy amounts for MediShield Life Premium Subsidies?
answer: ['Your household members may have different subsidy amounts for MediShield Life Premium Subsidies due to the following reasons:√Ç¬†a. Age-based Premium Subsidies structure - Subsidy amounts are higher for older insured members, as compared to younger insured members, for those with the same subsidy eligibility. b. Maximum subsidy for selected group identified - You or your household member may have been assessed previously and are eligible under other Government assistance schemes (e.g. Public Assistance Scheme). c. Assessed separately - Information from your application and/or renewal for other healthcare subsidy schemes (e.g. Community Health Assist Scheme) will be used for the eligibility checks for MediShield Life Premium Subsidies.√Ç¬†Selected household member(s) may have been assessed separately due to extenuating circumstances, e.g. those living overseas and are unable to provide consent in the previous applications.√Ç¬†If you and your household wish to be reassessed for MediShield Life Premium Subsidies please write to us at [medishieldlife.sg/writetous](https://medishieldlife.sg/writetous) or call our hotline at 1800-222-3399.']

question: Will I be eligible for MediShield Life Premium Subsidies?
answer:
['As long as you meet the eligibility criteria, you will receive MediShield Life Premium Subsidies.
* Premium Subsidies (up to 50%) are provided for lower- to middle-income Singapore Residents with household monthly income per person of $2,800 and below (applicable for renewals from 1 September 2019) and living in residences with an Annual Value of $21,000 and below. Those who are older, have lower income (or living in residences with lower Annual Value) will enjoy higher subsidy rates.
* Individuals who own multiple properties will not be eligible.
* Permanent Residents will receive half of the subsidy rates applicable to Singapore Citizens. This is aligned to the subsidy policy in public healthcare institutions.']

question: Will I receive premium subsidies if my child / payer is paying for my MediShield Life premium?
answer: ['You will receive the subsides you are eligible for regardless of who is paying your MediShield Life premiums. You can login to [Healthcare dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/dashboards/healthcare) 'Coverage and premium details' to check your eligible subsidies.']

question: I am a Pioneer Generation member (Pioneers). How much subsidies will I receive for my MediShield Life premium?
answer:
['Pioneers Generation Subsidies range from 40% at age 65, to 60% at age 90.
The Government is committed to help Pioneers Generation Seniors aged 80 and above in 2014, to fully cover their MediShield Life premiums. This is done through a combination of Pioneer Generation Subsidies and MediSave top-ups. For younger Pioneers, their MediShield life premiums will be about half of the MediShield premiums after Pioneer Generation Subsidies and MediSave top-ups.
You can login to [Healthcare dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/dashboards/healthcare) 'Coverage and premium details' to check your coverage, premiums and subsidies.']

question: Will I be eligible for MediShield Life Premium Subsidies for the lower- to middle-income for the rest of my life?
answer: ['Premium Subsidies are provided to help the lower- to middle-income households with their MediShield Life premiums as long as you meet the eligibility criteria.√Ç¬†Pioneer Generation Subsidies are applicable for the rest of the Pioneer's life. The Government will ensure that the process for subsidies is as simple and convenient as possible, so that those who meet the eligibility criteria can get the subsidies easily.']

question: Will I be eligible for MediShield Life Premium Subsidies if I earn more than $2,800?
answer: ['The $2,800 figure refers to the household monthly income per person, which is based on the total income earned by a family staying in the same residential address, divided by the number of members of that family.√Ç¬†If the total income earned by family members is $10,000, and there are four members in the family, then the household monthly income per person is $2,500, and the family would qualify for subsidies. Up to two-thirds of the population would qualify for Premium Subsidies. This is a fairer way of calculating the need for subsidies, because a family with more members may need more support, even if the total income they make is quite high. This is because the amount they can spend on each family member will be lower if there are more family members.√Ç¬†Families in a lower household income category will get a higher subsidy rate. In this way, we give more help to those who have less resources and need more help. This is part of being a compassionate and inclusive society.']

question: Why am I receiving subsidies even though I have withdrawn from the eligibility check for MediShield Life Premium Subsidies?
answer:
['There are different types of MediShield Life premium subsidies.
The eligibility check process was used to determine eligibility for MediShield Life Premium√Ç¬†Subsidies for lower- to middle-income Singapore Residents.
If you did not participate in the eligibility check, the√Ç¬†Government will still compute the MediShield Life√Ç¬†Premium√Ç¬†Subsidies for your household. However, it will be√Ç¬†based on existing information in Government records, which may not be up-to-date. For individuals who miss the date to confirm√Ç¬†their household information and wish to make changes, please call 1800-222-3399 for further assistance.
Pioneer Generation Subsidies and Merdeka Generation Subsidies are given based on your Pioneer Generation√Ç¬†and Merdeka Generation√Ç¬†statuses,√Ç¬†and are applied automatically to your MediShield Life premium. Similarly, COVID-19 Subsidies are automatically given to all Singapore Citizens regardless of household income and Annual Value for their residence.']

question: Annual Value is an assessment criterion for MediShield Life premium subsidies. Will there be any flexibility in premium payment for "asset-rich, cash-poor" citizens?
answer:
['In general, Government subsidies should be targeted at those in greater need. The assessment approach for MediShield Life Premium Subsidies uses the household monthly income per person and Annual Value (AV) of homes as a way to assess the household√¢¬Ä¬ôs means and better target these subsidies. In addition, those who own multiple properties will not be eligible for Premium Subsidies.
The household assessment process strikes a balance between being more precise in assessing applicants√¢¬Ä¬ô means and keeping the process simpler for applicants and administratively practical. The approach aims to provide us with a fair and objective basis to take a person's income and wealth into consideration.
Annual Value is a relevant consideration, as among those with similar income, those who live in homes with a higher AV would generally be better off than those who live in homes with a lower AV. The $21,000 AV threshold covers all HDB flats and a small number of private properties. Similarly, Singapore Residents who own multiple properties would also have more means to pay for their premiums.
Aside from premium subsidies, Singapore Citizens who belong to the Pioneer Generation or Merdeka Generation are given subsidies from 40% - 60% or from 5% - 10% respectively.
For Singaporeans with difficulties affording MediShield Life premiums even after the various government subsidies, there will be Additional Premium Support available on a case by case basis, in line with family circumstances.
Those living in homes with higher AVs or own multiple properties will also continue to benefit from substantial healthcare subsidies e.g. at polyclinics and public hospitals. From time to time, they also receive MediSave top-ups to help them with healthcare expenses.
Overall, we aim to be both fair and progressive, with general subsidies available to all Singapore Residents but the support tiered to target those who require greater support.']

question: Why is COVID-19 subsidy computed only based on net premium increase after subsidies?
answer: ['The one off COVID-19 subsidy is meant to further cushion the impact of the MediShield Life premium adjustments in light of the economic impact from COVID-19, after taking into account existing premium subsidies. Hence, it will cover 70% of the net premium increase in the first year, followed by 30% of the net premium increase in the second year. With this, the net premium increase for all Singapore Citizens will be no more than about 10% in the first year.']

question: What does it mean to appoint agents to recover outstanding MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['The Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS) will take enforcement actions against members with outstanding MediShield Life premiums. This may include appointing agents like employers, banks or tenants in member's properties to recover the outstanding premiums.
IRAS will inform members and their agents of the appointment in writing. The appointed agents will pay the premiums to the MediShield Life Fund on behalf of the member.']

question: Will premium recovery measures for MediShield Life include chasing the next of kin?
answer:
['Premium recovery measures will not be levied on the next of kin. Members are responsible for their own MediShield Life premiums.
The Government will implement measures such as imposition of interest and penalty on outstanding premiums on members who default premium payments repeatedly.']

question: Can I top up my MediSave to fully pay off the outstanding MediShield Life premiums if I am on a GIRO Payment plan?
answer: ['Yes, you can top up your MediSave to pay your outstanding MediShield Life premiums in full. Upon receipt of your payment, your outstanding premiums will be deducted from your MediSave by the following day. Your GIRO payment plan will automatically end when you do not have any outstanding premium*s.*']

question: I have an ongoing GIRO payment plan. Can I continue to pay my next MediShield Life premium by instalments?
answer: ['If you have insufficient MediSave for your next MediShield Life premium, the premium will be automatically included in your ongoing GIRO payment plan. You do not need to apply for a new GIRO payment plan. We will send you a notification on the revised GIRO payment plan when this happens.']

question: When is the GIRO deduction date for each monthly instalment to pay my MediShield Life premiums?
answer: ['The deduction will be made on the 15th of each month. If the 15th falls on a weekend or public holiday, the deduction will be made on the next working day.']

question: How do I apply for a GIRO payment plan for my/my dependant√¢¬Ä¬ôs outstanding MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['You can use your own or a third party√¢¬Ä¬ôs bank account to apply for a GIRO payment plan for your/your dependant√¢¬Ä¬ôs outstanding MediShield Life premiums by scanning the QR code below or click on [Apply/Change GIRO for Payment of MediShield Life Premiums](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/GiroApplication/LandingPage?scheme=MSL) to submit the request. The owner of the bank account/applicant must have a personal internet banking account with DBS or OCBC.
![QR code to Apply or Change GIRO for Payment of MediShield Life Premiums ](/content/dam/web/member/faq/images/medishield-giro.png)']

question: Can I change the bank account to pay for my MediShield Life premiums?
answer: ['Yes. You will need to submit a new GIRO application with the new bank account details. The new application will generally be processed within 21 working days. We will continue to deduct your outstanding MediShield Life premiums from the current bank account until the new GIRO application is approved.']

question: Will there be any fees for unsuccessful deduction of MediShield Life premiums?
answer: ['CPF Board ("Billing Organization") will not impose any charges for unsuccessful deductions of MediShield Life premiums. However, some banks will impose service charges as an unsuccessful deduction may be treated like a bounced cheque. Please contact your bank for further details on the fees and charges (if applicable).']

question: What happens if I don't have sufficient funds in my GIRO account for MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['If you do not have sufficient funds in your GIRO account for MediShield Life premiums, the GIRO deduction will be unsuccessful and a second GIRO deduction attempt will be made on the 15thof the next month for two months√¢¬Ä¬ô instalments.
The GIRO payment plan will be suspended if there are two consecutive unsuccessful deductions. Interest and penalties may be imposed on your outstanding premiums and re-activation of the GIRO plan will be assessed on a case-by-case basis.']

question: How do I terminate my GIRO arrangement for MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['You can scan the QR code below or click on [Terminate GIRO for MediShield Life premiums](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/TerminationOfGiroForEmployee/CoverPage?RequestType=3)√Ç¬†to submit your request. Your request will generally be processed within one working day.
![QR code to request for termination of GIRO arrangement for MediShield Life premiums](/content/dam/web/member/faq/healthcare-financing/images/GIROtermQR_23062023.png)
Alternatively, you can approach your bank to terminate your GIRO arrangement for MediShield Life premiums.']

question: Will interest be imposed on my outstanding premiums if my GIRO application was submitted before the deadline on Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore√¢¬Ä¬ôs (IRAS) notice?
answer:
['Interest on your outstanding MediShield Life premiums will not be imposed if your GIRO application is received before the due date stated in IRAS' notice.
However, interest will be imposed if the GIRO application is unsuccessful or if you defaulted on the GIRO payment plan.']

question: What happens if my GIRO application is rejected or the GIRO deductions are suspended for MediShield Life premiums?
answer: ['We will impose new interest and penalties on your outstanding MediShield Life premiums if your GIRO application is rejected or GIRO deductions are suspended.']

question: I have an ongoing GIRO payment plan. My MediShield Life cover has been renewed and has incurred new outstanding premiums. Will interest be imposed on me?
answer: ['New interest will not be imposed on the outstanding MediShield Life premiums under your ongoing GIRO payment plan. Your existing GIRO payment plan will be auto-renewed to include the new outstanding premiums. You will be notified of the revised instalment to be paid.']

question: Why do I have to pay MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['MediShield Life provides universal coverage to Singapore residents for life, regardless of their pre-existing health condition. Members uphold their collective responsibility by paying their premiums on time to ensure that MediShield Life is able to meet its commitments and pay out claims to its members.
Defaults on premium payment will translate to bad debts to the MediShield Life Fund and result in higher premiums for all.']

question: Can the deadline be extended to pay my outstanding MediShield Life premium?
answer:
['You should make payment for your MediShield Life premiums before the deadline. If you face difficulties in paying your outstanding premiums, you may apply for Additional Premium Support (APS). APS helps members who cannot pay their MediShield Life premiums after Government subsidies and have limited family support.
You can find out more about APS by calling 1800 222 3399 (or +65 6222 3399) from Monday to Friday, 8.30am to 5.30pm (GMT+8).
Alternatively, you can:
1. Apply for a "[Apply / Change GIRO for Payment of MediShield Life Premiums](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/GiroApplication/LandingPage?scheme=MSL)" to pay your outstanding premiums by instalments; or
2. Seek a family member's help to perform "[Change of Payer for MediShield Life Cover](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ChangePayerOfMediShieldCoverToMyself/Information)" to pay your outstanding premiums.']

question: Will my MediSave be deducted if the amount is less than my/my dependant's outstanding MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['The amount deducted from your MediSave Account will be your/your dependant√¢¬Ä¬ôs outstanding premium, or your MediSave balance, whichever is lower.
If you have insufficient MediSave for premium payment, please click on the link below to view the payment options.
[How can I view and pay my/my dependant(s)'s CareShield Life/ElderShield and MediShield Life premiums?](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/healthcare-financing/medishield-life/how-can-i-view-and-pay-my-dependant-msl-premiums)']

question: Why do I have to pay for my child's outstanding MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['Under MediShield Life Act/Regulations, parents are liable to pay for their child√¢¬Ä¬ôs MediShield Life premiums until the child is 21 years old.
We will deduct your child's outstanding premiums from your or the other parent√¢¬Ä¬ôs MediSave Account. If you have insufficient MediSave savings, you can top up your child√¢¬Ä¬ôs or your MediSave Account to pay your child√¢¬Ä¬ôs premiums.']

question: Can the Board refund the amount of outstanding MediShield Life premiums recovered from my/my child's MediSave if we qualify for Additional Premium Support?
answer:
['Additional Premium Support (APS) is provided to members who have insufficient MediSave and limited family support to pay their outstanding premiums.
The Government will pay your/your child's outstanding and future premiums at the point of APS qualification for the next two years. Hence, there is no refund of any outstanding premiums recovered prior to your APS qualification.']

question: Can the interest and penalty be waived if I partially paid my outstanding premiums before the deadline in Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore√¢¬Ä¬ôs (IRAS) notice?
answer: ['Interest and penalties will be imposed if full premium payment is not made by IRAS√¢¬Ä¬ô notice deadline.']

question: I am a bankrupt and I do not have monies to pay the MediShield Life premiums for my child/dependant and myself. Will there be interest and penalty imposed on me?
answer:
['A claim will be filed with the Private Trustee or Official Assignee for outstanding MediShield Life premiums (including interest and penalties) incurred prior to the date of your Bankruptcy Order.
You are required to pay any MediShield Life premiums incurred after the date of your Bankruptcy Order. Bankrupt parents/guardians remain liable to pay for their child/dependant's premiums.
If you face difficulties paying the premiums, you may apply for Additional Premium Support (APS). APS helps members who cannot pay their MediShield Life premiums after Government subsidies and have limited family support. Find out more information on APS by calling 1800-222-3399 (or +65 6222 3399) from Monday to Friday, 8.30am to 5.30pm (GMT+8).
The Ministry of Health will assess each APS application to ensure that assistance is provided to members who need financial support. They will notify you of your APS application status.']

question: I am a bankrupt and I remember I owe more MediShield Life premiums than what is shown in my notification and my Healthcare dashboard. How much should I pay?
answer:
['We may have filed a claim with the Private Trustee or Official Assignee to recover your outstanding MediShield Life premiums (including interest and penalties) incurred prior to the date of your Bankruptcy Order. The amount filed will not be shown in your notifications as the amount may berecovered from your bankruptcy estate.
The notifications you receive are for the MediShield Life premiums incurred after the date of your Bankruptcy Order. You can apply for a [Apply / Change GIRO for Payment of MediShield Life Premiums](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/GiroApplication/LandingPage?scheme=MSL)√Ç¬†or seek a family member's help to perform [Change of Payer for MediShield Life Cover](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ChangePayerOfMediShieldCoverToMyself/Information)√Ç¬†to pay your outstanding premiums.
To make a voluntary top-up to your MediSave Account, you must obtain approval from the Private Trustee or Official Assignee. You can contact them at 1800 225 5529 (during office hours) or visit√Ç¬†[www.mlaw.gov.sg](https://www.mlaw.gov.sg/).']

question: My family member has passed away. Why are interest and penalties still imposed on his/her outstanding MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['We are sorry for your loss. We√Ç¬†may not have been notified of your family member's passing, hence interest and penalties are still imposed on his/her outstanding MediShield Life premiums.
Please write to us at [cpf.gov.sg/writetous](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/writetous)√Ç¬†with details of your deceased family member.']

question: If I have renounced my citizenship, will interest and penalty still be imposed on my outstanding MediShield Life premiums?
answer: ['You need to pay your MediShield Life premiums incurred prior to your renouncement date of your citizenship. If your premiums remain outstanding, compounded interest of 4% and penalties of up to 17% will be imposed and enforcement actions will be taken.']

question: If I have renounced my Singapore Citizenship or Permanent Resident status, is CPF Board authorised to recover my outstanding premiums from my CPF savings?
answer:
['The Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS) will carry out enforcement actions on members with outstanding premiums. This includes the imposition of compounded interest of 4% and penalties of up to 17% on your outstanding premiums. IRAS will also appoint agents, such as CPF Board and banks, to recover your outstanding premiums from your CPF savings or bank accounts.
Pay your outstanding premiums in full to avoid enforcement actions. To do so, please click on the link below to view the payment options.
[I have renounced my Singapore Citizenship or Permanent Resident status/am residing overseas without a local bank account. How do I pay my outstanding MediShield Life premiums?](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/healthcare-financing/medishield-life/how-does-renounced-or-overseas-member-pay-outstanding-premiums)']

question: I have renounced my citizenship and applied to withdraw my CPF savings. Will my application be affected if I choose not to pay the outstanding MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['Your withdrawal application will be processed even if you have outstanding MediShield Life premiums.
However, you are advised to fully pay your outstanding premiums to avoid enforcement actions by the Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS). To do so, please click on the link below to view the payment options.
[I have renounced my citizenship/am residing overseas without local bank account. How do I pay my outstanding MediShield Life premiums?](/member/faq/healthcare-financing/medishield-life/how-does-renounced-or-overseas-member-pay-outstanding-premiums)']

question: Why am I unable to see the premiums owed for a particular policy year in the 'Outstanding MediShield Life Premium' section of my Healthcare dashboard?
answer:
['If you have fully paid the MediShield Life premium for the policy year, it will not be shown in your [Healthcare dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/dashboards/healthcare).
If you are bankrupt, your outstanding MediShield Life premiums incurred prior to your bankruptcy date may be recovered from your bankruptcy estate. Hence, these premiums will not be shown in your [Healthcare dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/dashboards/healthcare).']

question: I have already made payment via e-cashier. Why do I still see outstanding MediShield Life premiums under the 'Outstanding MediShield Life Premium' section of my Healthcare Dashboard?
answer: ['If you made the payment for your outstanding MediShield Life premiums recently, the amount might not been credited to your MediSave Account yet. You can view the premium deduction in your [Transaction history](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/statements/transaction-history) at [cpf.gov.sg](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/).']

question: How can I find out my child's outstanding MediShield Life premiums as I am unable to view it from the 'Outstanding MediShield Life Premium' section of my Healthcare dashboard?
answer:
['You can only view the MediShield Life premiums of the dependant(s) whom you are currently paying for in your [Healthcare dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/dashboards/healthcare).
If your child√¢¬Ä¬ôs MediShield Life premium is paid by the other parent or from the child√¢¬Ä¬ôs own MediSave Account, please write to us at [cpf.gov.sg/writetous](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/writetous)√Ç¬†with your child√¢¬Ä¬ôs name and birth certificate/NRIC number.']

question: What happens if I choose not to pay my outstanding MediShield Life premiums?
answer:
['The Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS) will start enforcement actions if no payment is made by the deadline. This includes imposition of compounded interest of 4% and penalties of up to 17% on your outstanding premiums. Agents (e.g.: employer, tenants, banks) may also be appointed to recover your outstanding premiums.
You should fully pay your outstanding premiums to avoid enforcement actions. Please click on the link below for the payment options.
[How can I view and pay my/my dependant(s)'s CareShield Life/ElderShield and MediShield Life premiums?](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/healthcare-financing/medishield-life/how-can-i-view-and-pay-my-dependant-msl-premiums)']

question: What should I do if I am unable to scan the QR code in the notifications to pay the MediShield Life premiums?
answer: ['If you are unable to scan the QR code in the notifications to pay the MediShield Life premiums, you can top up to your or the premium payer's MediSave Account via [e-Cashier](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Miscellaneous/Cashier/ECashierHomepage) and select "Contribute to My MediSave". Alternatively, you can seek a family member's help to perform "[Change of Payer for MediShield Life Cover](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ChangePayerOfMediShieldCoverToMyself/Information)" to take over the premium payment.']

question: I have paid my outstanding MediShield Life premiums in full. Why do I still receive a notification asking me to pay my premiums?
answer: ['You may have received the notification as the payment for your MediShield Life premium has not been processed. You can log in to view your [Transaction history](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/statements/transaction-history)√Ç¬†and check your payment status.']

question: My spouse and I received the Final Reminder notification regarding our child's outstanding MediShield Life premium. Whose MediSave would the premiums be deducted from?
answer:
['If your child is below 21 years old, his/her outstanding MediShield Life premiums will be deducted in the following order:
1. Child's MediSave, followed by 2. Father√¢¬Ä¬ôs MediSave, followed by 3. Mother√¢¬Ä¬ôs MediSave']

question: Can the outstanding MediShield Life premiums be waived due to financial difficulty?
answer:
['Members with financial difficulties may apply for Additional Premium Support (APS). APS helps members who cannot pay their MediShield Life premiums despite Government subsidies and have limited family support.
You can find out more on APS by calling 1800-222-3399 (or +65 6222 3399) from Monday to Friday, 8:30am to 5:30pm (GMT+8).
The Ministry of Health will assess each application to ensure that assistance is provided to members who need financial support.']

question: Can I still make payment for my outstanding MediShield Life premiums after the deadline stated in the Final Reminder notification?
answer:
