['You have to repay the full amount of CPF savings used and the accrued interest which is computed from the time the savings were withdrawn, until the CPF education loan is fully repaid. The amount repaid will be credited to the CPF member(s)' Ordinary Account.
You may check your outstanding loan amount by logging in to your√Ç¬†[**Education dashboard**](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/educationdashboard)√Ç¬†with your Singpass.']

question: What are the modes of repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer:
['The student can make repayment via GIRO or via e-Cashier (PayNow). It can be in a lump sum or monthly instalments.
We encourage students to register for **[GIRO repayment](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/GiroApplication/LandingPage?scheme=EDN)** as it is the most convenient. The monthly deduction required each month is automatic and students will not miss out on repayments as long as sufficient amount is maintained in their bank account.']

question: Why must CPF savings withdrawn for education be repaid with interest?
answer: ['The primary objective of CPF savings is to help members save for their retirement needs. The amount withdrawn for education and the accrued interest must be repaid to the CPF member's Ordinary Account. This is so that the member would not lose out on the interest that he/she would have earned had the monies not been withdrawn for education purposes.']

question: When do I need to start repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer: ['You are required to start repaying the CPF education√Ç¬†loan one year after graduation or leaving your course of study, whichever is earlier. We will send a notification to you generally about three months before the repayment start date, to inform you on the repayment.']

question: Would I receive any notification to start repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer: ['We will send a repayment√Ç¬†notification to you to inform you to start repayment. It will state the outstanding CPF education loan amount, the date to start repayment and the monthly instalment rate. We will enclose a GIRO application form for you to apply for GIRO deductions from the bank account, for your monthly repayment to the member's Ordinary Account.']

question: How do I submit a request to start repaying the education loan earlier, instead of waiting one year from my graduation?
answer:
['If you have graduated and wish to make an early repayment, you may either make your repayment via monthly instalments or lump sum repayment:
**1.√Ç¬†Monthly instalments** - You have toinform us your intention to start early repayment√Ç¬†of your education loan√Ç¬†through√Ç¬†[My Mailbox](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/mymailbox) using your Singpass. Please state the month which you would like to start the repayment and we will advise you on the monthly instalment amount.
After your request for early repayment has been approved, we recommend that you submit a GIRO application through√Ç¬†[*my cpf* Online](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/GiroApplication/LandingPage?scheme=EDN) [Services √¢¬Ä¬ì My Requests](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/GiroApplication/LandingPage?scheme=EDN)√Ç¬†with your Singpass to deduct your monthly repayments through GIRO. You will be re-directed to DBS or OCBC√¢¬Ä¬ôs ibanking portal to complete the application.
If you wish to apply for GIRO using other bank accounts, please download and submit the√Ç¬†"[Repay Education Loan Using GIRO" (FORM EDN GIRO/IBG)](/content/dam/web/member/faq/other-schemes/documents/FORM_EDN_GIRO.pdf)" (PDF, 0.4MB).
**2. Lump sum repayment** -You may proceed to make a partial or full lump sum repayment online via [e-Cashier](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Miscellaneous/Cashier/ECashierHomepage) (PayNow).']

question: Can I stop the use of CPF savings for my tuition fees and make a lump sum or full repayment for the education loan before I graduate?
answer:
['The CPF member (whose CPF savings is used) will need to submit an online application to √¢¬Ä¬úRevoke the use of his/her CPF savings√¢¬Ä¬ù via [*my cpf* Online Services - My Requests](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Miscellaneous/RevokeUseOfCpfSavingsForEducation/CoverPage)√Ç¬†using his/her Singpass, if you no longer wish to use his/her CPF savings to pay your tuition fees for future semesters.
After the revocation application is approved, please inform us of your intention to make a lump sum or full repayment through√Ç¬†[My Mailbox](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/mymailbox)√Ç¬†using your Singpass.']

question: What happens if I default in my education repayment and has arrears?
answer: ['You will receive monthly arrears√Ç¬†notifications to inform you on your repayment in arrears. You may make payment for your arrears through [e-Cashier](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Miscellaneous/Cashier/ECashierHomepage) at [CPF website](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/), or "[My Requests](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/MyRequest/MyRequestLanding)" under *my cpf* Online Services. If you are facing financial difficulties in repaying the arrears, you can write in to us to discuss on a suitable payment plan.']

question: How do I pay for my education arrears?
answer: ['You may make payment for your arrears through [e-Cashier](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Miscellaneous/Cashier/ECashierHomepage)√Ç¬†(PayNow).√Ç¬†Please also check with your bank on your daily withdrawal limit. You may wish to arrange with your bank to increase your withdrawal limit if needed.']

question: If I use my own CPF savings under the CPF Education Loan Scheme, why must I repay the CPF savings withdrawn?
answer: ['CPF savings are primarily meant for your retirement needs. Any withdrawal of CPF savings will cause your retirement savings to be reduced. Hence it is important that you repay the CPF savings withdrawn under the CPF Education Loan Scheme, including the accrued interest which would otherwise have been earned. Repayment will be credited into your Ordinary Account.']

question: Is repayment required under the CPF Education Loan Scheme if the CPF member passes away?
answer: ['Upon the death of the member, repayments of his CPF savings including the accrued interest under the CPF Education Loan Scheme shall cease.']

question: How will the repayment be credited if I have used more than one CPF member's savings to pay my tuition fees?
answer:
['The amount repaid will be credited proportionately to each member based on the total outstanding loan amount of each account.
Please see example below: ![Apportionment of CPF Education Loan Repayment to different members](/content/dam/web/member/faq/other-schemes/images/Repayment_proportion.jpg)
If you would like to credit the repayment into a specific member√¢¬Ä¬ôs account only, please let us know immediately via [My Mailbox](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/mymailbox) after the repayment is made. The CPF member(s) who will not be receiving the repayment would also need to submit their consent to the repayment arrangement via My Mailbox to us.']

question: How do I check my education loan repayment history?
answer:
['You can check the repayment history for your√Ç¬†education loan in two ways:
* Refer to your bank account statement, or
* Check with the member(s) who had used their CPF savings for your education. They will need to log in to [*my cpf* Online Services](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/statements/transaction-history) with their Singpass and retrieve their "Transaction History".']

question: What is the monthly instalment rate under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer: ['Your monthly instalment rate under the√Ç¬†CPF Education Loan Scheme√Ç¬†will be stated in the repayment√Ç¬†notification sent to you. Generally, the monthly instalment rate will enable you to fully repay your education loan within six years.']

question: What is the minimum monthly instalment rate under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer: ['The minimum monthly instalment rate under the CPF Education Loan Scheme√Ç¬†is $100. The instalment rate stated in the repayment√Ç¬†notification will be $100 if this rate is expected to enable you to fully repay the loan within six years. You are encouraged to fully repay the loan within six years to reduce the interest incurred for the loan. If you have a bigger outstanding loan amount, a higher monthly instalment rate will be stated, to enable you to repay within a period of six years.']

question: Can I reduce the monthly instalment for my CPF education loan stated in my repayment notification?
answer: ['Reducing the monthly instalment will mean a longer repayment period thus incurring more interest on the loan. Under the Terms & Conditions of the CPF Education Loan√Ç¬†Scheme, the loan must be fully repaid within 12 years, which starts one year after you graduate or leave the course of study. Any outstanding balance has to be paid in full before the end of the 12th year. Hence, if you repay at a lower monthly instalment, not only do you incur additional interest due to the prolonged repayment period, you may have to make a lump sum repayment of your outstanding loan at the end of the 12th year. If you would like to reduce the monthly instalment (subject to a minimum repayment of $100), you may submit your application online via[*my cpf* Online Services - My Requests](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Miscellaneous/ChangeMyMonthlyInstalment/ChangeMonthlyInstallmentLandingPage) using your Singpass.']

question: Can I increase the monthly instalment for my Education Loan repayment?
answer: ['You are encouraged to increase the monthly instalment for your education loan repayment if you are financially able to do so. This will enable you to fully repay the loan within a shorter period and hence minimise the interest you have to pay. If you would like to increase the monthly instalment, you may submit your application online via[*my cpf* Online Services - My Requests](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Miscellaneous/ChangeMyMonthlyInstalment/ChangeMonthlyInstallmentLandingPage) using your Singpass.']

question: How do I change my monthly instalment for my education loan repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer: ['You may submit your application online to change your monthly instalment through [*my cpf* Online Services - My Requests](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Miscellaneous/ChangeMyMonthlyInstalment/ChangeMonthlyInstallmentLandingPage) using your Singpass. The minimum monthly instalment is $100. You are encouraged to increase your monthly instalment as this will enable you to fully repay your education loan within a shorter period and hence minimise the interest that you have to pay.']

question: Is there any tool available that can help me project the monthly instalment rate under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer: ['You may use the online [CPF Education Monthly Instalment Rate calculator](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/EducationMonthlyInstalmentRateCalculator/EducationMonthlyInstalmentRateCalculate) to estimate your monthly instalment rate payable. You may also check your latest outstanding loan amount by logging in to your [Education dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/educationdashboard)√Ç¬†with your Singpass.']

question: Is there any tool available that can help me project the repayment period under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer: ['You may use the online [CPF Education Loan Repayment Period calculator](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/EducationLoanRepaymentPeriodCalculator/EducationLoanRepaymentPeriodCalculate) to estimate how long it would take to repay your education loan. You may also check your latest outstanding loan amount by logging in to your [Education dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/educationdashboard)√Ç¬†with your Singpass.']

question: Where can I check the status of my request to change monthly instalment rate under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer: ['You may check the status of your request to change the monthly instalment rate under the CPF Education Loan Scheme at [CPF website](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/) by logging in to [*my cpf* Online Services - My Activities](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/MyActivity/MyActivity)√Ç¬†using your Singpass.']

question: Can I use another person's bank account to repay my CPF education loan?
answer:
['You may authorise the monthly deductions from your own or another person's bank account for the loan repayments under the CPF Education Loan Scheme. Please submit a GIRO application through [*my cpf* Online Services √¢¬Ä¬ì My Requests](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/GiroApplication/LandingPage?scheme=EDN) with your Singpass. You will be re-directed to DBS or OCBC√¢¬Ä¬ôs ibanking portal to complete the application.
If you wish to apply GIRO using other bank accounts, please download and submit the√Ç¬†"[Repay Education Loan Using GIRO" (FORM EDN/GIRO)](/content/dam/web/member/faq/other-schemes/documents/FORM_EDN_GIRO.pdf) (PDF, 0.4MB).']

question: Can I use different bank accounts to repay my education loans for two different courses?
answer: ['Only one bank account may be maintained for repayments under the CPF Education Loan√Ç¬†Scheme. If you submit a GIRO form for repayment using a new account, deductions for all the courses that you are repaying will be made from the new account.']

question: Would I receive any acknowledgement after submitting my GIRO application form for the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer: ['Generally, you will receive an acknowledgement notification within two weeks upon receipt of your GIRO application form. The notification will indicate the start date of deduction and the monthly instalment rate. Generally, GIRO applications will be processed within 21 working days. Upon receipt of your bank's approval of your GIRO application, we will send a notification to inform you on the approval, together with the start date of the deduction and the monthly instalment rate. In the meantime, please repay your education loan through **[e-Cashier](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Miscellaneous/Cashier/ECashierHomepage)** (PayNow).']

question: Where can I check the status of my GIRO application for repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer: ['Your Direct Debit Authorisation / GIRO application for your repayment under the CPF√Ç¬†Education Loan√Ç¬†Scheme√Ç¬†will be sent to your bank and will generally be processed within 21 working days. We will notify you of the status and effective date of the Direct Debit / GIRO arrangement upon approval.']

question: What is the deduction date if I'm repaying my education loan by GIRO?
answer: ['The GIRO deduction date for repayments under the scheme is on the 20th of every month. If 20th of the month falls on a Saturday, Sunday or public holiday, the deduction will be made on the next working day.']

question: How do I change the bank account for my repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer:
['You will need to submit a new GIRO application through [*my cpf* Online Services √¢¬Ä¬ì My Requests](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/GiroApplication/LandingPage?scheme=EDN)√Ç¬†with your Singpass to change the bank account for your repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme. You will be re-directed to DBS or OCBC√¢¬Ä¬ôs ibanking portal to complete the application.
If you wish to apply GIRO using other bank accounts, please download and submit a new√Ç¬†"[Repay Education Loan Using GIRO" (FORM EDN/GIRO)](/content/dam/web/member/faq/other-schemes/documents/FORM_EDN_GIRO.pdf) (PDF, 0.4MB).']

question: How do I terminate my GIRO arrangement for my education loan repayment?
answer: ['You may submit your request via√Ç¬†[My Mailbox](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/mymailbox)√Ç¬†or approach your respective bank directly to terminate the GIRO arrangement for your education loan repayment. Please note that all requests should be submitted and approved before the 15th of each month for the termination to take effect by next month. Upon termination, all Standing Instruction(s) for repayments will cease. You will need to submit a new GIRO application if you want to repay using GIRO in future.']

question: Why CPF savings cannot be used to repay an outstanding education loan?
answer: ['CPF savings are primarily meant for a member's retirement needs. Allowing the use of CPF savings to repay an outstanding education loan would cause a premature drawdown of your own CPF savings.']

question: Can I use my CPF savings to repay the monies withdrawn under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer: ['CPF savings cannot be used for repayment of amounts withdrawn under the CPF Education Loan√Ç¬†scheme.']

question: How do I apply to defer the repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer: ['You may submit an application online to defer your education loan repayment through [*my cpf* Online Services - My Requests](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Miscellaneous/DeferralEducationLoanRepayment/Index) using your Singpass. You must read the Terms & Conditions and must obtain the consent of the CPF member/(s) whose Ordinary Account savings were used, before applying for deferment.']

question: If I choose not to waive the repayment, what will happen to the repayments made to my CPF Ordinary Account under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer: ['Under the CPF Education Loan Scheme, the repayments will be credited to your CPF Ordinary Account and form part of your CPF savings which you can withdraw if you are eligible to do so under the current CPF withdrawal rules.']

question: Can the repayment of the CPF Education Loan and interest be waived, especially during economic downturns?
answer:
['CPF is primarily for members√¢¬Ä¬ô retirement needs. Hence, while you can take a loan from your CPF Ordinary Account (OA) for your own or immediate family√¢¬Ä¬ôs tertiary education, the principal amount withdrawn has to be repaid to your OA, with the interest that you would otherwise have earned had the monies been left in your OA. This restores your CPF savings so that your retirement security is not worse off compared to not having taken the education loan. Retirement security remains important, if not more so, during economic downturns.
A waiver of the repayment is only allowed if you have already met your retirement needs, i.e. you are 55 years old and above and have set aside the Full Retirement Sum in your Retirement Account.']

question: Can I use my Post-Secondary Education Account (PSEA) savings to repay my outstanding education loan?
answer: ['From 1 March 2018, Post-Secondary Education Account (PSEA) holders can use their PSEA savings for full or partial lump sum repayment of their own education loan taken under the CPF Education Loan√Ç¬†Scheme. For more information on the usage of PSEA, please refer to√Ç¬†[MOE website](https://www.moe.gov.sg/education/post-secondary/post-secondary-education-account).']

question: How do I apply to use Post-Secondary Education Account (PSEA) savings to repay my outstanding education loan?
answer: ['You may submit an [online request](https://form.gov.sg/#!/5c808b72e3264100179f70e1) using your Singpass under the Loan Repayment Application via the Ministry of Education (MOE) website. Please note that your request will be submitted to MOE directly.']

question: Can I use my sibling's Post-Secondary Education Account (PSEA) to repay my outstanding education loan?
answer: ['You can only use your own Post-Secondary Education Account (PSEA) savings to repay your education loan.']

question: Is there a minimum amount for using Post-Secondary Education Account savings to repay my outstanding education loan?
answer: ['There is no minimum amount set for using Post-Secondary Education Account (PSEA)√Ç¬†savings to repay loans taken under the CPF Education Loan√Ç¬†Scheme.']

question: I intend to take a loan to finance my education and I will repay it promptly upon my graduation. Which is better for me √¢¬Ä¬ì the MOE Tuition Fee Loan (TFL) or CPF Education Loan?
answer:
['The MOE TFL is a better option as it is interest-free during the course of study, unlike the CPF loan where interest starts to accrue from the time of withdrawal. This means that if you repay the loan fully right after graduation, you will not incur any interest at all for the TFL. For scenarios comparing the two loans, please refer to the following document:
* [Comparing the CPF Education Loan Scheme and MOE Tuition Fee Loan](/content/dam/web/member/faq/other-schemes/documents/Comparison_EDNSchemeandMOETuitionFeeLoanScheme.pdf)
Additionally, being a loan from MOE, the TFL repayment and interest can be suspended in periods of economic downturn. For instance, MOE has suspended the TFL repayment and interest from 1 June 2020 to 30 September 2021 to support households affected by Covid-19, and had done so in the past as well. On the other hand, repayment of the CPF education loan and interest cannot be suspended as it is to restore the member√¢¬Ä¬ôs CPF savings for his retirement needs, and retirement security remains important, if not more so, during economic downturns.']

question: Compared to the MOE Tuition Fee Loan, isn't the CPF Education Loan a better option as I will pay the interest to my parents' Ordinary Account so that they can benefit from it?
answer:
['This is not the right way to think about it. The TFL is interest-free during the course of study. This means that if you repay the loan fully right after graduation, you will not incur any interest at all for the TFL. In other words, by not using your parent√¢¬Ä¬ôs OA savings, government will be paying your parent an OA interest of up to 3.5% during your period of study.
On the other hand, if you borrow from your parent√¢¬Ä¬ôs OA, the interest starts to accrue from the time the savings are withdrawn to pay the educational institutions. When you repay the accrued interest to your parents√¢¬Ä¬ô OA, you are simply restoring their OA to what government would have paid them anyway. There is no additional benefit to them.
Another reason why TFL is a better option is because the TFL repayment and interest can be suspended in periods of economic downturn. For instance, MOE has suspended the TFL repayment and interest from 1 June 2020 to 30 September 2021 to support households affected by Covid-19, and had done so in the past as well.
None of the above interest-free advantages on the TFL could be applied to the CPF Education Loan Scheme. This is because the interest paid by you, is what would have naturally accrued to your parents during the period of study and during the pandemic, and must be restored because CPF savings are essential to them in retirement.']

question: Is repayment required under the CPF Education Loan Scheme if the student passes away or is permanently incapacitated?
answer:
['In the event that the student passes away or has obtained a certification from an accredited doctor\* certifying that he/she is physically or mentally incapacitated from continuing in any employment, we will not recover the outstanding amount owed by the student under the CPF Education Loan Scheme.
\* The list of accredited doctors are those from government restructured hospitals, polyclinics or specialists. If clarifications are needed, a detailed medical report may be required from your doctor from the accredited list. If your doctor is not from the accredited list, you would be required to obtain an independent assessment from the Board's panel of doctors.']

question: Can I use my Post-Secondary Education Account (PSEA) savings to repay multiple education loans?
answer: ['To repay more than one loan under the CPF Education Loan Scheme, please indicate details of the loan (institution name) in the order of repayment priority in the Loan Repayment Application Form. Withdrawal of Post-Secondary Education Account (PSEA) savings for loan repayment will be made in the order specified in the application form.']

question: What courses are covered by the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer:
['Only approved full-time subsidised courses, conducted locally at the approved educational institutions, are covered by the CPF Education Loan Scheme.
Please select:
Institutions offering approved full-time subsidised undergraduate courses
You selected: **Institutions offering approved full-time subsidised undergraduate courses**
The CPF Education Loan Scheme covers all approved full-time subsidised undergraduate courses leading to a degree at the following institutions:
* Nanyang Technological University (NTU)\*,
* National University of Singapore (NUS),
* Singapore Management University (SMU),
* Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT)\*,
* Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD),
* Singapore University of Social Sciences (SUSS),
* Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA)\*,
* LASALLE College of the Arts (LAS)\*.
\*The approved degree programmes offered by these institutions in partnership with overseas universities are also included under the CPF Education Loan Scheme.
You can use CPF savings for your degree course as long as it is an approved full-time subsidised course under the CPF Education Loan Scheme, subject to the available withdrawal limit\*.
You selected: **\*available withdrawal limit**
You can use your Ordinary Account (OA) savings up to the Available Withdrawal Limit under the CPF Education Loan Scheme. The Available Withdrawal Limit is either 40% of your accumulated OA savings1, or your remaining OA balance2, whichever is lower. The amount that can be used is also subject to the tuition fees payable.
If you are 55 years old or older, you need to set aside the Full Retirement Sum (FRS) in the Retirement Account before you can use the remaining savings in the OA up to the Available Withdrawal Limit. The FRS can be set aside fully with cash, or with cash (i.e. at least the Basic Retirement Sum) and property.
The Available Withdrawal Limit will change if there is a new withdrawal, repayment or refund in your OA. To check your Available Withdrawal Limit and its working details, you can log in to√Ç¬†your [Education dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/educationdashboard)√Ç¬†with your Singpass.
1Made up of your current OA balance plus any OA savings that were previously withdrawn for education and investment, excluding the amount used for housing
2After setting aside any amounts reserved for housing or other schemes (if any).
Institutions offering full-time subsidised diploma courses
You selected: **Institutions offering full-time subsidised diploma courses**
The CPF Education Loan Scheme covers approved full-time subsidised diploma courses at:
* LASALLE College of the Arts (LAS),
* Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA),
* Nanyang Polytechnic (NYP),
* Ngee Ann Polytechnic (NP),
* Republic Polytechnic (RP),
* Singapore Polytechnic (SP),
* Temasek Polytechnic (TP),
* Institute of Technical Education (for students pursuing a Technical Engineer Diploma (TED) or a Technical Diploma in Culinary Arts)\*.
\*The approved diploma programmes offered by these institutions in partnership with overseas universities are also included under the CPF Education Loan Scheme.
You selected: **I have previously obtained government subsidies for my first diploma, hence my second diploma is not subsidised. Will I still be able to use CPF savings for my second diploma?**
As you are not eligible for government subsidies for the second diploma, CPF savings cannot be used even if it is a full-time course offered by an approved educational institution.
You selected: **I have previously obtained a degree and will study for a full-time diploma course at SP/NP/TP/NYP/RP/NAFA/LAS/ITE. The diploma course is not subsidised by the government. Can CPF savings be used for the diploma course?**
As your selected diploma course is not subsidised by the government, CPF savings cannot be used even if it is a full-time course offered by an approved educational institution.']

question: Whose CPF savings can I use under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer:
['You and/or the student can apply for this loan scheme if you meet the following conditions:
* You are using your Ordinary Account (OA) savings to pay for your own, children√¢¬Ä¬ôs, spouse√¢¬Ä¬ôs, siblings√¢¬Ä¬ô or relatives√¢¬Ä¬ô tuition fees.
* You have sufficient OA savings and Available Withdrawal Limit to be used under the CPF Education Loan Scheme.
* The course registered is a full-time subsidised diploma/degree course at an [Approved Educational Institution (AEI)](/member/faq/other-schemes/cpf-education-loan-scheme/what-courses-are-covered-by-the-cpf-education-loan-scheme).
There is no need for a guarantor, unless the student is a foreigner. Please refer to the [Terms and Conditions for Use of CPF Savings under the CPF Education Loan Scheme](/member/tnc/t-c-for-use-of-cpf-under-education-loan-scheme) on the guarantor eligibility criteria.
In√Ç¬†approved cases where:
A sibling's CPF savings is used
You selected:√Ç¬†**A sibling's CPF savings is used**
When a sibling's CPF savings is used, up to 100% of tuition fees may be paid using the sibling's CPF savings.
A relative's CPF savings is used
You selected: **A relative's CPF savings is used**
When a relative's CPF savings is used, up to:
* 10% of tuition fees may be paid using the relative's CPF savings, if the student is studying at a university;
* 25% of tuition fees may be paid using the relative's CPF savings, if the student is studying at a polytechnic, or pursuing a Technical Engineer Diploma (TED) or a Technical Diploma in Culinary Arts at an Institute of Technical Education;
* 50% of tuition fees may be paid using the relative's CPF savings, if the student is studying at an art college.']

question: How do I apply to use CPF savings under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer:
['You are required to submit only **ONE application form for each CPF member**, for your entire course of study at the approved educational institution. You do **NOT** need to re-apply or submit a new application every semester unless you have enrolled into another approved educational institution.
The steps for applying to use CPF savings under the CPF Education Loan Scheme depends on your citizenship.
Singapore Citizen or Singapore Permanent Resident
You selected: **Singapore Citizen or Singapore Permanent Resident**
If you are a **Singapore Citizen or Singapore Permanent Resident**, you may submit your application online through [*my cpf* Online Services](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Miscellaneous/UseForEducation/UseForEducationLanding) - My Requests using your Singpass. You must read the accompanying Terms & Conditions, and Procedures & Guidelines before you complete the online form.
The Board will notify the member of the amount of CPF savings paid out to the institution. For subsequent semesters, the tuition fees will automatically be paid to the institution, subject to the amount available for withdrawal from the member's Ordinary Account (OA) at the point of deduction.√Ç¬†An administrative fee of $10.70 (inclusive of GST) will be charged for each deduction from the CPF member's OA.
The CPF member (whose CPF funds would be withdrawn) and you must each have your own Singpass and valid email account.
* An√Ç¬†email\* with a Uniform Resource Locator (URL) will be sent to both the CPF member's and your e-mail address provided in your application form the next day, if your application is in order. Otherwise, you will be informed that your application has been rejected.
* The√Ç¬†CPF member\* must log in through the URL provided in the email using his/her own Singpass within 14 days from the date the application was submitted, to agree to the use of his/her CPF savings. Otherwise, your online application will be rejected.
\*This is not applicable if you are applying to use your own CPF.
Foreign Student
You selected: **Foreign Student**
If you are a **foreign student**, please obtain the 'Application for Use of CPF savings under the Education Loan Scheme' (FORM AES/F1) from your educational institution and send the completed form, together with any documents where applicable, to your institution by the deadline. Please note that you will need a guarantor to support your application. You must read the accompanying Terms & Conditions and Procedures & Guidelines before you complete the application form.
Alternatively, you may write to us at [cpf.gov.sg/writetous](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/writetous) and we will advise you on the procedures for application.
The Board will notify the member of the amount of CPF savings paid out to the educational institution. For subsequent semesters, the tuition fees will automatically be paid to the educational institution, subject to the amount available for withdrawal from the member's Ordinary Account (OA) at the point of deduction.√Ç¬†An administrative fee of $10.70 (inclusive of GST) will be charged for each deduction from the CPF member's OA.']

question: What information do I need to prepare before applying to use CPF savings under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer:
['Before you submit your application online under the CPF Education Loan Scheme:
* Check the [application period](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Miscellaneous/ApplicationScheduleToUseCpfSavings/ViewApplicationSchedule) for the institution you are applying to use CPF to pay your tuition fees.
* Ensure you are accepted by the tertiary institution and confirm that it is an approved educational institution under the CPF Education Loan Scheme.
* Establish whether you are a new (e.g. fresh intake for AY2016/2017) or existing student (e.g. 2nd year student) under the institution.
* Get ready your CPF account number or NRIC, telephone number and email address.
* Find out the CPF account number or NRIC, telephone number and e-mail address of the CPF member, whose CPF savings you are applying to use under the CPF Education Loan Scheme.
* Discuss with the CPF member on the percentage of the tuition fees you may pay using his/her CPF savings.
* Ensure you and the CPF member have your own Singpass and valid and correct email accounts.
You can refer to√Ç¬†the following FAQ for more information on the courses covered by the CPF Education Loan Scheme:
What courses are covered by the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
You selected: **What courses are covered by the CPF Education Loan Scheme?**
Only approved full-time subsidised courses, conducted locally at the approved educational institutions, are covered by the CPF Education Loan Scheme.
Please select:
The CPF Education Loan Scheme covers all approved full-time subsidised undergraduate courses leading to a degree at the following institutions:
* Nanyang Technological University (NTU)\*,
* National University of Singapore (NUS),
* Singapore Management University (SMU),
* Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT)\*,
* Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD),
* Singapore University of Social Sciences (SUSS),
* Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA)\*,
* LASALLE College of the Arts (LAS)\*.
\* The approved√Ç¬†degree programmes offered by these institutions in partnership with overseas universities are also included under the CPF Education Loan Scheme.
You selected:√Ç¬†**Can I use CPF savings for my full-time subsidised local degree course if I have previously used CPF savings for my first subsidised diploma course?**
You can use CPF savings for your degree course so long as it is an approved full-time subsidised course under the CPF Education Loan√Ç¬†Scheme, subject to the available withdrawal limit\*.
**\*available withdrawal limit**
You can use your Ordinary Account (OA) savings up to the Available Withdrawal Limit under the CPF Education Loan Scheme. The Available Withdrawal Limit is either 40% of your accumulated OA savings1, or your remaining OA balance2, whichever is lower. The amount that can be used is also subject to the tuition fees payable.
If you are 55 years old or older, you need to set aside the Full Retirement Sum (FRS) in the Retirement Account before you can use the remaining savings in the OA up to the Available Withdrawal Limit. The FRS can be set aside fully with cash, or with cash (i.e. at least the Basic Retirement Sum) and property.
The Available Withdrawal Limit will change if there is a new withdrawal, repayment or refund in your OA. To check your Available Withdrawal Limit and its working details, you can log in to your [Education dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/educationdashboard) with√Ç¬†your Singpass.
1Made up of your current OA balance plus any OA savings that were previously withdrawn for education and investment, excluding the amount used for housing
2After setting aside any amounts reserved for housing or other schemes (if any).
The CPF Education Loan Scheme covers approved full-time subsidised diploma courses at:
* LASALLE College of the Arts (LAS),
* Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA),
* Nanyang Polytechnic (NYP),
* Ngee Ann Polytechnic (NP),
* Republic Polytechnic (RP),
* Singapore Polytechnic (SP),
* Temasek Polytechnic (TP),
* Institute of Technical Education (for students pursuing a Technical Engineer Diploma (TED) or a Technical Diploma in Culinary Arts)\*.
\* The approved diploma programmes offered by these institutions in partnership with overseas universities are also included under the CPF Education Loan Scheme.
You selected: **I have previously obtained government subsidies for my first diploma, hence my second diploma is not subsidised. Will I still be able to use CPF savings for my second diploma?**
As you are not eligible for government subsidies for the second diploma, CPF savings cannot be used even if it is a full-time course offered by an approved educational institution.
You selected: **I have previously obtained a degree and will study for a full-time diploma course at SP/NP/TP/NYP/RP/NAFA/LAS/ITE. The diploma course is not subsidised by the government. Can CPF savings be used for the diploma course?**
As your selected diploma course is not subsidised by the government, CPF savings cannot be used even if it is a full-time course offered by an approved educational institution.']

question: If I have used my CPF savings to pay for my child's education, can I still use it for my other child/children?
answer:
['You can use your CPF savings to pay the tuition fees for more than one child, as long as you have available withdrawal limit (AWL) for education in your Ordinary Account.
How much of my CPF savings can I use under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
You can use your Ordinary Account (OA) savings up to the Available Withdrawal Limit under the CPF Education Loan Scheme. The Available Withdrawal Limit is either 40% of your accumulated OA savings1, or your remaining OA balance2, whichever is lower. The amount that can be used is also subject to the tuition fees payable.
If you are 55 years old or older, you need to set aside the Full Retirement Sum (FRS) in the Retirement Account before you can use the remaining savings in the OA up to the Available Withdrawal Limit. The FRS can be set aside fully with cash, or with cash (i.e. at least the Basic Retirement Sum) and property.
The Available Withdrawal Limit will change if there is a new withdrawal, repayment or refund in your OA. To check your Available Withdrawal Limit and its working details, you can log in to your [Education dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/educationdashboard) with your√Ç¬†Singpass.
1Made up of your current OA balance plus any OA savings that were previously withdrawn for education and investment, excluding the amount used for housing
2After setting aside any amounts reserved for housing or other schemes (if any).']

question: Is a guarantor required under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer:
['The need to provide a guarantor under the CPF Education Loan Scheme will depend on your citizenship.
Singapore Citizen or Singapore PR
You selected:√Ç¬†**Singapore Citizen or Singapore PR**
Since 1 April 2005, we have removed the need for Singaporean students to provide a guarantor for applications to use CPF savings for education.
Existing guarantors for Singapore Citizens or Singapore Permanent Residents under the scheme will continue to assume the responsibility of a guarantor. However, a replacement guarantor is not required in the event the existing guarantor becomes ineligible, i.e. when he passes away, becomes physically or mentally√Ç¬†incapacitated from ever continuing in any employment, or becomes an undischarged bankrupt.
The student, being the party who has enjoyed the benefit of using his own or another member's CPF savings for his education, is responsible for the repayment of the savings used.
However, we reserve the right to require you to provide a guarantor or other forms of guarantee on a case-by-case basis.
Foreign Student
You selected:√Ç¬†**Foreign Student**
Foreign students studying at an approved educational institution and are subsidised under the MOE Tuition Grant, can apply under the CPF Education Scheme. The foreign student will need to provide a guarantor for his application. Upon the death or bankruptcy of the guarantor or if the guarantor is physically or mentally incapacitated from continuing in any employment, the member whose CPF savings have been used or the foreign student will need to notify the Board in writing and a new guarantor will need to be provided.']

question: If I am a foreign student (not Singapore Citizen or Singapore Permanent Resident), can I apply under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer:
['Foreign students whose course of study at the approved educational institution is subsidised by the Ministry of Education (MOE) Tuition Grant, can apply under the CPF Education Loan Scheme.
You will need to provide a guarantor for your application. Please obtain the 'Application for Use of CPF savings under the Education Loan Scheme' (FORM AES/F1) from your institution and complete all parts of the form, including Part 4, where guarantor details are required.
If I do not wish to take up the MOE Tuition Grant, can I still apply under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
You selected:√Ç¬†**If I do not wish to take up the MOE Tuition Grant, can I still apply under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?**
CPF savings can only be used for fees that are subsidised by the Government through the Ministry of Education (MOE) Tuition Grant. You will not be able to use CPF savings to finance your tuition fees at the approved educational institutions under the scheme if you choose not to take up or is not eligible for the MOE Tuition Grant.']

question: How do I check the outstanding loan amount repayable under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer:
['For information on how to check outstanding loan amount repayable under the CPF Education Loan Scheme, please select:
As a CPF member whose CPF savings has been withdrawn from my Ordinary Account (OA), how do I check the outstanding loan amount repayable by the student under the CPF Education Loan Scheme
You selected:√Ç¬†**As a CPF member whose CPF savings has been withdrawn from my Ordinary Account (OA), how do I check the outstanding loan amount repayable by the student under the CPF Education Loan Scheme**
You may check the outstanding amount to be repaid to your OA by logging in to your [Education dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/educationdashboard)√Ç¬†with your Singpass, followed by clicking "My Messages" in the alerts. Please note that the outstanding loan amount is not the same as the net amount withdrawn under the CPF Education Loan Scheme. The outstanding loan amount includes the accrued interest that would have been earned if the monies were not withdrawn for education. The student needs to repay the accrued interest so as to fully restore the savings in your OA.
As a student making repayments, how do I check my outstanding loan amount under the CPF Education Loan Scheme
You selected:√Ç¬†**As a student making repayments, how do I check my outstanding loan amount under the CPF Education Loan Scheme** You may check your outstanding loan amount by logging in to your [Education dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/educationdashboard) with your Singpass.']

question: When will the change in my monthly instalment rate be effective under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer:
['The effective date for the new monthly instalment rate is dependent on the payment mode. Please select either one of the following:
Repayment by GIRO
You selected:√Ç¬†**Repayment by GIRO** For repayment by GIRO, you will need to change the instalment rate before 15th of the month for the change to be effective in the current month. It will generally take one working day to process the request. For example, if 15th of the month falls on a Sunday, please submit the request by 12th of the month (Thursday) if you wish for the new rate to be effective for the current month.
Repayment using other payment modes
You selected:√Ç¬†**Repayment using other payment modes**
For repayment using other payment modes, please change the instalment rate before end of the month. Generally, it will take one working day to process the request.']

question: Under what circumstances can I apply to defer the repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer:
['Upon notification√Ç¬†of the repayment start date for your CPF education loan, you may apply to defer the repayment if you meet any of the following conditions:
1. Currently√Ç¬†studying full-time either locally or overseas; or
2. Serving√Ç¬†full-time National Service; or
3. Currently√Ç¬†unemployed.
Defer repayment or lower monthly instalment rate due to financial difficulties
If you are financially affected by the COVID-19 situation, you may submit a request to either defer your repayment or repay at a lower monthly instalment rate for up to one year. You may submit the request through √¢¬Ä¬ò[My Mailbox](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/mymailbox)√¢¬Ä¬ô with the following information:
* Reason√Ç¬†for deferment or repayment through a lower monthly instalment rate;
* Declare√Ç¬†that you have sought the lending CPF member√¢¬Ä¬ôs consent to defer the repayment or repay at a lower monthly instalment rate;
* Indicate√Ç¬†the full name and NRIC of the lending CPF member and the loan that you want to defer or repay at a lower instalment rate.
What is the impact of deferring a repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
You selected:√Ç¬†**What is the impact of deferring a repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?** Please note that the maximum 12-year repayment period will be reduced by the period of deferment granted. For example, if you have 12 years for repayment and has successfully applied to defer the repayment for two years, the remaining maximum repayment period is 10 years after the deferment has ended. The monthly repayment amount may also be increased when the deferment period has ended so as to enable you to fully repay the outstanding loan within the remaining repayment period. As interest on the outstanding loan amount will continue to accrue during the deferment period, you are encouraged to start repayment as soon as you have the ability to do so. You can approach us to end the deferment earlier and to start repayment any time.']

question: What are the conditions that I have to meet before I can apply to waive the education loan repayment?
answer:
['You may apply to waive the repayment of the education loan if you have met the following conditions:
1. You√Ç¬†are aged 55 and above; ***and***
2. You√Ç¬†have set aside the [Full Retirement Sum (FRS)](/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-are-the-retirement-sums-brs-frs-ers-) in the Retirement Account. The FRS can be set aside fully with cash, or with cash (i.e. at least the Basic Retirement Sum) and property.
You can approach us to check whether you are able to waive the repayment if you are withdrawing some of your CPF savings under the Reduced Life Expectancy Scheme or are leaving Singapore and West Malaysia permanently.
Please refer to this [FAQ](/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-happens-to-my-cpf-savings-when-i-turn-55) for more information on how the retirement sum is set aside at age 55.
If I have withdrawn my CPF savings for my own education
You selected:√Ç¬†**If I have withdrawn my CPF savings for my own education** If you have withdrawn your CPF savings for your own education and have met the waiver conditions, the Board will waive the repayment when you apply for withdrawal of your CPF savings. If you do not wish to withdraw your CPF savings but wish to waive the repayment of your CPF savings for your own education, you can apply to do so if you meet the waiver conditions.
The waiver will include the total CPF savings withdrawn and the interest that would have otherwise been earned had the savings not been withdrawn under the scheme. It does not include the amount that has already been repaid and the amount used for your current course of study (if applicable). The waiver application is irrevocable.
If I have used my CPF savings for my child/spouse/sibling/relative's education
You selected:√Ç¬†**If I have used my CPF savings for my child/spouse/sibling/relative's education** If you have used your CPF savings for your child/spouse/sibling/relative's education, you will need to apply to waive the repayment. You have to meet the waiver conditions to apply.
You should only apply to waive repayment if you have no intention of continuing the use of your CPF savings for the student√¢¬Ä¬ôs current course of study. Hence, if the student is still in midst of study, you have to first revoke the use of CPF savings for future payments for the student's current course before applying to waive repayment. Alternatively, you may submit your application to waive repayment after the student has completed his/her studies. The waiver will include the total CPF savings withdrawn and the interest that would have otherwise been earned had the savings not been withdrawn under the scheme. It does not include the amount that has already been repaid by the student and the amount used for the student's current course of study (if applicable). The waiver application is irrevocable.']

question: How do I apply to waive the repayment under the CPF Education Loan Scheme?
answer:
['You may submit an application online to waive the education loan repayment through√Ç¬†[*my cpf*√Ç¬†Online Services - My Requests](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/WaiveTheRepaymentByChildren/Disclaimer)√Ç¬†using your Singpass.
Please refer to√Ç¬†the eligibility conditions to apply for waiver
You selected:√Ç¬†**Please refer to the eligibility conditions to apply for waiver**
You may apply to waive the repayment of the education loan if you have met the following conditions:
1. You√Ç¬†are aged 55 and above; ***and***
2. You√Ç¬†have set aside the [Full Retirement Sum (FRS)](/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-are-the-retirement-sums-brs-frs-ers-) in the Retirement Account. The FRS can be set aside fully with cash, or with cash (i.e. at least the Basic Retirement Sum) and property.
For CPF members who are able to withdraw some of your CPF savings under medical grounds or leaving Singapore and West Malaysia permanently, you can approach us to check whether you are able to waive the repayment.
Please refer to this [FAQ](/member/faq/retirement-income/general-information-on-retirement/what-happens-to-my-cpf-savings-when-i-turn-55) for more information on how the retirement sum is set aside at age 55.
You selected:√Ç¬†**If I have withdrawn my CPF savings for my own education**
If you have withdrawn your CPF savings for your own education and have met the waiver conditions, the Board will waive the repayment when you apply for withdrawal of your CPF savings. If you do not wish to withdraw your CPF savings but wish to waive the repayment of your CPF savings for your own education, you can apply to do so if you meet the waiver conditions. The waiver will include the total CPF savings withdrawn and the interest that would have otherwise been earned had the savings not been withdrawn under the scheme. It does not include the amount that has already been repaid and the amount used for your current course of study (if applicable). The waiver application is irrevocable.
You selected:√Ç¬†**If I have used my CPF savings for my child / spouse / sibling / relative's education**
If you have used your CPF savings for your child / spouse / sibling / relative's education, you will need to apply to waive the repayment. You have to meet the waiver conditions to apply.
You should only apply to waive repayment if you have no intention of continuing the use of your CPF savings for the student√¢¬Ä¬ôs current course of study. Hence, if the student is still in midst of study, you have to first revoke the use of CPF savings for future payments for the student's current course before applying to waive repayment. Alternatively, you may submit your application to waive repayment after the student has completed his/her studies. The waiver will include the total CPF savings withdrawn and the interest that would have otherwise been earned had the savings not been withdrawn under the scheme. It does not include the amount that has already been repaid by the student and the amount used for the student's current course of study (if applicable). The waiver application is irrevocable.']
