Please note that the outstanding loan amount is not the same as the net amount withdrawn under the CPF Education Loan Scheme. The outstanding loan amount includes the accrued interest that would have been earned if the monies were not withdrawn for education. The student needs to repay the accrued interest so as to fully restore the savings in your OA.
You selected:√Ç¬†**As a student making repayments, how do I check my outstanding loan amount under the CPF Education Loan Scheme**
You may check your outstanding loan amount by logging in to your [Education dashboard](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/educationdashboard)√Ç¬†with your Singpass.']

question: What happens to my online CPF Education Loan application that have been endorsed by the CPF member?
answer:
['If the application is successful, you will be notified on the application status generally within the next two months after the conditions have been met. You can check the application status under "My Activities" by logging in to√Ç¬†[CPF website](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/MyActivity/MyActivity)√Ç¬†with your Singpass.
For all unsuccessful/ invalid applications, it could be due to one of the following reasons √¢¬Ä¬ì
* Did not meet the eligibility criteria i.e CPF member does not have sufficient Ordinary Account savings up to the√Ç¬†[Available Withdrawal Limit](/member/faq/other-schemes/cpf-education-loan-scheme/how-much-ordinary-account--oa--savings-can-i-use-under-the-cpf-e)√Ç¬†for education purposes.
* Application was not endorsed by member within the deadline of 14 days.
* Duplicate application detected i.e it is a one-time application for the whole course of study.
You may wish to consider the√Ç¬†[MOE Tuition Fee Loan](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/other-schemes/cpf-education-loan-scheme/what-is-the-moe-tuition-fee-loan)√Ç¬†that is interest-free during your course of study, if your application for the CPF Education Loan is unsuccessful.']

question: What happens after I have endorsed the online CPF Education Loan application?
answer:
['If your application is successful, the student will be notified on the application status generally within the next two months after the conditions have been met. He/she can check the application status under "My Activities" by logging in to√Ç¬†[CPF website](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/MyActivity/MyActivity)√Ç¬†with Singpass.
For all unsuccessful/ invalid applications, it could be due to one of the following reasons √¢¬Ä¬ì
* Did not meet the eligibility criteria i.e CPF member does not have sufficient Ordinary Account savings up to the√Ç¬†[Available Withdrawal Limit](/member/faq/other-schemes/cpf-education-loan-scheme/how-much-ordinary-account--oa--savings-can-i-use-under-the-cpf-e)√Ç¬†for education purposes.
* Application was not endorsed by member within the deadline of 14 days.
* Duplicate application detected i.e it is a one-time application for the whole course of study.
You may wish to consider the√Ç¬†[MOE Tuition Fee Loan](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/other-schemes/cpf-education-loan-scheme/what-is-the-moe-tuition-fee-loan)√Ç¬†that is interest-free during your course of study, if your application for the CPF Education Loan is unsuccessful.']

question: As a bankrupt, can I use my CPF savings to buy a Housing & Development Board flat?
answer: ['You can use your CPF savings to buy a Housing & Development Board (HDB) flat as long as you are the owner of the HDB flat. Please liaise with HDB on the matter.']

question: As a bankrupt, can I use my CPF savings to buy a private property or to pay for the housing loan of my existing private property?
answer:
['If you have obtained consent from the Official Assignee to buy the private property, you can use your CPF savings for the purchase.
To start using your CPF savings to service the housing loan taken for your existing private property, regardless of whether it was purchased before or after your bankruptcy, you will also need to obtain consent from the Official Assignee for the use of your CPF savings.']

question: As a bankrupt, can I request to make a partial withdrawal and leave some monies in my CPF Account for my housing loan?
answer: ['You may request to make a partial withdrawal of your monies and leave some monies in your CPF Account for your housing loan.']

question: Can I, an undischarged bankrupt, withdraw my Retirement Account savings above the Basic Retirement Sum if I own a property?
answer:
['As an undischarged bankrupt, you can withdraw your Retirement Account savings if you own an HDB property that has remaining lease that can last you to at least 95 years old.
If you own a private property with remaining lease that can last you to at least 95 years old, you can withdraw your Retirement Account savings above your Basic Retirement Sum, provided the retirement sum you set aside (after the withdrawal) and the CPF savings you have used for the property including the accrued interest (P+I) is enough to make up your Full Retirement Sum. Otherwise, you will not be able to withdraw your Retirement Account savings above the Basic Retirement Sum because your private property is vested with the Official Assignee and no additional charge can be created on the property. For clarification on this, you may approach the Official Assignee.']

question: I am a bankrupt. If I sell my property, how much should I refund to my CPF account?
answer:
['If you are a bankrupt and you sell your property, you will need to refund the CPF principal amount withdrawn plus accrued interest ("P+I"). If you have pledged the property to make up your retirement sum, you will need to refund the pledged amount on top of the P+I.
The amount refunded will be used to meet your Full Retirement Sum in your Retirement Account. After this, any balance housing refunds will be paid to you in cash.']

question: Can I invest under the CPF Investment Scheme if I am bankrupt?
answer: ['If you are an undischarged bankrupt, you will not be able to use your CPF savings for investment. If you had previously used your CPF savings to invest, you can continue to hold your investments but you will not be allowed to make new investments. However, if you had previously used your CPF savings to invest in a regular premium insurance policy prior to your bankruptcy, you may continue to use your CPF savings to pay for your regular insurance premium subject to the Board's terms and conditions. When you subsequently liquidate your investments, the sale proceeds will be credited into your CPF Investment Account or Special Account.']

question: If I am an undischarged bankrupt member, how do I sell my shares, property funds, bonds or Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) that I have purchased under CPF Investment Scheme (CPFIS) before I became a bankrupt?
answer: ['If you have a trading account with a stockbroking firm that has been frozen due to your bankruptcy, you will have to reactivate your trading account to sell your investments. If you no longer have a trading account, you will need to open a new trading account with a [stockbroking firm](/content/dam/web/member/faq/documents/SDS_AnnexESGXBrokingFirmsforRetailClients.pdf) (PDF, 0.1MB) before you can sell your investments. However, it is at the stockbroking firm's discretion whether they will allow an undischarged bankrupt to reactivate/open a trading account. To assist the stockbroking firm to consider your request favourably, you may wish to provide them with your latest CPFIS Statement from your agent bank which lists the investment holdings that you intend to sell. You do not need to seek the CPF Board or Official Assignee's approval to sell the shares held in your CPF Investment Account.']

question: I am a bankrupt member, can I sell my Singtel (ST) shares?
answer: ['You can sell your discounted Singtel (ST) shares through SingPost. You would need to bring your identity card or passport personally to any SingPost office to sell your shares. If you are unable to go to any SingPost office personally, you may authorise someone to sell the shares for you. The authorised person must also bring along both his and your identity cards. Your signature on the original post office application form is also required.√Ç¬†You can refer to the [Frequently Asked Questions](/content/dam/web/member/faq/documents/SingPost_CPFFAQ.pdf) (PDF, 0.1MB) on selling the shares through the post office for more information. If you have a trading account with a broking firm, you may sell your discounted ST shares through your stockbroker if your stockbroker is willing to do it for you. If you do not have any existing trading account, you can also open one with any of the Singapore Exchange (SGX) [broking firms](/content/dam/web/member/faq/documents/SDS_AnnexESGXBrokingFirmsforRetailClients.pdf)√Ç¬†(PDF, 50KB). However, if you intend to trade through the internet, please check with your stockbroker before selling as broking firms generally do not allow internet trading for discounted Singtel shares.']

question: As a bankrupt, can I use the CPF Investment Scheme (CPFIS) investments that I have withdrawn to settle my judgement debts?
answer: ['Once your CPF Investment Scheme (CPFIS) investments and cash balance in your CPF Investment Account are withdrawn, they will no longer be protected from claims by your creditors and/or the Official Assignee. Please liaise with the Official Assignee on using your withdrawn CPFIS investments to settle your debts.']

question: Can I invest after I am discharged from bankruptcy?
answer: ['After your discharge from bankruptcy, you can continue to invest your CPF savings if you are at least 18 years old, subject to the investment thresholds and limits set by the Board.']

question: As a bankrupt, can my CPF savings be used to pay for my children's tertiary education?
answer: ['You may use your CPF savings for your children√¢¬Ä¬ôs tertiary education under the CPF Education scheme as long as you have the available withdrawal limit.']

question: As a bankrupt, can I use my CPF savings for my own tertiary education?
answer: ['You may continue to use your CPF savings for your own tertiary education if your application has been approved before your bankruptcy.']

question: I am a bankrupt. Can I withdraw my CPF savings?
answer:
['Under the CPF Act, you can apply to withdraw your CPF if you satisfy one of the following grounds for withdrawals:
a) have attained the age of 55 years; b)√Ç¬†are physically or mentally incapacitated from ever continuing in any employment or in such other manner as the Minister may approve; c)√Ç¬†are of unsound mind; d)√Ç¬†are suffering from a medical condition leading to a severely impaired life expectancy; or e)√Ç¬†are suffering from a terminal illness or disease.']

question: Can I continue to use my CPF savings for my existing private property housing loan if I am going to be made a bankrupt?
answer: ['If you are already an owner of the private property (including privatized Housing and Urban Development Company flats) and have used your CPF savings for your property before your bankruptcy, you may continue to use your CPF to service your housing loan.']

question: What should I include in my court order for division of CPF-related assets?
answer:
['As a guide, you may refer to these links for the suggested clauses that you may include in your court order:
* [Suggested Clauses for√Ç¬†Disclosure Orders](/content/dam/web/member/faq/other-schemes/documents/CPF_Standard_Order_for_Disclosure.pdf)√Ç¬†(PDF, 88KB)
* [Suggested Clauses in Order of Court for Charging of Monies in CPF Accounts](/content/dam/web/member/faq/other-schemes/documents/CPF_Suggested_Clauses_for_Charging.pdf)√Ç¬†(PDF, 0.6MB)
* [Suggested Clauses in Order of Court for Transfer of Monies in CPF Accounts](/content/dam/web/member/faq/other-schemes/documents/CPF_Suggested_Clauses_for_Transfer.pdf)√Ç¬†(PDF, 0.6MB)
* [Suggested Standard Clauses to include in Injunction Orders (CPF Assets)](/content/dam/web/member/faq/other-schemes/documents/Final_injunction_order_suggested_clauses.pdf)√Ç¬†(PDF, 0.1MB)
You may also wish to consult a lawyer for advice.']

question: Can CPF monies be used to settle claims for maintenance?
answer: ['Maintenance is separate from the division of matrimonial assets and represents a debt owed by the member to the ex-spouse. CPF monies cannot be used to settle claims for maintenance as section 24 of the CPF Act protects CPF savings from being seized or attached by creditors to satisfy any debt or claim.']

question: Is my ex-spouse entitled to have a share of my CPF monies upon our divorce?
answer: ['While CPF monies may be considered as matrimonial assets and a share may be given to an ex-spouse, there is nothing in the laws that give your ex-spouse an automatic entitlement. It is up to the Court to decide whether your ex-spouse is entitled to any part of your CPF monies, taking into account the matters set out in section 112 of the Women's Charter / section 52(3)(d) of the Administration of Muslim Law Act. The Court may then make an order giving your ex-spouse a share of your CPF monies, if that is the intent. For more information, please visit the [Family Justice Courts√¢¬Ä¬ô website](https://www.familyjusticecourts.gov.sg/) or [Syariah Court√¢¬Ä¬ôs website](https://www.syariahcourt.gov.sg/).']

question: Under a transfer order, does the member need to set aside his retirement sum before his ex-spouse can receive her entitlement?
answer: ['The transfer of CPF monies to the ex-spouse can take place without the member setting aside his retirement sum first. This gives his ex-spouse certainty over the amount she can receive and she can use them immediately for approved purposes such as housing, investment and education. She may also withdraw the CPF monies when she is entitled to do so.']

question: Is there a cap on the CPF transfers that can be made to the CPF Accounts under the division of CPF monies in matrimonial proceedings?
answer:
['There is no cap on the CPF transfers if so ordered by the Court. It is up to the Court to decide on the division of CPF monies and how much to transfer.
Before the Court grants the court order, the member's latest CPF statement should be made available to the Court so that it has up-to-date information on the amount of CPF monies available for the transfer. Any planned changes to the member's CPF Account status (e.g. deductions for housing payments) should also be taken into consideration.
The Board may only effect the transfers based on the available balances in the member's CPF Account upon receipt of the court order.']

question: Could the ex-spouse specify in the court order the CPF Account to receive the CPF monies under a transfer order?
answer:
['Generally, the member's CPF monies can only be transferred from the member√¢¬Ä¬ôs CPF Account to the ex-spouse√¢¬Ä¬ôs designated CPF Account. Please refer to the table below for more details:
| | |
| --- | --- |
| **From member's CPF Account** | **To ex-spouse's CPF Account** |
| Ordinary Account | Ordinary Account |
| Special/Retirement Account | Special Account (if below 55) \*Retirement Account (if 55 and above) |
| MediSave Account | MediSave Account |
\* Any amount in excess of the Full Retirement Sum that the ex-spouse needs to set aside in his CPF Retirement Account, will be transferred to his Ordinary Account.']

question: I have obtained the court order for division of matrimonial assets granted by the Courts. What do I do next?
answer:
['Please submit the court order(s) for the division of matrimonial assets via our online service using the following steps:
**For Members:**
Scan/click the QR code, login with your Singpass, and complete the form accordingly:
[![QR Code for Submit Court Order For Division Of Matrimonial Assets - Members](/content/dam/web/member/faq/images/SubmitCourtOrderForDivisionOfMatrimonialAssetsMbr_QRCode.png)](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/SubmitCourtOrderForDivisionOfMatrimonialAssetsMember/Index)
Alternatively, you may submit the court order(s) using the following steps:
1. At [CPF website](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/members), login with your Singpass for my cpf Online Services
2. Click on "My Requests" > "Other CPF Matters" > "Submit Court Order for Division of Matrimonial Assets"
3. Complete the form accordingly
**For Business Partners and Legal Aid Bureau (LAB):**
If your lawyer or LAB is submitting your court order(s), they may scan/click the QR code, login with their Singpass, and complete the form:
[![QR Code for Submit Court Order For Division Of Matrimonial Assets - BP](/content/dam/web/member/faq/images/SubmitCourtOrderForDivisionOfMatrimonialAssetsBP_QRCode.png)](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/SubmitCourtOrderForDivisionOfMatrimonialAssetsBP/Index)
Alternatively, they may submit the court order(s) using the following steps:
1. At [CPF website](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/members),√Ç¬†scroll to the bottom of the page and click on "Business partners"
2. Under √¢¬Ä¬úBusiness Partners Portal√¢¬Ä¬ù, click on √¢¬Ä¬úLog in√¢¬Ä¬ù
3. Log in with Singpass
4. Click on "Submit Court Order for Division of Matrimonial Assets"
5. Complete the form accordingly
Note: If you, your ex-spouse or your lawyers cannot submit the court order(s) via our online service, you may make an appointment at our **CPF Bishan Service Centre** via [Appointment@CPF](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/Appointments/CreateAppointmentCover) for our Customer Service Executive to assist you with the submission. On the day of the appointment, please bring along a copy of your court order(s) and your identification documents.
**CPF Bishan Service Centre** 3 Bishan Place #01-01 Singapore 579838 (near Bishan MRT Station)']

question: How long will CPF Board take to give effect to the court order?
answer: ['As court orders differ, the CPF Board will need to review them and will keep the lawyers and parties informed on the status.']

question: What are the member's obligations after the court order is issued, before and following the transfer of CPF savings in matrimonial proceedings?
answer:
['The member is obliged to comply with the court order and shall not withdraw/transfer or attempt to withdraw/transfer any amount that the ex-spouse is entitled to under the court order.
Following the transfer of the member's CPF monies to the ex-spouse's CPF Account(s), the member will then be able to use his CPF monies subject to the applicable CPF laws and terms and conditions of the CPF scheme(s) he intends to participate in.
Loans or grants taken by the member which are repayable or refundable to the Government must be repaid or refunded first before the transfer of CPF monies can take place. Grants include housing grants from Housing and Development Board (HDB) and HOPE (Home Ownership Plus Education) from Ministry of Social and Family Development (MSF).']

question: What happens if CPF monies in member's Account are not enough for the transfer to ex-spouse's designated Account under division of CPF monies in matrimonial proceedings?
answer:
['If CPF monies in member's Account are not enough for the transfer to ex-spouse's designated Account under division of CPF monies in matrimonial proceedings, the Board may only effect the transfers based on the available balances in the member's CPF Account upon receipt of the court order. The ex-spouse may seek his lawyers' advice on the remedies for the shortfall amount.
Before the Court grants the court order, the member's latest CPF statement should be made available to the Court so that it has up-to-date information on the amount of CPF monies available for the transfer. Any planned changes to the member's CPF Account status (e.g. deductions for housing payments) should also be taken into consideration.']

question: Can the ex-spouse use the CPF monies immediately upon the receipt of the transferred monies under division of CPF monies in matrimonial proceedings?
answer: ['Once CPF Board has transferred the member's CPF monies to the ex-spouse's CPF Account(s), he can use them for approved purposes such as housing, investment and education. He may also withdraw the CPF monies when he is entitled to do so.']

question: Under a transfer order, can the ex-spouse request the monies to be paid to him in cash, instead of transferring to his CPF Account?
answer: ['Under a transfer order, the monies can only be transferred from the member's CPF Account to the ex-spouse's designated CPF Account.']

question: What does the ex-spouse need to do to receive payment under a charging order?
answer:
['Parties will first need to submit the court order for the division of matrimonial assets via the online service "Submit Court Order for Division of Matrimonial Assets". We will write to the parties on the case once we have reviewed the court order.
When the member is entitled to withdraw his CPF monies, we will write to the ex-spouse on the withdrawal procedure.
Once we receive the ex-spouse's withdrawal application and the necessary documents, we will process the application and the monies will be paid to the ex-spouse within 10 working days through Inter-Bank GIRO and 15 working days via Telegraphic Transfer.
If the member/ex-spouse cannot submit the court order and/or application online, he may make an appointment at our **CPF****Bishan Service Centre** via [Appointment@CPF](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/Appointments/CreateAppointmentCover) to submit the documents. On the day of the appointment, the member/ex-spouse is required to bring along the documents and his identification documents. We will provide more information in our letter to the ex-spouse.
**CPF Bishan Service Centre** 3 Bishan Place #01-01 Singapore 579838 (near Bishan MRT Station)']

question: As an ex-spouse, what are the options if I am an undischarged bankrupt under division of CPF monies in matrimonial proceedings?
answer: ['The Court may still grant a transfer order or a charging order; similar to an ex-spouse who is not an undischarged bankrupt. However, you will need to check with the Official Assignee whether payment can be made to you under a charging order.']

question: What are the ex-spouse's (remaining party) obligations following the transfer of the property under matrimonial proceedings?
answer:
['If the Court so orders, the ex-spouse (remaining party) has to refund a sum (amount as decided by the Court) to the member√¢¬Ä¬ôs (outgoing party) CPF Account(s) upon transfer.
The Court may also order the transfer of property with no refunds to the member√¢¬Ä¬ôs CPF Account. If that is the case, upon the subsequent sale/transfer or otherwise disposal of the property, the ex-spouse would be required to refund to his own CPF Account(s), the CPF monies withdrawn (including the accrued interest) by him and the member for the purchase of the property, and any amount in respect of which the property has been pledged to make up his and the member√¢¬Ä¬ôs retirement sums.']

question: Can a member (outgoing party) transfer his share in the property to his ex-spouse (remaining party) under the division of CPF monies in matrimonial proceedings?
answer:
['Yes, the member can do so but the ex-spouse should take note of the following required refunds when the ex-spouse sells/transfers or disposes of the property subsequently:
Portion of the required CPF refund not refunded to the member's CPF account at the point of transfer of property√Ç¬†i)√Ç¬†the principal CPF monies withdrawn by the member and the accrued interest that were not refunded to the member's CPF account,√Ç¬†ii)√Ç¬†interest that would have accrued on (i) as at the date of the ex-spouse's subsequent sale/transfer or disposal of the property, and√Ç¬†iii) the member√¢¬Ä¬ôs pledged amount if he is aged 55 years old and above and had pledged the property to make up his retirement sum.√Ç¬†Ex-spouse's required CPF refund√Ç¬†iv)√Ç¬†the total principal CPF monies withdrawn by the ex-spouse and the accrued interest, and√Ç¬†v) the ex-spouse√¢¬Ä¬ôs pledged amount if he is aged 55 years old and above and had pledged the property to make up his retirement sum. If the ex-spouse is 55 years and above, the refunds will be used to top up his Retirement Account up to the Full Retirement Sum he needs to set aside. Any excess housing refunds will be paid to him.']

question: Can the courts order the sale of the member's share of the matrimonial property to the ex-spouse without any CPF refund?
answer: ['Upon the sale of the member√¢¬Ä¬ôs share of the matrimonial property to the ex-spouse, the required CPF refund has to be first returned to the member√¢¬Ä¬ôs CPF Account. The Court can then order the transfer of the refunded CPF monies from the member√¢¬Ä¬ôs CPF Account to the ex-spouse√¢¬Ä¬ôs CPF Account if it so wishes']

question: After the transfer of the matrimonial property has been done, I reached a different agreement with my ex-spouse. Can we undo the transfer?
answer: ['The CPF Board has no power under CPF laws to reverse the transfer after the CPF Board has effected the Court Order which directs such a transfer. Please seek legal advice on this.']

question: I am required to give some of my CPF Investment Scheme (CPFIS) investments to my ex-spouse as specified in the Court Order. What should I do after receiving the Court Order?
answer:
['Please submit the court order(s) for the division of matrimonial assets via our online service using the following steps:
**For Members:**
Scan/click the QR code, login with your Singpass, and complete the form accordingly:
[![QR Code for Submit Court Order For Division Of Matrimonial Assets - Members](/content/dam/web/member/faq/images/SubmitCourtOrderForDivisionOfMatrimonialAssetsMbr_QRCode.png)](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/SubmitCourtOrderForDivisionOfMatrimonialAssetsMember/Index)
Alternatively, you may submit the court order(s) using the following steps:
1. At [CPF website](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/members), login with your Singpass for my cpf Online Services
2. Click on "My Requests" > "Other CPF Matters" > "Submit Court Order for Division of Matrimonial Assets"
3. Complete the form accordingly
**For Business Partners and Legal Aid Bureau (LAB):**
If your lawyer or LAB is submitting your court order(s), they may scan/click the QR code, login with their Singpass, and complete the form:
[![QR Code for Submit Court Order For Division Of Matrimonial Assets - BP](/content/dam/web/member/faq/images/SubmitCourtOrderForDivisionOfMatrimonialAssetsBP_QRCode.png)](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/SubmitCourtOrderForDivisionOfMatrimonialAssetsBP/Index)
Alternatively, they may submit the court order(s) using the following steps:
1. At [CPF website](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/members), scroll to the bottom of the page and click on "Business partners"
2. Under √¢¬Ä¬úBusiness Partners Portal√¢¬Ä¬ù, click on √¢¬Ä¬úLog in"
3. Log in with Singpass
4. Click on "Submit Court Order for Division of Matrimonial Assets"
5. Complete the form accordingly
You should also proceed to execute the transfer/liquidation of your investments in accordance with the Court Order. Please refer to the [step-by-step guide](/content/dam/web/member/faq/documents/StepbyStepDMAguide.pdf) (PDF, 54KB) for more details on how a transfer/sale of CPFIS investments is effected from you to your ex-spouse.
Note: If you, your ex-spouse or your lawyers cannot submit the court order(s) via our online service, you may make an appointment at our **CPF Bishan Service Centre** via [Appointment@CPF](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/Appointments/CreateAppointmentCover) for our Customer Service Executive to assist you with the submission. On the day of the appointment, please bring along a copy of your court order(s) and your identification documents.
**CPF Bishan Service Centre** 3 Bishan Place #01-01 Singapore 579838 (near Bishan MRT Station)']

question: What are the obligations that my ex-spouse assumes when my investments are transferred to him/her under distribution of CPF savings in matrimonial proceedings?
answer: ['When your investments are transferred to your ex-spouse, he/she will be subjected to the CPF Investment Scheme rules (e.g. investments are subject to stock/gold limits, types of investments CPF savings could be used) so as to ensure his/her own retirement adequacy. If your ex-spouse sells the transferred investments, the sale proceeds will be credited to his/her Ordinary and/or Special Accounts, where applicable. The amount will be subject to CPF rules and can only be withdrawn when he/she meets the withdrawal conditions under Section 15 of the CPF Act. Your ex-spouse will have to pay bank charges for the transferred investments that he/she continues to hold in his/her Investment Account. Such charges can be paid using his/her Ordinary Account savings.']

question: Can the cash balance in my Investment Account be transferred under the distribution of CPF savings in matrimonial proceedings?
answer: ['Cash balances in your Investment Account can be transferred but you have to initiate the transfer of cash balance from your Investment Account to your Ordinary Account first before CPF Board can transfer the balance to your ex-spouse's Ordinary Account.']

question: What are the criteria to be fulfilled by my ex-spouse before my investments could be transferred to him/her under the distribution of CPF savings in matrimonial proceedings? What are the options if my ex-spouse could not fulfill the criteria?
answer: ['Before your investments could be transferred to your ex-spouse, he/she must be a CPF member who is Singaporean or Singapore Permanent Resident (SPR) and 21 years old and above. If your ex-spouse is below 21 years old, he/she could consider requesting the Court to order your investments to be liquidated and the sale proceeds to be transferred to his/her CPF accounts.']

question: Why do I have to effect the transfer/sale of investments under the distribution of CPF savings in matrimonial proceedings? What happens if I do not come forward to effect the transfer/sale of investments?
answer: ['You are solely responsible for presenting the Court Order and/or completing the necessary forms at the relevant financial intermediaries to effect the transfer/sale of investments because the financial intermediaries require authorisation and instruction from the owner, i.e. you. If you do not sign the transfer form, your ex-spouse may apply to the Court for the Registrar of Court to sign the transfer form on your behalf. Your ex-spouse will need to furnish the required information (eg, Divorce Petition number, both of your names, contact numbers, CPF account numbers, Investment Account numbers, names of agent banks, name of your investments, name of financial intermediaries, etc) to complete the transfer form. If you do not sell the investments as ordered, and the investments are such that they cannot be sold without instruction being given personally by you (as required by the financial intermediaries), your ex-spouse may request for the Court Order to be varied to transfer your investments to him/her instead. As this depends on the nature of the investments, your ex-spouse should make the necessary enquiries with the financial intermediaries concerned before obtaining the appropriate order.']

question: Under the distribution of CPF savings in matrimonial proceedings, which investments can be transferred? Which investments have to be liquidated for proceeds to be transferred? Who to approach for transfer/liquidation of investments?
answer: ['Please refer to the [step-by-step guide](/content/dam/web/member/faq/documents/StepbyStepDMAguide.pdf) (PDF, 55KB) for the details on the sale/transfer of investments under CPF Investment Scheme - Ordinary Account (CPFIS-OA) and CPF Investment Scheme - Special Account (CPFIS-SA).']

question: How can I submit an application to transfer CPF Investment Scheme investments sale proceeds under Division of Matrimonial Assets?
answer:
['To transfer your CPF Investment Scheme investments sale proceeds under Division of Matrimonial Assets, please submit an application via *my cpf**Online Services*:
1. Log in to *my cpf Online Services* with your Singpass
2. Select "My Requests" > "Investment" > "[Apply to transfer CPF investments sale proceeds (Division of CPF-related Matrimonial Assets)](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/MatrimonialAssetsFundTransfer/MatrimonyAssetLanding)".
Note: If you cannot submit the application via our online service, you may make an appointment at our CPF Bishan Service Centre via Appointment@CPF for our Customer Service Executive to assist you with the submission. On the day of the appointment, please bring along a copy of your court order(s) and your identification documents.
**CPF Bishan Service Centre** 3 Bishan Place #01-01 Singapore 579838 (near Bishan MRT Station)']

question: Where can I locate the application form to transfer CPFIS Investments sales proceeds under Division of Matrimonial Assets?
answer: ['To obtain the application form to transfer CPFIS Investments sales proceeds under Division of Matrimonial Assets, please login with your Singpass > select My Requests > Investment > [Apply to transfer CPF Investments Sale Proceeds (Division of CPF-related Matrimonial Assets)](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/PortalServices/MemberPortalServices)']

question: The member (outgoing party) did not use CPF monies for the matrimonial property, but pledged it to make up his retirement sum. Can the Court order a transfer of this property to the ex-spouse (remaining party)?
answer: ['The Court can order the transfer of the property to the ex-spouse without the CPF refund to the member. However, the ex-spouse will be required to make the necessary refund to his own CPF Account(s) upon the subsequent sale/transfer or otherwise disposal of property, to make up his retirement sum. This also applies to the ex-spouse if he has made a similar pledge of the property.']

question: Is CPF Board bound by Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA)?
answer: ['While the Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA) does not apply to government agencies, Government's√Ç¬†data protection standards are√Ç¬†aligned with, if not more stringent than,√Ç¬†the requirements of the PDPA. For example, we have implemented measures such as Internet surfing separation which are not required in the PDPA. These measures show how seriously the Government takes data protection. We will continue to require the same high standards in third parties√¢¬Ä¬ô handling of CPF data to prevent inadvertent disclosure of CPF member√¢¬Ä¬ôs details.']

question: Isn't it against the law for CPF Board to reveal a member's personal details publicly?
answer:
['Members√¢¬Ä¬ô data are safe with the Board and there are high standards in place to prevent its unintended disclosure. However, where misleading information is put out and widely disseminated, we must be able to provide the public with relevant facts. Where it is in the public interest, the law allows the CPF Board to release a member√¢¬Ä¬ôs personal details. This approach applies to all public agencies. It helps the public gain a fuller picture of the case and counter the misinformation, both of which are necessary to maintain the trust placed in public agencies.
The CPF Board addresses close to two million queries from members every year. Members are encouraged to approach the Board for any clarification. Members can call us at 1800-227 1188, write to us at [cpf.gov.sg/writetous](https://cpf.gov.sg/writetous), or visit any of our 5 service centres conveniently located throughout the island.']

question: What is Central Provident Fund (CPF)?
answer: ['The Central Provident Fund (CPF) is a comprehensive social security system that enables working Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents to set aside funds for retirement. It also addresses healthcare, home ownership, family protection and asset enhancement. Working Singaporeans and their employers make monthly contributions to the CPF and these contributions go into three accounts: **Ordinary Account** - the savings can be used to buy a home, pay for CPF insurance, investment and education. **Special Account** - for old age and investment in retirement-related financial products. **MediSave Account** - the savings can be used for hospitalisation expenses and approved medical insurance. Please refer to the [CPF website](/member/cpf-overview) for an overview of CPF.']

question: What is the mission and vision of CPF Board?
answer: ['The CPF Board's mission is:√Ç¬†"To enable Singaporeans to have a secure retirement, through lifelong income, healthcare financing and home financing."√Ç¬†Our vision:√Ç¬†"A trusted and respected social security organisation, committed to enable Singaporeans to have a secure retirement."']

question: What does the CPF logo represent?
answer:
['**About the CPF Logo**
| | |
| --- | --- |
| CPF Logo | The circle emphasises the completeness of the CPF system as a national social security savings scheme. The shield represents security and protection for our members in their retirement. The three keys represent the unity of the tripartite relationship among Employees, Employers and the Government. Lastly, the use of the colour green in our logo highlights the need for CPF's constant growth and dynamism. |']

question: I am a Singapore Citizen working in India. Do I need to contribute to the India's Employees' Provident Fund (EPF)?
answer: ['The Singapore Government is aware that Singapore Citizens working in India have been required to contribute to India's Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) and has been negotiating with India's Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) to exempt Singapore Citizens from this requirement. As of 1 January 2016, Singapore Citizens working in India will no longer have to contribute to the EPF. If you have previously contributed to the EPF, you will be able to withdraw your past contributions, but only after your employment contract in India ends. Please visit [Ministry of Trade and Industry website](https://www.mti.gov.sg/MTIInsights/Pages/Comprehensive-Economic-Cooperation-Agreement---EPF-Exemption0404-7686.aspx) for more information. The relevant forms should be sent to the Certifying Authority (MFA, MTI) for certification. Members can approach MFA or MTI for assistance. For more information on the India-Singapore Comprehensive Economic Cooperation Agreement or contributions to India's Employment Provident Fund by Singapore Citizens, please contact MTI at [MTI\_email@mti.gov.sg](mailto:MTI_email@mti.gov.sg).']

question: What is available at CPF Self-Help Lobby?
answer: ['E-kiosks are available at our Self-Help Lobby for CPF members who need to access our digital services.']

question: Why am I not allowed to use my bank account with a non-local bank to receive payments from CPF Board?
answer: ['To better protect members from scams, we will only accept bank accounts where the bank is able to provide automated bank account verification to CPFB. This ensures that payment will only be made to a bank account belonging to the member. Currently, only POSB, DBS, OCBC and UOB are able to provide this service. We welcome any other bank to set up similar arrangements with us.']

question: Why is there a new √¢¬Ä¬úText us (pilot)√¢¬Ä¬ù option for me to contact CPF Board?
answer: ['CPF Board is constantly seeking ways to enhance the service experience of our members. We are piloting text messaging on WhatsApp as an additional option for your enquiries - making it easier for you to get quick clarifications on the go for questions not found on the CPF website. As this text messaging service is in its pilot phase, the option to correspond via WhatsApp is only available for selected CPF services. Please visit [Contact us](/member/contact-us) page for the available service channels to reach us.']

question: How do I send my enquiry via text messaging?

Our text messaging service is available:
* Monday - Friday: 8:30am to 5:00pm
* Saturday, Sunday and public holidays: Closed
* Eves of Christmas, New Year and Chinese New Year: 8:30am to 12:00pm']

question: Why am I unable to make an appointment at the Service Centre more than 2 weeks in advance?
answer:
['Based on our experience, the 2-week advance booking meet the needs of majority of CPF members.√Ç¬†There are more than sufficient appointment slots available, even as early as the next working day at any of the Service Centres.√Ç¬†Those who need to book an appointment beyond the 2 week period can come back at a later date to make the booking.
Most organisations do not provide appointment bookings too far in advance as customers could have resolved the issue during the interim period. This results in a higher no-show rate and does not optimise our customer service officer's time, which could have been better used to serve other customers in need.']

question: How early can I make an appointment at the Service Centre?
answer: ['Service Centre appointment bookings are opened 2 weeks in advance.']

question: Why does CPF Board refer my case to another organisation?
answer: ['CPF Board is committed to providing the best possible assistance to those in need. To make sure you get the right kind of support, we√¢¬Ä¬ôll look at your situation and assess whether there are other organisation(s) with more appropriate assistance tailored to your needs. If the situation warrants, we will refer your case to our partner organisation(s) that have the right assistance programme(s) and expertise to better assist you.√Ç¬†Please inform us explicitly if you do not want us to refer your case to our partner organisation(s). CPF Board is committed in ensuring your data is protected. You may refer to our [privacy statement](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/privacy-statement) for more details.']

question: What is this √¢¬Ä¬úReferrer Name√¢¬Ä¬ù field in the CPF online services?
answer:
['CPF Board has launched a new volunteer and partner engagement initiative in April 2021. This **C**ommunity **P**aying it **F**orward movement encourages individuals to share CPF information and help others improve their understanding of CPF so as to make informed decisions on the use of their CPF savings.
We have introduced a √¢¬Ä¬úReferrer Name√¢¬Ä¬ù field in selected CPF online services to thank volunteers who have made a positive impact on members and our volunteering movement. If someone has shared the CPF scheme or service with you, please leave the referrer√¢¬Ä¬ôs detail with us. By doing so, we can extend our appreciation to these individuals and assess the effectiveness of this initiative.']

question: How did the √¢¬Ä¬úCommunity Paying it Forward√¢¬Ä¬ù movement come about?
answer:
['This movement rides on a widely popular concept known as √¢¬Ä¬úPay it Forward√¢¬Ä¬ù. A simple way of explanation is that by helping three people, who in turn each help three more people and so on, we can help many more people collectively.
As CPF is an essential component in planning for our retirement, it is important for us to understand how we can maximise our CPF savings. Therefore, after benefitting from this information ourselves, we can also pay it forward by sharing it with others, so that they too, can make the most of what the CPF system has to offer.
![Pay it forward](/content/dam/web/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/images/Pay_it_forward.png)']

question: Where can I find out more about this CPF Volunteering initiative?
answer:
['To learn more about the purpose of CPF Volunteering initiative, **[watch why and how](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=skp5O2Fo1jk)**our volunteers have been paying it forward.
Alternatively, you can also read our [infographic](/content/dam/web/member/faq/documents/CPFV-infographic-for-faq-2023.pdf) for more information on **C**ommunity **P**aying it **F**orward.']

question: What is this volunteer and partner engagement about?
answer:
['In line with the **Singapore Together** movement to encourage Singaporeans to partner the government in building a shared future, we are involving individuals like you, to share CPF information with members to support their retirement planning. Through a **C**ommunity **P**aying it **F**orward movement, you can do good by helping others within your social circles to improve their understanding of CPF schemes and make informed decisions on the use of their CPF savings. Training will be provided to facilitate accurate sharing of CPF information.
If you are interested in joining this initiative, you can download our CPF Volunteering (CPFV) mobile app and register with us by tapping on √¢¬Ä¬úSign up now√¢¬Ä¬ù. It is available on both [App Store](https://cpf.gov.sg/cpfvi)√Ç¬†and [Google Play](https://cpf.gov.sg/cpfva) (search for keyword: CPFV).
![CPFV Logo](/content/dam/web/member/faq/images/CPFV-icon_2048_greyborder.png)
You can also scan the QR code to download the app and√Ç¬†register with us.√Ç¬†![CPFV mobile app QR code download iOS](/content/dam/web/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/images/CPFV_mobile_app_iOS.png)![CPFV mobile app QR code download Android](/content/dam/web/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/images/CPFV_mobile_app_Android.png)']

question: What are the roles and responsibilities of a CPF volunteer?
answer:
['Unlike conventional volunteering, there is generally no upfront time commitment and CPF volunteers have the flexibility to choose when or how they would like to share CPF information with people around them. However, do take reference to our code of ethics, by being impartial and objective when sharing information about CPF and to keep yourself updated on CPF matters.
As the CPF Volunteering (CPFV) initiative grows, we are also expanding the opportunities in which volunteers can contribute their personal stories, skills etc. As a volunteer, you may have the opportunity to star as our guest speaker in CPF webinars or participate in other co-creation efforts. Active and interested volunteers can also reach out to us to suggest possible collaborations.']

question: What does the CPF Volunteering (CPFV) mobile app offer?
answer:
['Our CPF Volunteering (CPFV) app serves as a one-stop platform for volunteers and partners of CPF Board to:
1. Register with us as a volunteer of CPF Board
2. Receive CPF updates and access onboarding and training resources on CPF
3. Network with other like-minded individuals
4. Be guided on how they can pay it forward through various opportunities to do good
5. View personal achievements and impact of one√¢¬Ä¬ôs contributions']

question: I√¢¬Ä¬ôm interested to register as a CPF volunteer. How do I sign up?

1. Download the CPF Volunteering (CPFV) mobile application, available on both [Apple App Store](https://cpf.gov.sg/cpfvi) and [Google Play Store](https://cpf.gov.sg/cpfva). You can also scan the QR code to download the app and register.

Your orientation and training resources will be availed to you via our CPFV app.']

question: How does CPF Board appreciate volunteers under the Community Paying it Forward movement?
answer:
['Through our CPF Volunteering (CPFV) mobile app, volunteers can enjoy a gamified experience and gauge the impact of their sharing through fun elements to understand how this act of √¢¬Ä¬úPaying it Forward√¢¬Ä¬ù has helped members in their retirement planning. We are deeply appreciative of these extraordinary individuals who have stepped forward to help fellow CPF members be better prepared for their retirement. Apart from an annual appreciation event, we will also extend thank-you emails to those who have been exceptional in touching the lives of CPF members under this movement.
To encourage our volunteers to do more in spreading kindness and spurring more Singaporeans to take actions to plan for their retirement, our volunteers are also entitled to CPFV seasonal event prizes and benefits from our corporate partners, such as Resorts World Sentosa, Shopee,√Ç¬†ComfortDelGro Taxi, Ya Kun, Lazada, NTUC Income and MoneyOwl, an NTUC Social Enterprise.
Additionally, we also aim to host regular learning workshops with our senior advisor and engagement sessions amongst the volunteers. Participants who opt to attend the learning workshops can enhance their knowledge regarding CPF√¢¬Ä¬ôs schemes and policies. During the sessions, they may also ask and clarify any doubts they have. Volunteers may register for the engagement sessions to become familiar with a larger community of like-minded individuals.']

['You need to download and sign up via our CPF Volunteering (CPFV) mobile application even though you had previously signed up via our online form. By doing so, you will be able to participate in the **C**ommunity **P**aying it **F**orward movement with like-minded individuals, access CPF online resources on the go, experience a gamified journey, view your personal achievements and the impact of your contributions.
You can download our CPF Volunteering (CPFV) mobile app and tapping on √¢¬Ä¬úSign up now√¢¬Ä¬ù. It is available on both [App Store](https://cpf.gov.sg/cpfvi)√Ç¬†and [Google Play](https://cpf.gov.sg/cpfva) (search for keyword: CPFV).
![CPFV Logo](/content/dam/web/member/faq/images/CPFV-icon_2048_greyborder.png)
You can also scan the QR code to download the app and√Ç¬†register with us.√Ç¬†![CPFV mobile app QR code download iOS](/content/dam/web/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/images/CPFV_mobile_app_iOS.png)![CPFV mobile app QR code download Android](/content/dam/web/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/images/CPFV_mobile_app_Android.png)']

question: What is an E-Xperience Guide and how do I register to be one?
answer:
['CPF Board has launched the E-Xperience Space at the newly renovated Tampines Service Centre, with a dedicated area for guiding and training members on the use of the Board√¢¬Ä¬ôs digital transaction services. Volunteers who are keen to become an E-Xperience Guide, will be trained by CPF Board officers to conduct the workshops to members of the public.
To sign up as an E-Xperience Guide, simply [register your interest](https://form.gov.sg/6269f62c00c1b80011d9b0a6) with us.']

question: If I discover any wrongdoing by a CPF volunteer, what action should I take?
answer:
['We do not tolerate any [wrongdoings](/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/cpf-volunteering/what-are-the-types-of-wrongful-practices) by volunteers in their course of advocating for CPF. If you come across any wrongdoings, it is important that you report it via our [online reporting form](https://www.form.gov.sg/64479e8bf6b50300121437d8 "Online reporting form for wrongdoings") so that appropriate action can be taken. Please ensure that you record the response ID once you have completed the form in the event you need to provide new information/ changes to the report.
By reporting the wrongdoing, you can help to ensure that our volunteers are held accountable for their actions and that steps are taken to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future.
All reports should be made in good faith, without any personal agenda, or ulterior motive, and when there are reasonable grounds to suspect that an incident of wrongful practice has occurred.']

question: What are the types of wrongful practices?
answer:
['Examples of wrongful practices include, but not limited to the following:
* Violation of [CPFV√¢¬Ä¬ôs code of ethics (PDF, 0.1MB)](/content/dam/web/member/infohub/documents/Code%20of%20Ethics_CPF%20Volunteering%20Programme.pdf),
* Fraud or deliberately providing false or incorrect information,
* Violation of intellectual property rights,
* Financial and non-financial malpractices']

question: What information do I need to provide when I report a wrongdoing?
answer:
['We have outlined the key information to provide when you report a wrongdoing by following the 4Es:
1. **Elaboration of the wrongdoing:** Describe the nature of the wrongdoing. Include when and where it occurred, who was involved, whether any money or assets are involved.
2. **Evidence:** Provide any evidence you may have, such as photographs and emails, that support your claims of wrongdoing.
3. **Eyewitnesses:** If there are witnesses to the wrongdoing, provide their names and contact information so that they can be contacted for further information.
4. **Essential contacts and your identity:** Providing your identity and contact information will allow us to verify your claims and follow up on any additional information if required. Reports made anonymously may lack credibility and hinder follow-ups.
Please be assured that all reports will be treated with confidence and every effort will be made to ensure that confidentiality is maintained throughout the process.']

question: How can I provide new information or make changes to a previous report on wrongdoing?
answer:
['To provide us with new information or make changes to a previous report on wrongdoing, please email us at [volunteer@cpf.gov.sg](mailto:volunteer@cpf.gov.sg) and include the following information:
1. Your name
2. Contact number
3. FormSG response ID that you submitted previously']

question: Will I be further involved after making a report on wrongdoing?
answer: ['We may contact you for more information after you made a report on wrongdoing. Please ensure that you have the necessary evidence or supporting documents if you are being contacted.']

For assistance on CPF-related matters, you can [make an appointment](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/appt/oas/form) to visit any of our Service Centres or to speak with our Customer Service Executive over the phone.√Ç¬†Please note that counter services are available by appointment only.']

question: I have a new CPF account after getting my new Singapore identity card. What happens to my Singpass?

If you have received your Singpass for the new account, you can continue using that Singpass.']

question: How do I change or reset my Singpass password online?
answer:
['To change or reset your Singpass password, please complete the following steps:
1. [Visit Singpass website](https://www.singpass.gov.sg/)
2. Select 'Log in'
3. Select √¢¬Ä¬òReset password√¢¬Ä¬ô (under the √¢¬Ä¬òServices√¢¬Ä¬ô tab)
4. Follow the instructions on the website to complete the changing or resetting of Singpass password
If you require further assistance, please contact the Singpass Helpdesk at [support@singpass.gov.sg](mailto:support@singpass.gov.sg) or +65 6335 3533. The operating hours are from 8am to 8pm (Mondays to Fridays) and from 8am to 2pm (Saturdays) excluding Sundays and public holidays.']

question: My mobile number/email address is outdated. How can I update my records in Singpass?
answer:
['To update your mobile number/email address with Singpass, please complete the following steps:
1. Login to the [Singpass website](https://www.singpass.gov.sg/)
2. Select √¢¬Ä¬òMenu√¢¬Ä¬ô > √¢¬Ä¬òUpdate profile√¢¬Ä¬ô (under the √¢¬Ä¬òMy Account√¢¬Ä¬ô tab) and follow the instructions on the website to complete the updating of your mobile number/email address
Please ensure that you have access to your mobile phone/email as a One-Time Password (OTP) will be sent to your updated mobile number/email address for verification.
If you require further assistance, please contact the Singpass Helpdesk at [support@singpass.gov.sg](mailto:support@singpass.gov.sg) or +65 6335 3533. The operating hours are from 8am to 8pm (Mondays to Fridays) and from 8am to 2pm (Saturdays) excluding Sundays and public holidays.']

question: I have renounced my Singapore Citizenship and I can no longer use my Singpass to access my CPF Statement. How do I access my CPF Statement?
answer:
['You may [write to us](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/FeedbackSubscription/Index) for CPF-related assistance.
For information, only the following groups of users are eligible to apply for Singpass:
* Singapore Citizen and Permanent Resident
* Employment Pass and Personalised Employment Pass holders
* EntrePass holders
* S-Pass holders
* Dependant Pass holders (of EP, PEP, EntrePass and S-Pass holders)
* Long Term Visit Pass-Plus (LTVP+) holders
* Selected Work Permit (WP) Holders who require Singpass authentication to perform e-Service transactions. Please access [WP Online](https://wponline.mom.gov.sg/WPOLLoginController?action=WPOLLoginAction&actionType=WPOLNonLogin) to check your status.']

question: What is "my cpf Online Services"?
answer: ['[*my cpf* Online Services](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/PortalServices/WelcomePage) is a series of personalised online services available to help you manage your CPF savings better. With these services, you will get an overview of your CPF balances and transactions. You will also be able to check the status of your online applications and view personalised messages from us in a secure environment, at your convenience!']

question: What is "My Statement"?
answer:
['"My Statement" gives you an overview of your CPF Account balances, as well as the amount of CPF that can be used for education, investment and housing.
Please login to√Ç¬†[*my cpf* Online Services](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/PortalServices/MemberPortalServices) - My Statement with your Singpass and 2-Step Verification (2FA) to access the service.
If you do not have a Singpass and/or 2FA, please visit√Ç¬†[Singpass website](http://www.singpass.gov.sg/)√Ç¬†for more information.']

question: How do I print a particular section or statement in "My Statement"?
answer: ['Please click on the Portable Document Format (PDF) / Print Link to save and/or print the relevant section or statement in "My Statement".']

question: What is "My Requests" and what is available in "My Requests"?
answer:
['"My Requests" is a user-friendly service that enables you to apply for the various CPF schemes and services in a guided manner. With "My Requests", you will be able to apply for the following schemes and services:
* CPF LIFE
* Building Up My / My Recipient's CPF Savings
* Retirement (e.g. Retirement Sum & Age 55 applications)
* Property
* Home Protection Scheme (HPS)
* Healthcare Matters
* Investment
* Self Employed Matters
* Nomination Details
* Withdrawal on Non-Retirement Grounds (Death and Medical Grounds)
* Education / Dependants' Education
* GIRO Matters
* Other CPF Matters
Please login to√Ç¬†[*my cpf* Online Services](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/PortalServices/MemberPortalServices) - My Requests with your Singpass and 2-Step Verification (2FA) to access the service.']

question: How do I amend/cancel an online request?
answer: ['You are unable to amend/cancel any online request that has been submitted. If you wish to make any changes, please [contact us](/member/contact-us).']

question: What is "My Activities"?
answer:
['"My Activities" informs you of the latest status of all your online or hardcopy transactions with the Board. At one glance, you will be able to tell whether your application is received, being processed, rejected or approved.
Please login to [*my cpf* Online Services - My Activities](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/MyActivity/MyActivity) with your Singpass and 2 Step Verification (2FA) to access the service.']

question: How can I view my online forms I have submitted and their status?
answer: ['Once you have made your selection, confirm your submission. An acknowledgement page will be displayed to confirm your submissions. You can check the status of your online submission through [My Activities](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/PortalServices/MemberPortalServices).']

question: How can I save the information in My Activities?
answer:
['You can save the information by taking the following steps: 1. Go to File -> Save As
2. Within the drop-down box "Save as type", select "Web Archive, single file (\*.mht)"
3. Click on the button "Save"
The information saved is what you see currently. View My Activities again for the latest updates.']

question: How can I inform CPF Board of a change in my mobile number or email address?

An SMS or email One-Time PIN (OTP) will be sent to your new mobile number or email address for verification before the changes take effect.
If you are an employer, you should inform CPF Board as soon as possible of the change in your contact details as below:

| CPF EZPay related matters | [CPF EZPay](https://www2.cpf.gov.sg/ert/dsa/spcpSelection.action) with Singpass |']

question: What is responsive web design or mobile responsive website?
answer: ['Mobile responsive pages will automatically fit mobile screens, without having to pinch or zoom in/out to see contents clearly.']

question: Why am I unable to view the Notification Messages after closing it?
answer: ['After closing the Notification Message via the √¢¬Ä¬òx√¢¬Ä¬ô on the top right corner of the Message, it is collapsed at the top right corner of the Account Balances section in a √¢¬Ä¬úShow Notifications√¢¬Ä¬ù button. To view the message again, click on this button and the √¢¬Ä¬úNotification Message√¢¬Ä¬ù section will expand again.']

question: How can I view more months of contributions within the detailed contributions table?
answer: ['In the Contributions section, within the detailed contributions table, up to the past 6 months of contributions are available. To view more months of contributions, click on the √¢¬Ä¬úView contribution history up to the last 15 months√¢¬Ä¬ù at the bottom of the Contributions section, and select √¢¬Ä¬úContribution History up to the last 15 months√¢¬Ä¬ù. Thereafter, select the period of the contributions which you want to view.']

question: How can I view more months of transactions within the detailed transactions table?
answer: ['In the Transactions section, within the detailed transactions table, up to the past three months of transactions are available. To view more months of transactions, click on the √¢¬Ä¬úView transaction history up to the last 15 months√¢¬Ä¬ù at the bottom of the Transactions section, and select √¢¬Ä¬úTransaction History up to the last 15 months√¢¬Ä¬ù. Thereafter, select the period of the transactions which you want to view.']

question: Within the detailed transactions table, there are green, pink and green/pink circles. What do these circles mean?
answer: ['In the Transactions section, within the detailed transactions table, there are green, pink and green/pink circles. A green circle represents that the transaction is a Credit (Money In). A pink circle represents that the transaction is a Debit (Money Out). A green/pink circle represents that the transaction has both Credit (Money In) and Debit (Money Out) occurring, e.g. transfer of funds from OA to SA.']

question: How can I download CPF Mobile?
answer: ['You can download CPF Mobile directly to your mobile phone from either the [Apple App Store](http://itunes.apple.com/sg/app/cpf-tools/id389277976?mt=8) or the [Google Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=gov.sg.cpf.mycpf).']

question: Do I have to pay to use CPF Mobile?
answer: ['CPF Mobile is a free service provided by CPF Board. However, you would need to bear any data charges that might be charged by your service provider. Please check with your mobile service provider for details of the charges. M1: 1627 SingTel: 1626 StarHub: 1633']

question: What is OCBC Pay Anyone?
answer: ['OCBC Pay Anyone is a payment mobile app to allow OCBC customers to transfer funds and receive funds, as well as make payment to organisations. For more information, do [visit OCBC Pay Anyone](https://www.ocbc.com/personal-banking/online-banking/payanyone.html).']

question: What are the CPF payment services available for PayNow QR and OCBC Pay Anyone?
answer: ['PayNow QR and OCBC Pay Anyone payment options are available for all payment services in CPF Mobile. You may use PayNow QR or OCBC Pay Anyone to top up Special Account/Retirement Account (SA/RA Top-Up) or refund funds used for your housing (Housing Refund).']

question: Where can I find the PayNow QR and OCBC Pay Anyone option?
answer: ['Customers will be able to select the PayNow QR or OCBC Pay Anyone option under the √¢¬Ä¬òPayment Mode√¢¬Ä¬ô page in CPF Mobile after confirming the transaction details. Please note that OCBC Pay Anyone payment option√Ç¬†will only be available to customers who have installed OCBC Pay Anyone mobile app.']

question: What is the payment limit for PayNow QR and OCBC Pay Anyone?
answer: ['The payment limit for PayNow QR and OCBC Pay Anyone is currently up to $200,000. Please ensure you have updated your banking transaction limits with your respective banks.']

question: Why can't I find the OCBC Pay Anyone option in CPF Mobile?
answer: ['The OCBC Pay Anyone option is only available to customers who have installed the Pay Anyone app on their mobile devices. Customers will be able to select the OCBC Pay Anyone option under the 'Payment Mode' page in CPF Mobile after confirming the transaction details.']

question: Why do I encounter a Security Warning Message when I login to my cpf  Online Services or other online application?
answer: ['The transaction you're performing makes use of a Secure Socket Layer (SSL) digital security certificate. This allows you to conduct safe e-transactions with 256-bit encrypted SSL connections. Essentially, this digital certificate is an electronic document which your browser uses to authenticate our server and initiate the encryption processes. The certificate is like a stamp of approval that also carries the information needed to activate the SSL process.']

question: What should I do when I see the Security Warning Message?
answer:
['You can click "Yes" to proceed with your intended transaction. However, the message will appear when you login the next time. For a long-term solution, please do the following:
Click on the 'View Certificate' button.
1. Click on the 'Install Certificate' button.
2. Click on the 'Next' and 'Finish' buttons as required to accept and install the certificate.
3. Click "Yes" when you see 'Do you want to ADD the following certificate to the Root Store?'
4. Click 'Ok' as required.
5. Click 'Yes' to the Security Alert warning which may still be being displayed.']

question: I am a foreigner. I can√¢¬Ä¬ôt seem to be able to login to CPF digital services using my Singpass, why is it so?
answer:
['With the discontinuation of the OneKey Token from 1 April 2021, foreign CPF members will no longer be able to access CPF digital services using the Singpass which was registered under their CPF issued account numbers (e.g. SA987654C or TC123456A) previously.
Foreign CPF members with CPF issued accounts and are currently holding FIN may apply for a new Singpass under the FIN to access CPF digital services for their CPF SA/SB/TC account. You may refer to the√Ç¬†Singpass website at√Ç¬†[singpass.gov.sg](https://www.singpass.gov.sg/)√Ç¬†for the steps to apply.
CPF members who do not meet the above criteria may√Ç¬†[Write to Us](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/FeedbackSubscription/Index)√Ç¬†for assistance.']

question: What are the e-payments I can make using e-Cashier?
answer:
['You can make the following e-payments via [e-Cashier](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Miscellaneous/Cashier/ECashierHomepage)
As a member:
1. Pay HPS Premium shortfall
2. Contribute to my three CPF accounts
3. Contribute to my own/recipient√¢¬Ä¬ôs MediSave Account
4. Repayment of Education Loan
As a self-employed:
1. Contribute to my three CPF accounts
2. Contribute to my MediSave Account
3. Composition Offer for Self-Employed']

question: How do I make a PayNow payment to CPFB using the e-Cashier?
answer:
['Please submit an application on e-Cashier and select the PayNow option. A unique PayNow QR code will be generated after you have submitted your application. To complete your payment, please scan the PayNow QR code with a participating bank or payment app, or save the QR code on your device and upload it into the banking or payment app by the end of the day.
*Note: **Please do not make payment using CPFB√¢¬Ä¬ôs UEN, or change the payment details after scanning the PayNow QR code**. If you do so, we are unable to process your application and we will refund the payment to you.*']

question: Can I make more than one payment using the same QR code?
answer: ['No, the QR code generated is unique to your submitted application. Should you require to make another payment, please submit another application. A new QR code with the required payment details will be generated for you to make another payment.']

question: What if I made more than one payment using the same QR code?
answer: ['You should only use the generated QR code for one payment as the QR code generated is unique. If there is more than one payment, the subsequent payment will be refunded to you.']

question: I received an SMS/email informing me that I will receive CPF notifications via my Singpass registered email address and/or mobile number. Is this legitimate?
answer:
['Your Singpass contact information was shared with us so that we can update you on your CPF matters in a timely and efficient manner. This is part of the whole of government effort to provide you with a seamless digital experience.
If you prefer us to contact you via a different email address or mobile number, you can update your mobile number and/or email address via the [Account settings](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/account-settings) page√Ç¬†with your Singpass. An SMS or email One-Time PIN (OTP) will be sent to your new mobile number or email address for verification before the changes can take effect.']

question: I have updated my email address/mobile number with Singpass. Why are my Singpass contact details not updated with CPF Board?
answer:
['Updates to your Singpass mobile number and email address will not be automatically updated with the Board.
You can instantly update your mobile number and/or email address via the [Account settings](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/account-settings) page with your Singpass. An SMS or email One-Time PIN (OTP) will be sent to your new mobile number or email address for verification before the changes can take effect.']

question: What is the difference between General and Personalised Notifications?
answer:
['General Notifications are notifications that contain non-sensitive information such as alerts on educational articles, CPF tips and events.
Personalised Notifications are notifications that contain personal information such as alerts on CPF contributions.']

question: How do I enable / disable push notifications on my mobile device?
answer:
['For General Notifications, go to your device settings to turn on notifications.
For Personalised Notifications, tap on the √¢¬Ä¬òside menu√¢¬Ä¬ô icon located on the top left corner of the app and select √¢¬Ä¬òSettings√¢¬Ä¬ô. Toggle the switch to enable personalised Push Notifications.']

question: Can I enable personalised push notifications on multiple mobile devices?
answer: ['No, you can only enable personalised push notifications on one mobile device at any time. If you had already enabled personalised push notifications on one device, enabling it on another device will disable the personalised notifications on your older device.']

question: How long will the message stay in the notification list?
answer: ['The content will be available for 15 months from the notification date and will be removed automatically thereafter.']

question: How do I delete the messages in the notification list?
answer: ['You can delete the message by tapping on the √¢¬Ä¬òBin√¢¬Ä¬ô icon in the notification detail page.']

question: How do I read the full content of push notifications?
answer:
['You can view the full content of the push notification via three ways:
1. Tap on the banner and it will bring you to view the full content of the notification.
2. Before logging into the app, tap on the √¢¬Ä¬òbell√¢¬Ä¬ô icon located at the top left corner.
3. After logging into the app, tap on the √¢¬Ä¬òbell√¢¬Ä¬ô icon located at the top left corner of the side menu.']

question: Do I need to log in to access personalised notifications on CPF Mobile?
answer: ['Yes, Singpass login is required to view your personalised notifications.']

question: Can I still view my past notifications if I change to a new mobile device?
answer: ['Yes, you will have access to your past personalised notifications after you have successfully enabled notifications on your new mobile device. Notifications sent in the past 15 months will be available.']

question: I lost my mobile device. How can I disable personalised notifications?
answer: ['In the event that you lose your mobile device, you can enable personalised notifications on your new mobile device. By doing so, there will be no personalised notifications sent to your missing mobile device.']

question: How do I disable personalised notifications before I sell my mobile device?
answer: ['You can disable personalised notifications at the app settings page. It is recommended that you uninstall CPF Mobile before selling your mobile device.']

question: I received an email/WhatsApp/SMS with a password protected link that is only available for a limited period. How can I view the information in the link after it expires?
answer: ['After you have successfully entered the password, you can click on ![](/content/dam/web/member/faq/images/pdficon.png) to save a copy of your personal information in PDF format to view them conveniently from your devices (e.g. laptop, mobile) anytime.']

question: Why is there a need to provide mobile number/email address to CPF Board?
answer:
['For greater convenience and faster updates on your personal CPF matters, you will be receiving digital notifications via email or SMS from us.
You are encouraged to update your mobile number and email address with us to receive digital acknowledgements for your transactions.
If you do not have an email address, you may want to create a Gmail, Yahoo mail, Outlook or Hotmail address. Please visit their websites for details on how to create an email address for free.']

question: I am a FIN holder. How do I access CPF digital services?
answer:
['You may login to CPF digital services using your Singpass registered under your FIN.
If you have a CPF issued account (e.g. SA987654C or TC123456A) and your FIN is updated with us, you will be prompted to select your transaction profile (either CPF issued account or FIN) after you log in.']

question: What is the minimum requirement to access CPF Mobile on my mobile device?
answer:

Keeping your Operating System (OS) updated is crucial to maintain the security of your mobile device and ensure compatibility with our mobile app. Furthermore, up-to-date OS improves performance and offers a better user experience.
You can update your OS via the following steps:
* For iPhone users: Go to Settings > General > Tap on √¢¬Ä¬úSoftware Updates√¢¬Ä¬ù
* For Android users: Go to Settings > System > Tap on √¢¬Ä¬úSystem Update√¢¬Ä¬ù (may vary by device)']

question: How can I benefit from electronic payments?
answer:
['You can benefit in the following ways with electronic payment modes:
* Easy and convenient
* Faster processing time
* Secure and seamless transaction']

question: What browsers are compatible with my cpf digital services?

1. Chrome

question: Why is CPF Board rolling out Chinese translations for selected features in CPF Mobile?
answer: ['We√Ç¬†are introducing this translation pilot to the Dashboard and √¢¬Ä¬òCash Top-Up and CPF Transfers√¢¬Ä¬ô service in CPF Mobile to gauge customers√¢¬Ä¬ô usage and feedback for this vernacular feature. We plan to extend this to other features progressively.']

question: How can I update my subscription preferences for my CPF notifications?
answer:
['You can update your subscription preferences via the√Ç¬†[Account settings](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/account-settings)√Ç¬†page with your Singpass. Once you have logged in with Singpass, click on the √¢¬Ä¬úSubscription√¢¬Ä¬ù tab. You can choose to receive notifications on CPF educational content and events, as well as alerts on your CPF contributions, by clicking on the respective check boxes.
You can unsubscribe from such notifications anytime. Even if you unsubscribe from receiving educational content, please rest assured that you will still receive key notifications on CPF transactions and policies through your registered contact details.']

question: What is "My dashboards" and what is available in "My dashboards"?
answer:

Please login to the following *my cpf* digital services √¢¬Ä¬ì My dashboards with your Singpass and 2-Factor Authentication (2FA) to access the information.
