question: What is "My Mailbox" and how do I access it?
answer:
['√¢¬Ä¬úMy mailbox√¢¬Ä¬ù is a secure platform that enables you to write in to give feedback or make enquiries and appeals regarding your CPF account.
Please login to *my cpf* digital services √¢¬Ä¬ì [My Mailbox](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/mymailbox) with your Singpass and 2-Factor Authentication (2FA) to access the platform.']

question: When is the next scheduled maintenance of the CPF website and mobile app?
answer: ['The next maintenance schedule will be published here approximately 1-3 days before the maintenance.']

question: Why is the Board still sending links in SMS messages?
answer:
['Website links remain a legitimate means for the Board to point citizens to useful services and information. To ensure that a link genuinely leads to the CPF website or another Government website, you should always check that the domain ends with √¢¬Ä¬ú.gov.sg√¢¬Ä¬ù.
We will not ask users to provide their credentials, such as passwords, through websites directly accessed through SMS links.
Find out how else to [protect yourself from falling prey to phishing scams.](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/electronic-services/how-do-i-avoid-falling-prey-to-phishing-scams)']

question: Why doesn√¢¬Ä¬ôt CPF Mobile offer all the services found on CPF website?
answer: ['CPF Mobile and CPF website complement each other to serve different needs of our customers as we deliver a multi-channel digital experience. CPF Mobile provides easy access to popular services such as viewing account balances to allow one to access CPF information on the go, while the website allows customers to access the full suite of CPF digital services.']

question: How do I avoid falling prey to phishing scams?
answer:
['Your financial safety matters to us. Please stay vigilant and beware of scam or phishing attempts. Here are some tips on how to protect yourself against phishing scams pretending to come from CPF Board:
1. Do not share your Singpass ID / password or banking details with anyone. If you need to discuss confidential matters with us over the phone, we will request you to perform an authentication using your Singpass. CPF officers will **NOT** ask for your Singpass or banking userid or password.
2. Stay vigilant and only click on links from trusted sources. Always log in to your account from the official CPF website.√Ç¬†To determine if a link will lead you to a malicious website or is reliable, you can hover your mouse over the link to view the full address. For mobile devices, you can hold your finger down on the link so that a window pops out and shows you the full address of the link.
3. Do verify the sender
* For email, ensure that the sender√¢¬Ä¬ôs email address is correctly spelt and√Ç¬†ends with @cpf.gov.sg or @e.cpf.gov.sg
* For WhatsApp, ensure that the sender is √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù, our official business account, with a green badge. ![](/content/dam/web/member/faq/images/cpfwhatsappgreenbadge.png)
* For SMS, ensure that the sender is √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù from 1 Aug 2022. We will not send SMS from other IDs.
* Telephone calls from CPF officers to you will not begin with a prefix "+65". If a call has a prefix with a plus (+) sign, it is likely to be an overseas call.
* Messages from CPF Board may contain links to the CPF website or other Government websites. Please check that the domain of such links end with √¢¬Ä¬ú.gov.sg√¢¬Ä¬ù before clicking on them.
4. Do report any suspicious call or digital notifications spoofing CPF Board via our [CPF official hotline](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/contact-us/call-us) or [Writetous](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/FeedbackSubscription/Index).
Be **C**autious, **P**ay attention to scam and don√¢¬Ä¬ôt be the next victim of **F**raud.']

question: Why is payment via eNETS discontinued with effect from 23 April 2023?
answer: ['CPF Board regularly reviews the services and payment options we provide to our customers. Payment via eNETS will be discontinued from 23 April 2023 because payments made by customers via eNETS are unable to be updated in the members√¢¬Ä¬ô accounts instantaneously. Customers can use PayNow QR or OCBC Pay Anyone via our digital services on CPF website and CPF Mobile to make payment and these transactions will be processed instantaneously.']

question: What should I do if I face difficulty logging into CPF Mobile?
answer:
['Here are some ways for you to troubleshoot when encountering login issues:
1. Check your internet connection to ensure it is stable.
2. Relaunch CPF Mobile and try to log in again.
3. Make sure your device operating system and CPF Mobile are updated to the latest version.
4. Check that your device date-time setting is set to √¢¬Ä¬úAutomatic√¢¬Ä¬ù.
5. Try logging in to other government websites/apps to determine if the issue occurs on these other platforms.
If the issue persists, please [write to us](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/writetous) for further assistance.']

question: What should I do if I face difficulty logging into my cpf digital services?
answer:
['Here are some ways for you to troubleshoot when encountering login issues:
1. Check your internet connection to ensure it is stable.
2. Clear your browser cache before trying again (please refer to this [link](https://www.wikihow.com/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache) for instructions on how to clear the cache for all major browsers).
3. Relaunch CPF website and try to log in again.
4. Check that your browser is updated. *my cpf* digital services is compatible with the latest two versions of these [commonly used browsers](/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/electronic-services/what-browsers-are-compatible-with-my-cpf-digital-services).
5. Check that your device date-time setting is set to √¢¬Ä¬úAutomatic√¢¬Ä¬ù or the current date and time
6. Try logging in to other government websites to determine if the issue occurs on these other platforms.
If the issue persists, please [write to us](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/writetous) for further assistance.']

question: Why am I receiving push notifications on my mobile device when I did not enable them on CPF Mobile?
answer: ['For early detection of unauthorised changes to contact details, push notifications are enabled on CPF Mobile automatically. You can change your setting at the app settings page of your mobile device.']

question: What is Supplementary Retirement Scheme?
answer:
['The Supplementary Retirement Scheme (SRS) is part of the Government's multi-pronged strategy to address the financial needs of a greying population. It is a voluntary scheme that complements the CPF. Participants can contribute a varying amount to SRS (subject to a cap) at their own discretion. The contributions may be used to purchase various investment instruments. The SRS offers attractive tax benefits. Contributions to SRS are eligible for tax relief, investment returns are accumulated tax-free (with the exception of Singapore dividends), and only 50% of the withdrawals from SRS are taxable at retirement.
You may wish to find out more information on [SRS](https://www.iras.gov.sg/irashome/Schemes/Individuals/Supplementary-Retirement-Scheme--SRS-/).']

question: What is Singpass?
answer: ['Singpass stands for Singapore Personal Access and it is your common password to transact with the Government online. Please visit [Singpass website](http://www.singpass.gov.sg/) for more information on Singpass.']

question: How do I get a Singpass?
answer:
['To obtain a Singpass, you can either:
1. visit [Singpass](https://www.singpass.gov.sg/) website to apply for your Singpass online or
2. visit any of the [Singpass counters located islandwide](https://www.singpass.gov.sg/home/ui/counter-locations) in-person.']

question: Where can I find advice on tax issues?
answer: ['For tax issues, such as queries on IR8A form, please visit [IRAS's website](http://www.iras.gov.sg/).']

question: How do I know if I need to submit my Income Tax Return?
answer: ['You may wish to visit [IRAS website](http://www.iras.gov.sg/irashome/default.aspx) for more details. Alternatively, you may wish to contact IRAS at [1800 356 8300](tel:1800) for further assistance.']

question: How do I check my outstanding Housing & Development Board (HDB) loan?
answer: ['For issues related to your Housing & Development Board (HDB) flat, such as checking your outstanding HDB loan, please visit [HDB's website](http://www.hdb.gov.sg/).']

question: Does Housing & Development Board (HDB) offer any measures if I fail to service my monthly HDB housing payments?
answer: ['Housing & Development Board (HDB) has several measures to help HDB mortgagors who are in financial difficulty to service their monthly housing payments. These include rescheduling your loan, reducing or deferring payments, and paying arrears by instalments. Please check [www.hdb.gov.sg](http://www.hdb.gov.sg/) for details, call HDB's toll-free Branch Office Service Line at [1800-866 3030](tel:18008663030), or approach your relevant HDB Branch Office for advice.']

question: How do I apply for Housing & Development Board (HDB)'s financial assistance measures?
answer: ['Housing & Development Board (HDB) has several measures to help HDB mortgagors who are in financial difficulty to service their monthly housing payments. The details are at [www.hdb.gov.sg](http://www.hdb.gov.sg/). Mortgagors who have difficulty servicing their mortgage payments can call the toll-free HDB Branch Office Service Line at 1800-866 3030 for advice on the financial assistance measures that best suit their needs. They can also approach their HDB Branch Office managing their flats for assistance.']

question: How to make use of Edusave funds?
answer: ['For Edusave issues, please visit [Ministry of Education's website](https://www.moe.gov.sg/).']

question: What is baby bonus?
answer: ['The Baby Bonus Scheme supports parent's decision to have more children by helping to lighten the financial costs of raising children. It was introduced on 1 April 2001 and enhanced on 1 August 2004. The latest enhancements on 17 August 2008 extended increased benefits to the first and second child benefits to Singapore citizens beyond the fourth child. Please visit our website [www.babybonus.msf.gov.sg](https://www.babybonus.msf.gov.sg/) for more details.']

question: I have issues with my Singpass. What should I do?
answer:
['Singpass is an authentication service governed by GovTech. CPF Board is one of the government agencies using Singpass and its 2FA service.
If you have any Singpass issues (e.g. unable to login via Singpass, lost Singpass token, forgot Singpass password, unable to receive SMS OTP), please call the Singpass helpdesk at +65 6335 3533 or email [support@singpass.gov.sg](mailto:support@singpass.gov.sg).']

question: Why is Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS) allowed to recover unpaid taxes/ MediShield Life premiums when I withdraw my CPF savings?
answer: ['Taxes go towards funding of government expenditure; and to support the government's economic and social programme to ensure quality growth and an inclusive society. Most taxpayers pay their taxes on time. To encourage voluntary compliance where every taxpayer contributes their fair share of tax, there are penalties if taxes are not paid on time. Actions to recover the unpaid taxes may include appointment of agents such as CPF Board.√Ç¬†Under the law, IRAS is empowered to appoint CPF Board as an agent for the recovery of unpaid taxes/MediShield Life premiums. IRAS would have informed you that CPF Board has been appointed as agent to recover the unpaid taxes/MediShield Life premiums when you withdraw your CPF savings.√Ç¬†You may approach IRAS at 6356 7012 to discuss alternative arrangements to settle your unpaid taxes/MediShield Life premiums before submitting your withdrawal application.']

question: I received an SMS from √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù informing me that there is a change in the Board√¢¬Ä¬ôs SMS sender ID. Is it legitimate?
answer:
['Yes, the SMS is legitimate. From 1 Aug 2022, the Board will use SMS sender ID, √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù, to send messages pertaining to your CPF, Workfare and Silver Support matters. You received the SMS because you have a registered mobile number with the Board. You may [check or update your mobile number](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/account-settings) with your Singpass.
To protect yourself against scams, you are encouraged to keep the SMS on your mobile device so that you can be assured that any future SMSes received on this same Sender ID would be legitimate. Only the Board can send SMSes using this ID.']

question: Why is CPF Board standardising the SMS sender ID to √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù?
answer: ['The use of a single SMS sender ID √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù allows you to easily verify the legitimacy of messages sent by the Board. Only the Board can send SMSes using this ID.']

question: How does CPF Board ensure that the new SMS sender ID will not be spoofed by scammers?
answer:
['The Board has registered the new SMS sender ID with the Singapore SMS Sender ID Registry (SSIR), a setup by Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA). The SSIR can identify and block spoofed messages upfront, and prevent scammers from pretending to be CPF Board.
Only the Board can send SMSes using the new sender ID. SMSes appearing under √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù are legitimate messages sent by the Board.
Please remain vigilant as scammers may use variations of a legitimate sender ID to attempt to trick unsuspecting recipients.
Find out how else to [protect yourself from falling prey to phishing scams.](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/electronic-services/how-do-i-avoid-falling-prey-to-phishing-scams)']

question: I used to receive SMSes from √¢¬Ä¬úSG-Workfare√¢¬Ä¬ù and √¢¬Ä¬úSG-SSS√¢¬Ä¬ù on Workfare and Silver Support matters respectively but stopped receiving such SMSes after the change in SMS Sender ID to √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù. Why is that so?
answer: ['We have standardised all SMSes sent to use the sender ID of √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù. Please check that you have registered your mobile number with us at the [CPF website.](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/account-settings)']

question: What should I do with the previous SMS messages from CPF Board?
answer: ['We will no longer send SMSes from √¢¬Ä¬úCPFBOARD√¢¬Ä¬ù, √¢¬Ä¬úSG-Workfare√¢¬Ä¬ù, √¢¬Ä¬úSG-SSS√¢¬Ä¬ù from 1 Aug 2022. You may save the previous messages for your personal reference or delete them as you wish.']

question: Why am I receiving the SMS from √¢¬Ä¬úCPFBoard√¢¬Ä¬ù instead of √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù?
answer:
['There are specific phone models which automatically remove the spaces in sender ID. It mainly affects Apple users with iOS version 12 and below.
You can be assured that all SMSes appearing in the thread under √¢¬Ä¬úCPFBoard√¢¬Ä¬ù are legitimate messages sent by the Board.']

question: How do I view my CPF Yearly Statement of Account?
answer: ['You can view, print and/or download your CPF Yearly Statement of Account√Ç¬†via Singpass login at [*my cpf*√Ç¬†digital services](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/).']

question: I would like a hardcopy of my CPF Yearly Statement of Account. Where can I get it?
answer:
['You can:
* Print your CPF Yearly Statement of Account (YSOA) for the past 10 years via Singpass login at [*my cpf*√Ç¬†digital services](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/).
* Print your CPF YSOAs at the Citizen Connect Centres (CCCs) with printing facilities in selected Community Clubs (CC). The CCC provides internet-enabled devices for the public to perform selected transactions with the Government online (includes printing statements).√Ç¬†You can refer to the [locations of CCCs with printing facilities](/content/dam/web/member/account-services/documents/List%20of%20CCs%20with%20CitizenConnect%20Centres%20Dec%202022.pdf)(PDF, 0.1MB) for more information. Please call the respective community clubs/centres to check on the opening hours and availability of print services before making your way there.
* Have a hardcopy of your latest YSOA mailed to your registered address through our Interactive Voice Response System (1800 227 1188). This service operates from 8:30am to 10:00pm daily. Please refer to the [guide](/content/dam/web/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/documents/Updated%20design%20for%20Interactive%20Call%20Flow%20to%20request%20YSOA_2023.pdf) (PDF, 0.1MB) for the steps.']

question: Can I request to receive my hardcopy Yearly Statement of Account annually?
answer:
['As part of our efforts to go green, members will receive their Yearly Statement of Account (YSOA) digitally in place of hardcopy statement. This initiative is being rolled out in phases. We have also enhanced our digital YSOA and encourage you to try it out.
If you still need a hardcopy of your latest YSOA, you can have a hardcopy mailed to you through our Interactive Voice Response System (1800 227 1188). Please refer to the [guide](/content/dam/web/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/documents/Updated%20design%20for%20Interactive%20Call%20Flow%20to%20request%20YSOA_2023.pdf) (PDF, 0.1MB) for the steps. This service operates from 8:30am to 10:00pm daily.']

question: How do I read my Digital Yearly Statement of Account?
answer:
['You can view the guide on the Digital Yearly Statement of Account (YSOA) in your preferred language below:

[YSOA Illustrated Summary Guide √¢¬Ä¬ì Malay](/content/dam/web/member/account-services/documents/YSOA_IllustratedSummary_Malay.pdf) (PDF, 0.46MB)

question: What is the total employment contribution I received for the year?
answer:
['You can sum up the √¢¬Ä¬úEmployee Contribution√¢¬Ä¬ù under the √¢¬Ä¬úYou√¢¬Ä¬ù category and √¢¬Ä¬úEmployer Contribution√¢¬Ä¬ù under √¢¬Ä¬úEmployer√¢¬Ä¬ù category to derive the total employment contributions for the year.
For more details on the rates, see [rates for Singapore Citizens and Singapore Permanent Residents](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/employer-obligations/how-much-cpf-contributions-to-pay).']

question: How do I derive the breakdown of employer and employee's contributions indicated on my Yearly Statement of Account?
answer:
['The breakdown of the employer and employee's CPF contributions√Ç¬†is meant to be indicative as general assumptions were used in the derivation. They are derived based on the amount submitted by your employer(s) in the past year as well as the assumptions below:
1. Employee is a:
* Singapore Citizen; or
* 3rd year and onwards√Ç¬†Singapore Permanent Resident; or
* 1st and 2nd year Singapore Permanent Resident who has jointly applied with employer to pay full employer and employee CPF contribution rates;
2. Employee with multiple employments did not apply to limit their share of contribution on Ordinary Wage;√Ç¬†3. Multiple CPF contributions√Ç¬†made by the employer in the particular month were calculated on a per transaction basis rather than on an aggregated basis;√Ç¬†4. The following are excluded in the breakdown:√Ç¬†* Adjustment(s) and refund(s) requested by employer(s);
* Voluntary CPF contributions made by your employer(s) or yourself; and
* MediSave contributions as a Self-employed Person.
To determine the exact breakdown of your CPF contributions based on your total wages per month; please use our [CPF contribution calculator](/employer/tools-and-services/calculators).']

question: What are the Government cash grants included in the Yearly Statement of Account?
answer:
['Please refer to the table below for the participating schemes included in the Yearly Statement of Account (YSOA). question: How do I derive the interest indicated in my Yearly Statement of Account?
answer: ['Please refer to the [CPF interest page](/member/growing-your-savings/earning-higher-returns/earning-attractive-interest) for more information on CPF interest. Details on [extra interest](/member/faq/growing-your-savings/cpf-interest-rates/how-much-extra-interest-can-i-earn-on-my-cpf-savings) and [how CPF interest rates are determined](/member/faq/growing-your-savings/cpf-interest-rates/how-are-cpf-interest-rates-determined)√Ç¬†can be found in our FAQs.']

question: How do I save, download or print a copy of my Digital Yearly Statement of Account?
answer:
['On the Digital Yearly Statement of Account (YSOA)√Ç¬†page, click on√Ç¬†![the PDF icon](/content/dam/web/member/faq/images/pdficon_pbs.png) to open and print/save a copy of your YSOA.
You can also download a copy of your statement to view on your mobile device.']

question: What should I do if I think the information in my CPF statement is incorrect?
answer: ['You can seek further clarification and provide the relevant supporting documents via [Write to Us](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/writetous)√Ç¬†if you think that the information in your CPF statement is incorrect.']

question: If I am granted sole custody of my child following a divorce, can I request to remove my ex-spouse√¢¬Ä¬ôs access to our child√¢¬Ä¬ôs CPF statement?
answer: ['Yes, please submit a request via √¢¬Ä¬ú[My Mailbox](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/MyMailbox/MyMailboxLanding)√¢¬Ä¬ù using your Singpass and attach the Court Order as a supporting document.']

question: Can I view my child√¢¬Ä¬ôs CPF statements online?
answer:
['You can view your child√¢¬Ä¬ôs Transaction History statement as well as the MediSave and Healthcare Insurance Claims and Reimbursement statement (if applicable) for the last 15 months online if:
1. You and your child are Singapore Citizens or Permanent Residents, and
2. Your child is below the age of 21 and has received CPF contributions (including Government Grants such as MediSave Grant for Newborns).
Simply login to [*my cpf* Home > Child Dashboard](http://cpf.gov.sg/childdashboard)√Ç¬†with your Singpass to access this information.
If you do not see your child√¢¬Ä¬ôs name listed in the Child Dashboard, please submit a request via √¢¬Ä¬ú[My Mailbox](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/MyMailbox/MyMailboxLanding)√¢¬Ä¬ù with the following supporting documents and we will be happy to assist.
**Supporting documents required:**
1. Birth certificate of your child
2. Citizenship certificate if your child was a foreigner at birth (where applicable).']

question: Why am I receiving this notification from CPF Board? Is it legitimate?
answer:
['We are piloting a new service to notify members that their monthly CPF transaction statement is ready for viewing. Notifications are sent to members who were selected to participate in our pilot trials. These notifications will only be sent to the email address that you have registered with the Board. You may [check or update your email address](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/account-settings)√Ç¬†with your Singpass.
To verify whether the notification is legitimate, check that the email is sent from **do\_not\_reply@e.cpf.gov.sg.**
If you have downloaded the latest version of the CPF Mobile app, you will be directed to the CPF Mobile app upon clicking the link.
If you have not downloaded the latest version of the CPF Mobile app, or you are viewing your statement on a desktop or laptop, you will be directed to our official CPF website (link starting with cpf.gov.sg) on your web browser to view your statement.
Find out [how you can protect yourself from phishing links](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/infohub/educational-resources/how-to-protect-yourself-from-phishing-links?cid=cpfprel:bn:bau:alsgm:cpfoverview:cpf101:cpfclarifications).']

question: I would like to check my past transaction records. How can I do so?
answer: ['You can access transactions up to the past 15 months via Singpass login at [*my cpf* digital services](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/statements/transaction-history).']

question: I would like a hardcopy of my monthly transaction statement. Where can I get it?
answer:
['You can print your monthly transaction statement via the link provided in our notification.
You can also print your transaction history for the past 15 months via Singpass login at [*my cpf* digital services](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/statements/transaction-history).√Ç¬†For information, the Citizen Connect Centres (CCC) in selected Community Clubs (CC) provides internet enabled devices for the public to perform selected transactions with government online (includes printing statements). Please refer to the [locations of CCCs](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/member/account-services/documents/List%20of%20CCs%20with%20CitizenConnect%20Centres%20Dec%202022.pdf)√Ç¬†(PDF, 0.1MB) for more information.']

question: I did not see interest credited into my accounts in my monthly transaction statement. Why is this so?
answer: ['Interest is computed monthly, credited and compounded annually. For more details, please refer to the FAQ on '[How is my CPF interest computed and credited into my accounts](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/growing-your-savings/cpf-interest-rates/how-is-my-cpf-interest-computed-and-credited-into-my-accounts)'.']

question: Will I continue to receive the same notification and transaction statement format every month from now?
answer: ['As we are still piloting this new service, we may not always send the same notification and could send a different format of transaction statement..']

question: How do I update my contact details?
answer: ['You can update your mobile number and/or email address via *my cpf* digital services √¢¬Ä¬ì [Account settings](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/account-settings)√Ç¬†with your Singpass. An SMS or email One-Time PIN (OTP) will be sent to your new mobile or email address for verification before the changes take effect.']

question: How can I download or print my monthly transaction statement?
answer:
['You can save a PDF copy or print your monthly transaction statement by using your laptop/desktop to access the link provided in the email notification.
You can also access your online 15-month transaction history via the CPF Mobile app or CPF website, and print or download your monthly transaction statement from there.']

question: How do I stop receiving my hardcopy Yearly Statement of Account?
answer: ['As part of our efforts to go green, we have transformed the Yearly Statement of Account (YSOA) into a digital statement. If you wish to go green and stop receiving a hardcopy YSOA, please [submit a request](https://form.gov.sg/636084afd3c4cd00123164ce) to us. Singpass login is required.']

question: Is the notification from CPF Board relating to the Yearly Statement of Account (YSOA) legitimate? Why am I receiving the notification?
answer:
['Notifications are sent to members who have registered their contact details with CPF Board.
To verify whether the notification is legitimate, check that the notifications are sent from the following sender:
| | |

Find out [how you can protect yourself from phishing links](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/infohub/educational-resources/how-to-protect-yourself-from-phishing-links?cid=cpfprel:bn:bau:alsgm:cpfoverview:cpf101:cpfclarifications).']

question: What is the Year-in-Review?
answer:
['The Year-in-Review (YIR) is a personalised statement prepared for you on your birthday.
When you open your YIR, you will see an overview of your CPF account balances, inflow and outflow and key milestones in the last 12 months from your birthday month. It will also inform you on what to look out for in the next 12 months.
The YIR also includes useful resources and steps that you can consider to start your retirement planning.
Your YIR will be refreshed every year on your birthday.
You can [access your YIR](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/statements/year-in-review)*(Singpass required)* if you have celebrated your birthday this year.√Ç¬†Otherwise, you can look forward to receiving your YIR on your birthday.
View the [YIR guide](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/statement-of-account/how-do-i-read-my-year-in-review) on how to read your YIR.']

question: How do I read my Year-in-Review?
answer:
['You can view the guide on the Year-in-Review (YIR) below:
[Year-in-Review Guide](/content/dam/web/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/documents/Year_in_Review_Guide.pdf) (PDF, 0.56MB)']

question: How is the Year-in-Review different from the CPF Yearly Statement of Account?
answer:
['The Year-in-Review (YIR) is designed to give you an overview of your CPF account balances, inflow and outflow in the last 12 months from your birthday month. It also includes key milestones within the last 12 months and things to look out for in the next 12 months from your birthday month. You will also see a link to the [CPF Retirement Planning Service](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/planners/cpf-retirement-planning-service) which allows you to set your own retirement goal.
The CPF Yearly Statement of Account (YSOA) will give you an overview of your CPF transactions for the past calendar year.']

question: Why can√¢¬Ä¬ôt I see my Year-in-Review?
answer: ['You will be able to view your Year-in-Review (YIR) from your birthday.']

question: Why are my transactions not included in my Year-in-Review?
answer:
['The Year-in-Review (YIR) gives you an overview of your CPF account balances, inflow and outflow in the last 12 months from your birthday month. If the transactions happened more than 12 months from your birthday month, it would not appear.
For a detailed list of transactions, you may refer to [your transaction history](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/statements/transaction-history) to access transactions up to the past 15 months.']

question: The format of my monthly transaction statement looks different from that received previously. Can I request to receive it in the previous format?
answer:

We understand that you would like to have your statement displayed in the previous format. You can view your statement in tabular form in the PDF version by using your laptop/desktop to access the link provided in the email notification and clicking on the PDF icon found on the top right corner of the statement page.']

question: How do I avoid falling prey to phishing scams?
answer:
['Your financial safety matters to us. Please stay vigilant and beware of scam or phishing attempts. Here are some tips on how to protect yourself against phishing scams pretending to come from CPF Board:
1. Do not share your Singpass ID / password or banking details with anyone. If you need to discuss confidential matters with us over the phone, we will request you to perform an authentication using your Singpass. CPF officers will **NOT** ask for your Singpass or banking userid or password.
2. Stay vigilant and only click on links from trusted sources. Always log in to your account from the official CPF website.√Ç¬†To determine if a link will lead you to a malicious website or is reliable, you can hover your mouse over the link to view the full address. For mobile devices, you can hold your finger down on the link so that a window pops out and shows you the full address of the link.
3. Do verify the sender
* For email, ensure that the sender√¢¬Ä¬ôs email address is correctly spelt and√Ç¬†ends with @cpf.gov.sg or @e.cpf.gov.sg
* For WhatsApp, ensure that the sender is √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù, our official business account, with a green badge. ![](/content/dam/web/member/faq/images/cpfwhatsappgreenbadge.png)
* For SMS, ensure that the sender is √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù from 1 Aug 2022. We will not send SMS from other IDs.
* Telephone calls from CPF officers to you will not begin with a prefix "+65". If a call has a prefix with a plus (+) sign, it is likely to be an overseas call.
* Messages from CPF Board may contain links to the CPF website or other Government websites. Please check that the domain of such links end with √¢¬Ä¬ú.gov.sg√¢¬Ä¬ù before clicking on them.
4. Do report any suspicious call or digital notifications spoofing CPF Board via our [CPF official hotline](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/contact-us/call-us) or [Writetous](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/FeedbackSubscription/Index).
Be **C**autious, **P**ay attention to scam and don√¢¬Ä¬ôt be the next victim of **F**raud.']

question: I received an email/WhatsApp/SMS with a link asking me to enter a password before I can view my personal CPF information. Is it legitimate?
answer:
['For greater convenience and faster updates on your personal CPF matters, the Board will be sending you digital notifications via email, WhatsApp or SMS. These notifications will only be sent to the mobile number/email address that you have registered with the Board. You may check or update your [mobile number and/or email address](https://cpf.gov.sg/mynotifications) with your Singpass.
As some notifications may contain information relating to personal CPF accounts/transactions, we have protected it with a unique link for each individual CPF member. Only the intended recipient with the correct password and unique link will be able to view the information. You should always check that the domain of such links end with √¢¬Ä¬ú.gov.sg√¢¬Ä¬ù before clicking on them.']

question: I received a call/email/WhatsApp message from the Board regarding my enquiry. Is it a scam?
answer:
['The Board may respond to enquiries via calls, emails and WhatsApp messages. You can protect yourself against phishing scams by doing the following checks:
* For email, ensure that the sender's email address is correctly spelt and ends with @cpf.gov.sg or @e.cpf.gov.sg
* Telephone calls from CPF officers to you will not begin with a prefix "+65". If a call has a prefix with a plus (+) sign, it is likely to be an overseas call.
* Telephone calls from CPF Call Centre responding to your enquiry will be made from 68454401.
* For WhatsApp, ensure that the sender is from "CPF Board" or √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board Text us√¢¬Ä¬ù, our official business accounts, with the green badge. CPF Board![A screenshot displaying CPF Board as the sender of legitimate WhatsApp messages from the Board](/content/dam/web/member/faq/images/CPFBoardWhatsApp.png)CPF Board Text us![A screenshot displaying CPF Board Text us as the sender of legitimate WhatsApp messages from the Board](/content/dam/web/member/faq/images/CPFB-Whatsapp-Text-us-resized.png)
* Messages from CPF Board may contain links to the CPF website or other Government websites. Please check that the domain of such links end with ".gov.sg" before clicking on them.
To ensure that you do not miss out on our replies and notifications, please check and update your contact details under√Ç¬†[Account Settings](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/account-settings)√Ç¬†(Singpass required).']

question: What is email spoofing?
answer: ['Email spoofing is a form of cyberattack in which emails are manipulated to make it seem as if they are sent by a trusted source. Email spoofing is used in phishing attempts because people are more likely to open an email when they think it has been sent by a known sender. Email scammers try to trick recipients into opening or responding to the message.']

question: Why is CPF Board sending emails to advise members about email spoofing?
answer:
['The Board uses email as one of its channels to communicate with CPF members. While we have implemented email security measures to prevent scammers from impersonating us, these measures work only if email service providers also implement such protection at their end. We have developed a utility tool √¢¬Ä¬úEmail receiver checker√¢¬Ä¬ù (beta version) that you can easily use to check whether your email service provider has in place the protection known as Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting and Conformance (DMARC).
CPF Board is sending emails to a small number of members so that they can try out the utility tool and provide feedback about it. These members are using email service providers which may not have the recommended email security in place.']

question: What is Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)?
answer:
['DMARC, which stands for √¢¬Ä¬úDomain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance√¢¬Ä¬ù, is an email authentication, policy, and reporting protocol. It is designed to give email domain owners like CPF Board the ability to protect their domain (e.g., √¢¬Ä¬úcpf.gov.sg√¢¬Ä¬ù) from unauthorised use by email scammers.
As the Board uses DMARC together with other email security measures, recipients√¢¬Ä¬ô email service providers which have security measures in place, are able to verify that emails are from a legitimate sender (CPF Board) and we are able to tell such service providers how to handle emails that do not pass verification checks, e.g., reject or quarantine the email.']

question: Where can I find CPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ôs email receiver checker utility tool?
answer: ['You can find CPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ôs [email receiver checker utility tool](/member/tools-and-services/email-receiver-checker) (beta version)√Ç¬†under Tools and services > Enquiry services.']

question: What test results would I receive when I use CPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ôs email receiver checker utility tool?
answer:
['After you use CPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ôs email receiver√Ç¬†checker utility tool (beta version), your test notification results would be sent to your email inbox. The utility tool will attempt to send two emails to your email address. Everyone who uses the tool would receive a first email notification. Only those whose email domain is not Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant would receive a second notification. If you receive the second notification, we recommend that you switch to a DMARC-compliant email provider or request your current email provider to implement DMARC.
You can expect to receive the test notification results in your email inbox soon after you perform the test.
If you find that the results have not reached your inbox, please check your mailbox size and spam folder. It may be possible that your mailbox is full in your Inbox\*, or that your email service provider has treated the test notification as spam due to certain words in the content.
*\*Note: For email providers which are DMARC-compliant but which enforce its own email policies that override the sender√¢¬Ä¬ôs DMARC policies (e.g. Hotmail and Outlook), you would receive the second notification email (indicating DMARC non-compliance) in the spam/junk folder.*']

question: The utility tool results show that my email domain is not Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant. What should I do?
answer: ['If your utility tool (beta version) results showed that your email domain is not Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant, you should request your email service provider√¢¬Ä¬ôs technical team to comply with the DMARC policies set by email senders. If your service provider is unable to do that, we recommend that you switch to a DMARC-compliant provider so that you will not be vulnerable to email spoofing.']

question: How can I verify that my email domain is Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant after switching email provider, or after my current email provider√¢¬Ä¬ôs technical team has implemented the needed protections?
answer: ['You can use the utility tool (beta version) to test if your email address is Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant.√Ç¬†You can find CPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ôs [email receiver checker utility tool](/member/tools-and-services/email-receiver-checker) under Tools and services > Enquiry services.']

question: I have several email addresses. Can I use the utility tool to check if they are Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant?
answer: ['We have designed the utility tool (beta version) to provide additional assurance that it is safe to receive and open emails sent by CPF Board. To prevent misuse of the tool, we require you to login with your Singpass and the tool will use the email address that you have registered in CPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ôs records. You will thus not be able to use the tool to check if other email addresses are Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant.']

question: Which email service providers can identify and filter incoming Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant emails?
answer: ['If your email service provider is Yahoo or Gmail, your email domain is able to identify and filter incoming Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant emails. This list is not exhaustive and there are other email service providers which are DMARC-compliant.']

question: What are the potential risks if I use an email service which does not comply to Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC) policies?
answer: ['If your email service does not comply to Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC) policies, there is a higher risk of receiving spoofed emails sent from scammers impersonating trusted senders such as CPF Board. This is because such a service provider might not take action to verify who is sending the email before it goes into your inbox.']

question: Am I protected against email spoofing or phishing attempts if my email service provider is Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant?
answer: ['No. While Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC) can protect you against scammers who try to impersonate trusted senders, it cannot protect you from scammers who set up their own domains and try to mislead email recipients into mistaking them as legitimate senders. In general, it is good practice to be vigilant when we receive emails, especially if it is from a sender that we don√¢¬Ä¬ôt know or weren√¢¬Ä¬ôt expecting to get an email from.']

question: If my email service provider implements the email security measures, does it mean that I no longer have to check that the email sender domain is from a √¢¬Ä¬ú.gov.sg√¢¬Ä¬ù domain for emails sent by  Singapore government agencies?
answer: ['We recommend that you still scrutinise that the email sender domain is from a √¢¬Ä¬ú.gov.sg√¢¬Ä¬ù domain as scammers may attempt to send emails from lookalike domains (e.g. √¢¬Ä¬ú-gov.sg√¢¬Ä¬ù, √¢¬Ä¬ú.gov-sg√¢¬Ä¬ù) and pass the verification checks by Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant email service providers.']

question: I know that I should not rely on the email display name which is easily spoofed. Isn√¢¬Ä¬ôt it enough to check that the email sender√¢¬Ä¬ôs domain ends with √¢¬Ä¬ú.gov.sg√¢¬Ä¬ù? Why do I still need to check that my email service provider implements the needed protections?
answer: ['It is not sufficient to check that the email sender is from an email domain that ends with √¢¬Ä¬ú.gov.sg√¢¬Ä¬ù as a scammer can easily forge the email address with such an email domain to impersonate trusted senders (eg. you get an email supposedly from √¢¬Ä¬úcustomer department <customer@cpf.gov.sg>√¢¬Ä¬ù . However, such spoofed emails can be detected by email service providers which have the security measures in place to verify if emails are from a legitimate sender (CPF Board), and reject or quarantine emails that do not pass verification checks.']

question: How do I know whether the emails I receive are genuinely sent by CPF Board?
answer: ['To ensure that an email is genuinely sent by the CPF Board, remember to always check that the sender√¢¬Ä¬ôs email address ends with @cpf.gov.sg, @e.cpf.gov.sg or @inform.cpf.gov.sg.']

question: Where can I find CPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ôs email receiver checker utility tool?
answer: ['You can find CPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ôs [email receiver checker utility tool](/member/tools-and-services/email-receiver-checker) (beta version)√Ç¬†under Tools and services > Enquiry services.']

question: What test results would I receive when I use CPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ôs email receiver checker utility tool?
answer:
['After you use CPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ôs email receiver√Ç¬†checker utility tool (beta version), your test notification results would be sent to your email inbox. The utility tool will attempt to send two emails to your email address. Everyone who uses the tool would receive a first email notification. Only those whose email domain is not Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC)-compliant would receive a second notification. If you receive the second notification, we recommend that you switch to a DMARC-compliant email provider or request your current email provider to implement DMARC.
You can expect to receive the test notification results in your email inbox soon after you perform the test.
If you find that the results have not reached your inbox, please check your mailbox size and spam folder. It may be possible that your mailbox is full in your Inbox\*, or that your email service provider has treated the test notification as spam due to certain words in the content.
*\*Note: For email providers which are DMARC-compliant but which enforce its own email policies that override the sender√¢¬Ä¬ôs DMARC policies (e.g. Hotmail and Outlook), you would receive the second notification email (indicating DMARC non-compliance) in the spam/junk folder.*']

question: I received an SMS from √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù informing me that there is a change in the Board√¢¬Ä¬ôs SMS sender ID. Is it legitimate?
answer:
['Yes, the SMS is legitimate. From 1 Aug 2022, the Board will use SMS sender ID, √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù, to send messages pertaining to your CPF, Workfare and Silver Support matters. You received the SMS because you have a registered mobile number with the Board. You may [check or update your mobile number](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/account-settings) with your Singpass.
To protect yourself against scams, you are encouraged to keep the SMS on your mobile device so that you can be assured that any future SMSes received on this same Sender ID would be legitimate. Only the Board can send SMSes using this ID.']

question: Why is CPF Board standardising the SMS sender ID to √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù?
answer: ['The use of a single SMS sender ID √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù allows you to easily verify the legitimacy of messages sent by the Board. Only the Board can send SMSes using this ID.']

question: How does CPF Board ensure that the new SMS sender ID will not be spoofed by scammers?
answer:
['The Board has registered the new SMS sender ID with the Singapore SMS Sender ID Registry (SSIR), a setup by Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA). The SSIR can identify and block spoofed messages upfront, and prevent scammers from pretending to be CPF Board.
Only the Board can send SMSes using the new sender ID. SMSes appearing under √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù are legitimate messages sent by the Board.
Please remain vigilant as scammers may use variations of a legitimate sender ID to attempt to trick unsuspecting recipients.
Find out how else to [protect yourself from falling prey to phishing scams.](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/faq/general-information---useful-tips/electronic-services/how-do-i-avoid-falling-prey-to-phishing-scams)']

question: I used to receive SMSes from √¢¬Ä¬úSG-Workfare√¢¬Ä¬ù and √¢¬Ä¬úSG-SSS√¢¬Ä¬ù on Workfare and Silver Support matters respectively but stopped receiving such SMSes after the change in SMS Sender ID to √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù. Why is that so?
answer: ['We have standardised all SMSes sent to use the sender ID of √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù. Please check that you have registered your mobile number with us at the [CPF website.](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/member/ds/account-settings)']

question: What should I do with the previous SMS messages from CPF Board?
answer: ['We will no longer send SMSes from √¢¬Ä¬úCPFBOARD√¢¬Ä¬ù, √¢¬Ä¬úSG-Workfare√¢¬Ä¬ù, √¢¬Ä¬úSG-SSS√¢¬Ä¬ù from 1 Aug 2022. You may save the previous messages for your personal reference or delete them as you wish.']

question: Why am I receiving the SMS from √¢¬Ä¬úCPFBoard√¢¬Ä¬ù instead of √¢¬Ä¬úCPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ù?
answer:
['There are specific phone models which automatically remove the spaces in sender ID. It mainly affects Apple users with iOS version 12 and below.
You can be assured that all SMSes appearing in the thread under √¢¬Ä¬úCPFBoard√¢¬Ä¬ù are legitimate messages sent by the Board.']

question: What should I do if I fall prey to a malware/phishing scam?
answer:
['In the unfortunate event that you fall prey to a scam, we recommend taking the following actions immediately:
1. Alert your bank to freeze the affected bank account.
2. Reset your Singpass password if you think your Singpass has been compromised. For further assistance, please contact the official Singpass 24/7 helpdesk at 6335 3533.
3. File a police report and provide all details.']

question: Why are Total Expense Ratio (TER) caps reduced for CPF Investment Scheme funds?
answer: ['The purpose of CPF Investment Scheme is to provide alternative investment to help CPF members build up their retirement savings. As expenses of investment have a significant impact on returns, a regular review of the Total Expense Ratio (TER)√Ç¬†caps is important as high expense ratio would erode investment returns for CPF members. Where feasible, TER caps should be kept low to increase the fund√¢¬Ä¬ôs per-unit net asset value and enable CPF members to accumulate their retirement savings faster. This is in line with the efforts by regulatory authorities in other countries to reduce the cost of funds to investors.']

question: What actions should Fund Management Companies/insurers take if their existing CPF Investment Scheme List A funds are unable to comply with the Total Expense Ratio (TER) caps?
answer: ['Fund Management Companies (FMCs)/insurers have undertaken to comply with the Total Expense Ratio (TER)√Ç¬†caps for funds included under CPF Investment Scheme. If their List A funds are not able to comply with the new TER caps from 2016, **FMCs/insurers will be required to compensate the funds for the difference between the actual expense ratios and the new TER caps**. The funds would then be downgraded to List B with effect from the implementation date (see *[relevant reporting period](/content/dam/web/member/business-partners/documents/RelevantReportingPeriod.pdf)*, (PDF, 0.1MB)). Under List B, funds are not allowed to take in new CPF monies.']

question: Do Fund Management Companies/insurers need to submit a new undertaking in view of the new Total Expense Ratio caps?
answer: ['There is no need to√Ç¬†submit a new undertaking. The previous undertaking continues to be valid for existing List A funds under CPF Investment Scheme.']

question: Can a fund downgraded to List B resume accepting CPF monies once the fund's Total Expense Ratio meets the cap subsequently?
answer: ['The fund would be upgraded to List A, and can take in CPF monies if its audited Total Expense Ratio meets the cap subsequently.']

question: How frequent will CPF Board assess whether a fund can or cannot take in CPF monies?
answer: ['CPF Board will assess whenever a fund√¢¬Ä¬ôs audited financial statements become available (i.e. yearly basis for most funds). A company that wishes to have its fund assessed more frequently may submit to CPF Board the fund√¢¬Ä¬ôs semi-annual audited financial statements according to its accounting period. The company must ensure that all subsequent published Total Expense Ratios (TERs)√Ç¬†of its funds are also in line with the TER cap.']

question: Will a fund be excluded from CPF Investment Scheme due to not meeting the Total Expense Ratio cap subsequent to the inclusion?
answer: ['The fund will remain under CPF Investment Scheme (as List B fund) but it will not be allowed to take in CPF new monies. However, the company will have to provide the fund√¢¬Ä¬ôs investors with options to hold, redeem or make free switches within 3 months from informing the CPF Board of not meeting Total Expense Ratio caps.']

question: Can my company apply for the new fund to be included under the CPF Investment Scheme if its last audited Total Expense Ratio (TER) does not meet the TER cap?
answer:
['Your company can apply to√Ç¬†include√Ç¬†the fund under List A if it undertakes to cap the TER of the fund with effect from the date it is launched for CPF subscription. The Letter of undertaking is attached below:
| | |
| --- | --- |
| √¢¬Ä¬ãFMCs | √¢¬Ä¬ãInsurers |
| [UT Inclusion of new fund under List A](/content/dam/web/member/faq/business-partners/documents/UT_Inclusion_of_new_fund_under_ListA.pdf) (PDF, 0.2MB) | √¢¬Ä¬ã[ILP Inclusion of new fund under List A](/content/dam/web/member/faq/business-partners/documents/ILP_Inclusion_of_new_fund_under_ListA.pdf) (PDF, 0.2MB) |']

question: What is the relevant reporting period (of audited expense ratio) that fund managers are required to submit?
answer:
['For existing CPF Investment Scheme√Ç¬†funds, the new Total Expense Ratio (TER)√Ç¬†caps will take effect from 1 Jan 2016. **As such, the compliance with the new TER caps for each fund will be based on the audited report for the financial year of the fund ended in a month in 2016**. The implementation date for the new TER cap for a fund will be one day after the deadline of submission of the audited report for the fund.
The Board encourages Fund Management Companies (FMCs)/Insurers to assess early whether their funds can meet the new TER caps. If their funds cannot meet the new TER caps, FMCs/ Insurers should inform the Board early.
However, FMCs/Insurers must factor in the period required for settling the purchase transactions and thus the last purchase date must be at least five working days before the implementation date. This means that after the last purchase date, if a CPF member buys a fund that does not meet the TER cap, FMCs/ Insurers should not channel the subscriptions into that fund. If the funds cannot meet the TER cap, FMCs/ Insurers should communicate the consequence clearly to their unitholders/ policyholders, **before** the last purchase date. Please refer to the [relevant reporting period](/content/dam/web/member/business-partners/documents/RelevantReportingPeriod.pdf)√Ç¬†(PDF, 0.1MB) for details.']

question: What are the new Total Expense Ratio (TER) caps?
answer:
['The new Total Expense Ratio1 (TER) caps are as follows:
| | |
| --- | --- |
| **Risk Categories** | **New TER Caps (%)** |
| Higher Risk | 1.75 |
| Medium to High Risk | 1.55 |
| Low to Medium Risk | 0.95 |
| Lower Risk | 0.35 |
For CPF Investment Scheme List A funds, fund managers/insurers are not allowed to charge expenses more than the TER caps.
1 Guidelines on the computation of expense ratio can be found in the [Investment Management Association of Singapore (IMAS) website](http://www.imas.org.sg/uploads/media/2012/10/25/19_200505_-_IMAS_Revised_Guidelines_on_Expense_Ratio.pdf).']

question: How are the new Total Expense Ratio (TER) caps determined?
answer: ['The new Total Expense Ratio (TER) caps are determined based on the FY2012 **median** TERs (for the relevant risk categories) of CPF Investment Scheme (CPFIS) List A funds, and taking into account industry feedback. Median TERs were also used in 2008 when CPF Board first implemented TER caps for funds under the CPFIS.']

question: What are the admission criteria that fund management companies (FMCs) and insurance companies need to meet, in order to be included under CPFIS?
answer: ['Please see the admission criteria for√Ç¬†[fund management companies (FMCs)](/content/dam/web/member/business-partners/documents/CRITERIAFORFUNDMANAGEMENTCOMPANIES.pdf) and [insurance companies](/content/dam/web/member/business-partners/documents/CRITERIAFORINSURERSTOBEINCLUDEDUNDERCPFIS.pdf).']

question: What does the Board's investment consultant look for when evaluating fund management companies (FMCs), insurance companies or their products?
answer: ['Please see the [evaluation criteria](/content/dam/web/member/business-partners/documents/EVALUATIONCRITERIAFORPROSPECTIVEFUNDMANAGEMENTCOMPANIESFORINCLUSIONUNDERTHECPFIS.pdf) provided by the Board's investment consultant.']

question: What are the CPFIS admission criteria for funds?
answer: ['You can refer to para 5 for the [admission criteria for funds](/content/dam/web/member/business-partners/documents/APPLICATIONANDADMISSIONCRITERIAFORFUNDSMANAGEDBYFMC.pdf).']

question: How does regular MediSave co-contributions received under the Drive and Save (DAS) benefit me?
answer:
['Under the Drive and Save (DAS) scheme, the regular MediSave co-contributions from your taxi operator can:
* Offset your mandatory MediSave contributions under the Self-Employed Scheme
* Earn up to 6% interest per annum (p.a.) on your MediSave savings This includes an additional 1% interest p.a. on the first $60,000 of your combined balances (with up to $20,000 from the Ordinary Account). CPF members aged 55 and above will also earn an additional 1% interest p.a. on the first $30,000 of their combined CPF balances.
* Pay MediShield Life/ Integrated Shield Plan premiums for you and your loved ones (spouse, children, parents, grandparents or siblings)
* Qualify to receive√Ç¬†[Workfare Income Supplement (WIS)](/member/growing-your-savings/government-support/workfare-income-supplement)√Ç¬†payouts in cash and in your MediSave Account. Terms and conditions apply.']

question: If I participate in the Drive and Save (DAS) scheme, will my Taxi Vocational Licence (TDVL) be automatically renewed?
answer:
['Your Taxi Driver Vocational Licence (TDVL) will not be automatically renewed.
Taxi principal hirers must have fully paid their MediSave payable or are making monthly payments via GIRO to renew their TDVLs. Your MediSave contributions and the co-contributions from your taxi operators will go towards meeting your self-employed MediSave payable.']

question: If I am not liable to make a MediSave contribution to qualify for Drive and Save (DAS), can I qualify for co-contribution from my taxi operator?
answer:
['Taxi principal hirers who do not have outstanding MediSave payable can still receive Drive and Save co-contributions if they make:
* A voluntary contribution of at least $20 to their MediSave Account monthly, or
* A lump sum MediSave contribution of at least $240 in the past 12 months.']

question: How does each taxi operator know the Drive and Save (DAS) co-contribution amount?
answer: ['Every month, CPF Board will inform the participating taxi operators of the details of taxi principal hirers who have made sufficient MediSave contributions to qualify for Drive and Save (DAS) co-contributions. Exact contribution amounts will not be revealed.']

question: Will I receive Drive and Save (DAS) co-contributions if I make a lump sum payment?
answer: ['You will receive Drive and Save (DAS) co-contributions of $20 monthly provided you have contributed at least $240 into your MediSave Account in the past 12 months.']

question: What sources of MediSave contributions are eligible for Drive and Save (DAS) co-contribution?
answer: ['MediSave contributions made by the taxi principal hirer as a self-employed person will qualify him for Drive and Save (DAS) co-contribution. CPF contributions received as an employee (from both employer and self) for taxi principal hirers who are concurrently employed, as well as government top-ups are excluded.']

question: How do I register for the Drive and Save (DAS) Scheme?
answer:
['No registration is required for the Drive and Save (DAS) Scheme.
Taxi principal hirers who contribute at least $20 monthly to their MediSave Account will be eligible to receive a co-contribution of $20\* monthly from participating taxi operators.
\*Terms and conditions apply']

question: Who is eligible for the Drive and Save (DAS) Scheme?
answer: ['Under the Drive and Save (DAS) Scheme, all taxi principal hirers who make regular contributions to their MediSave Account are eligible to receive co-contributions from participating taxi operators.']

question: What is Drive and Save (DAS) Scheme?
answer: ['The Drive and Save (DAS) Scheme is a tripartite co-contribution scheme initiated by the National Taxi Association (NTA) and the taxi industry, and supported by Ministry of Manpower and CPF Board. DAS aims to enhance the welfare of all taxi principal hirers.']

question: Can I use my Unique Entity Number (UEN) to perform transactions with CPF Board? Why do I have to use my CPF Submission Number (CSN)?
answer: ['You must use your CPF Submission Number (CSN) to perform transactions with CPF Board. The CSN is the Unique Entity Number (UEN) + CPF Payment Code. The UEN alone is not sufficient to identify the different types of CPF payments made by you.']

question: I have ceased engaging employee (s) for a period of time. Can I use my previously issued CPF Submission Number (CSN) to pay CPF contributions for newly hired employee(s)?
answer: ['You can use the previously issued CPF Submission Number(CSN) to pay CPF contributions for your employee(s), provided that your UEN remains the same for your business√Ç¬†entity or you are an individual trading under your own name.']

question: How do I obtain my CPF Submission Number (CSN) as a new employer?
answer:
['Please [apply](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ApplyforCPFSubmissionNumber/Index) for your CPF Submission Number (CSN) as soon as you intend to hire your first employee. You will need your Singpass and entity's [Unique Entity Number (UEN)](https://www.uen.gov.sg/ueninternet/faces/pages/uenSrch.jspx) to complete the application. The contact details provided in the application will also be registered automatically with [CPF EZPay](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/making-cpf-contributions/submitting-cpf-contributions-via-cpf-ezpay), an online service that helps you to easily submit CPF contributions for your employees.
You can refer to this [guide](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/ApplyforCSNandSetupCPFEZPay_QuickGuide.pdf)√Ç¬†on how you start contributing CPF as a new employer.']

question: Is it mandatory for all companies to apply for a CPF Submission Number (CSN) with the CPF Board?
answer: ['All employers are required to apply for a CPF Submission Number with the Board before they can submit their CPF contributions.']

question: What is the CPF Payment Code?
answer: ['The CPF Payment Code in your CPF Submission Number (CSN) identifies the different types of payments made by employers to the Board such as mandatory CPF contributions, Voluntary Contributions, and MediSave contributions under the Additional MediSave Contribution Scheme. You will need to apply for a different CSN for each type of payment that you are making.']

question: What is Unique Entity Number (UEN)?
answer: ['The Unique Entity Number (UEN) is the standard identification number of an entity. The UEN is for registered entities while the NRIC is for Singapore Citizens and Singapore Permanent Residents. The UEN uniquely identifies the entity. For more information, please visit [www.uen.gov.sg](https://www.uen.gov.sg/).']

question: How long does it take to process the √¢¬Ä¬úApply for CPF Submission Number√¢¬Ä¬ù online application?
answer:
['Generally, if your application was submitted before 5pm, you can submit CPF contributions via CPF EZPay Mobile the next day. If you wish to use CPF EZPay for your CPF submission, do note that one additional day is required for the Board to activate your CPF EZPay access.
After your CPF EZPay access is activated, please also note the process for setting up access control for your CPF Submission Number (CSN):
* For UEN-registered entity, you must set up and assign √¢¬Ä¬ú[CPF EZPay](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/Guide%20to%20setup%20and%20assign%20CPF%20eService_2021.pdf)√¢¬Ä¬ù e-Service to your authorised officer for your CSN in the Corppass portal. This access control is required for CPF EZPay so you can decide which of your staff can submit CPF for each of your CSN.
* For individuals trading under own name, you would have set up your access control for System Administrator and Editor when applying for your new CSN.']

question: If I do not have a Unique Entity Number (UEN), can I register with the Board to pay my employees√¢¬Ä¬ô CPF contributions?
answer:
['You can [apply for a CPF Submission Number (CSN)](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ApplyforCPFSubmissionNumber/Index) as you are considered to be trading under your own name hiring Singapore Citizen or Singapore Permanent Resident employees in your own capacity.
Some examples of employers trading under their own name include hawker hiring a hawker assistant, or a person who hires a personal driver, gardener, or domestic worker.']

question: Do I need to apply for a new CPF Submission Number (CSN) if my subsidiary company has a different Unique Entity Number (UEN) from the parent company?
answer: ['You are required to apply for a new CPF Submission Number (CSN) if your subsidiary company has a different Unique Entity Number (UEN) from the parent company. To apply for a CSN, please submit your application using [Apply for CPF Submission Number](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ApplyforCPFSubmissionNumber/Index).']

question: How can the employees' CPF Account information under the old company be transferred to the new company?
answer: ['CPF Board is unable to transfer the CPF Account details of employees from the old to the new company. Employers must apply for a new CPF Submission Number (CSN) for the new company and inform the Board to cancel the old company's existing CSN. When submitting the first CPF payment under the new CSN, employers must provide the CPF Account information for all employees.']

question: How do I register for an additional CPF Submission Number (CSN) if MOM requires me to do so for Work Permit purposes?
answer: ['To apply for an additional CPF Submission Number (CSN)√Ç¬†for MOM Work Permit purposes, please submit your application using [Apply for CPF Submission Number](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ApplyforCPFSubmissionNumber/Index). Please attach a copy of the letter from MOM Work Pass Division in the application.']

question: What is CPF Submission Number (CSN)?
answer:
['CPF Submission Number (CSN) is a unique identifier used by employers to transact with CPF Board. This includes making CPF payments and making any request relating to employer matters.
A CSN consists of an [Unique Entity Number (UEN)](http://www.uen.gov.sg/) or NRIC/FIN (if you√¢¬Ä¬ôre trading under your own name) and a CPF Payment Code.
You will need to apply for a different CSN for each type of payment you are making. Some examples include mandatory CPF contributions, voluntary contributions, MediSave contributions under the Additional MediSave Contribution Scheme.']

question: How do I start contributing CPF as a new employer?
answer: ['You will need a CPF Submission Number (CSN) to transact with CPF Board. You can refer to this [guide](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/Start%20your%20CPF%20journey%20in%205%20steps.pdf) to learn how to apply for a CSN and submit CPF contributions via CPF EZPay in five steps. Please give us your feedback and/or suggestions on the guide using the [feedback form](https://form.gov.sg/642bd5fb5e0f74001266e558).']

question: What should I do if there is a change in employee's particulars?
answer:
['Please ensure that your affected employees inform the Board of any changes in their personal particulars which include:
1. Change in name
2. Change in Passport/ Identity Card / Special Pass number
3. Change in Singapore Permanent Resident (SPR) or citizenship status
Your employee who has been issued with a new Singapore Identity Card will be given new CPF account. The new CPF account number is the same as his new Singapore Identity Card number. You should therefore pay CPF contributions into the new CPF account, and inform your employee to contact CPF Board to merge his previous CPF account (if any) with the new CPF account. This is to ensure that only one CPF account is maintained for the employee concerned. Submission of CPF contributions to accounts with an SA/SB/SD/SF/TC/TF prefix will be rejected.']

question: How long does it take to process the √¢¬Ä¬úApplication for Change of Employer√¢¬Ä¬ôs Particulars√¢¬Ä¬ù online application?
answer:
['The service standard to process an application for change of employer's particulars is:
| | |
| --- | --- |
| **Service** | **Normal Processing Time** |
| Application for Change of Employer's Particulars | Within two working days.√Ç¬†Please ensure your applications are duly completed with the necessary supporting documents. |']

question: How do I update CPF Board of any change to my company's address (also known as Principal Place of Business)?
answer: ['You can inform us of any changes to your principal place of business or contact details via our [website](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/AuthenticationProviderSelection/SelectSPCPProvider?returnAction=/eSvc/Web/Services/ChangeOfAddress/CoverPage&theme=Employer) as soon as possible.']

question: What should I do if I cease to have employees?
answer:
['If you no longer have any employees or ceased operations\*, you need to:
i) notify us immediately by submitting your [request](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/FeedbackSubscription/Index) to us, and
ii) indicate the date that you cease to have employees.
By doing so, you can avoid incurring late payment interest and composition amount.
\*Note: Terminating Electronic Standing Instruction (ESI) or Direct Debit Arrangement (DDA), stopping payment of CPF contributions or deleting employee records from CPF EZPay do not constitute as informing CPF Board that you do not have any more employees.']

question: When do I need to inform CPF Board of any changes to my entity's particulars?
answer:
['You will need to inform CPF Board when there are changes to the following:
Change of Company's Principal Place of Business (PPB) / Contact Details
You should submit to inform CPF Board of the change via an [online application](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/ChangeOfAddress/CoverPage) with Singpass as soon as possible. Please note that P.O. Box or V Box addresses will not be accepted. The updated contact details will be your official contact details maintained with CPF Board for general CPF notifications. Do ensure that you also log in to CPF EZPay to update your contact details for CPF EZPay-related matters.
If your company hires foreign workers, the Ministry of Manpower would be informed of the change once the address had been updated with us.
Change in Business Entity
If you are issued with a new Unique Entity Number (UEN), you will need to [apply](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ApplyforCPFSubmissionNumber/Index) for a new CPF Submission Number (CSN) under the new entity to make your CPF contributions .You are also required to inform us if you no longer have any employees in your service under the old UEN.
After you are issued with the new CSN, you are required to set up your√Ç¬†[Direct Debit arrangement](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/faq/making-cpf-contributions/payment-modes/how-do-i-apply-for-direct-debit-to-pay-cpf).
Change in Company's Name
You should [inform](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/contact-us/write-to-us) us and attach either the:
* Instant Computer Information (Business Profile); or
* Certificate of Incorporation on Change of Name of Company
The above information can be obtained from the [Accounting & Corporate Regulatory Authority (ACRA)](https://www.acra.gov.sg/).']

question: I have set up a new company and transferred my existing employees to that company. Do I need to apply for a new CPF Submission Number (CSN)?
answer:
['You will need to [apply for a new CPF Submission Number (CSN)](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ApplyforCPFSubmissionNumber/Index) in order to make CPF contributions for a new company. The CSN is made up of the Unique Entity Number (UEN) and CPF Payment Code, which are unique to the entity.
You can apply for a new CSN on the CPF website, and once processed, a new CSN will be issued. Please provide the employees' account information when making the first payment under the new CSN, as CPF Board is unable to transfer the details from the old CSN. Refer to the "[Apply for CSN and Setup CPF EZPay Quick Guide](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/ApplyforCSNandSetupCPFEZPay_QuickGuide.pdf)" for more information on CSN application.
You will also need to inform the Board if you cease to engage any employees under the old UEN to prevent late payment penalties.']

question: How do I pay using CPF EZPay Mobile?
answer: ['After submitting the CPF contribution details via CPF EZPay Mobile, employers can pay via PayNow QR (supports personal or corporate accounts of participating banks).']

question: What are the benefits of using CPF EZPay Mobile?
answer:
['By using CPF EZPay Mobile, you will enjoy:
* Fuss-free submission of your CPF contribution details via any mobile platform
* Option to load the employee details and email address from the previous submission
* Mobile optimised screen for positive user experience
* Secure payment via PayNow QR']

question: What is CPF EZPay Mobile?
answer:
['CPF EZPay Mobile is a mobile application suitable for submitting CPF contributions for 10 or fewer employees, anytime and anywhere.
Here√¢¬Ä¬ôs what you need to know about CPF EZPay Mobile:
* Registration is not required. Simply download the app from [Apple App Store](https://apps.apple.com/sg/app/cpf-e-submit-mobile/id1072317364) or [Google Play](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=sg.gov.cpf.eSub&hl=en_SG&gl=US) to begin.
* Save and load your employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs details, and easily amend them for your monthly submissions.
* Make payment via PayNow QR.
To find out more about how to use CPF EZPay Mobile, you may refer to the [User Guide](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/CPFEZPayMobile.pdf) (PDF, 2.3MB) or watch the [Video Guide](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lEIh2qfon7M) on YouTube.
This app is now available for download from the Apple App Store or Google Play (only for Android phones running on Android OS. 5.0 and above)!
[![Icon for Apple App Store for downloading CPF EZPay Mobile](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/images/Apple.jpg)](https://apps.apple.com/sg/app/cpf-e-submit-mobile/id1072317364 "Icon for Apple App Store for downloading CPF EZPay Mobile.") [![Icon for Google Play for downloading CPF EZPay Mobile](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/images/Google.jpg)](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=sg.gov.cpf.eSub&hl=en_SG "Icon for Google Play for downloading CPF EZPay Mobile.")']

question: Does CPF EZPay compute Additional Wage (AW) Ceiling?
answer: ['CPF EZPay does not compute AW Ceiling as it does not track wages on an annual basis. You may use our√Ç¬†[CPF Additional Wage Ceiling Calculator](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/tools-and-services/calculators/additional-wage-ceiling-calculator "Additional Wage ceiling calculator")√Ç¬†to calculate the AW Ceiling or do so manually.']

question: Am I required to do any test submission before I start using my own payroll software to submit via CPF EZPay (FTP)?
answer:
['You are not required to do any test submission to CPF Board.
To know more about the CPF EZPay (FTP), you may refer to our√Ç¬†[user guide](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/CPFEZPayFTPUserGuide.pdf)(PDF, 3.5MB).']

question: How do I appoint or change Administrator for CPF EZPay?
answer:
['To appoint or change Administrator for CPF EZPay, please refer to the following options:
For UEN-registered entity
Your Corppass Admin or Sub-Admin can appoint or change your system Administrator by assigning the √¢¬Ä¬úCPF EZPay√¢¬Ä¬ù e-service to another authorised officer within Corppass portal. Please refer to this [guide](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/Guide%20to%20setup%20and%20assign%20CPF%20eService_2021.pdf)√Ç¬†(PDF, 1.5MB) for more information.
For individual trading under own name
Your existing Administrators within CPF EZPay can add new Administrators. Please refer to our [user guide](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/CPFEZPayupdateparticulars.pdf)√Ç¬†(PDF, 3.7MB) for more information.
If you only have one Administrator who has left, you will need to [write to us](http://cpf.gov.sg/writetous) stating your reason for addition/removal of Administrator for us to assist you.']

question: How do I check the status of my submission? What do the different Submission Status under the View / Amend / Delete Submission screen mean?
answer:
['To view the status of your submission, please login to CPF EZPay and select√Ç¬†**View / Amend / Delete Submission**√Ç¬†option under√Ç¬†**Manage Records & Particulars**√Ç¬†section of the√Ç¬†**Main Menu**.
Please refer to the chart below for the different submission status.
| | |
| --- | --- |
| **Submission Status** | **What it means** |
| Draft | This submission is incomplete and CPF has not received your submission yet. |
| Submitted | This submission will be processed after 5.15pm daily. Therefore, if there are any errors in the submission, you may [amend or delete your submission](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/faq/making-cpf-contributions/cpf-ezpay/can-i-amend-or-delete-my-submission-if-i-have-made-payment) before it is processed. |
| Processed | Submission was successfully processed. |']

question: How do I print the CPF EZPay acknowledgement if I have closed the browser?
answer:
['It is not possible to print the "CPF EZPay Acknowledgement" page once you have closed the browser.
Instead, you may login to our [CPF EZPay](https://www2.cpf.gov.sg/ert/dsa/spcpSelection.action) to view the status of your submission.
You will also receive an email from the Board within the day acknowledging the receipt of your submission.']

question: How do I submit CPF Contribution via CPF EZPay (ESI)?
answer:
['If you√¢¬Ä¬ôre already on Direct Debit payment mode, and generally your employees√¢¬Ä¬ô wages do not change every month, you can√Ç¬†[set up Electronic Standing Instruction (ESI)](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/CPFEZPayESIUserGuide.pdf)√Ç¬†within CPF EZPay. Once your ESI is set up, your monthly submission and deduction will be automatically made to us.
You√¢¬Ä¬ôre required to amend your employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs wages in ESI if there are changes so the CPF contributions to be deducted are updated.']

question: How do I view the Record of Payment (ROP) if I submit via CPF EZPay?
answer:
['You can view up to 24 months of past Record of Payment (ROP) online if you submit via CPF EZPay. Please refer to our [guide](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/CPFEZPay_ROPUserGuide.pdf).
As good record keeping practice, you should save a copy of your ROP. We do not provide retrieval of past ROPs. If you did not retain a copy of your past ROPs, you can seek other documents (e.g. company√¢¬Ä¬ôs bank statement, payroll or financial statement).
Please [write to us](http://cpf.gov.sg/writetous) if you encountered technical difficulties to view the ROPs.']

question: How do I update my employee database on CPF EZPay?
answer:
['Please login to√Ç¬†[CPF EZPay](https://www2.cpf.gov.sg/ert/dsa/spcpSelection.action)√Ç¬†to update your√Ç¬†Employee Database. If the employee has left the company and no more CPF contribution is payable to him/her, please tick the checkbox beside the employee record and select√Ç¬†**Delete Employee Record**√Ç¬†to delete this employee from the database.
If you are still required to pay CPF for this employee, please perform the following steps:
