1. Select√Ç¬†**Detail**√Ç¬†button corresponding to the employee record and√Ç¬†**Key/Update Staff Information**√Ç¬†screen will pop-up.
2. Indicate the√Ç¬†**Employment Status**√Ç¬†for that employee as√Ç¬†**Left**√Ç¬†and indicate the date employee left at the√Ç¬†**Date Left Employment**√Ç¬†column.
3. Once the employee record has been updated, please select√Ç¬†**Save Changes**. A confirmation message "**Employee Database**√Ç¬†**saved successfully**" will be displayed.
4. You can delete this employee from the database in the following month√¢¬Ä¬ôs submission.
If your company no longer have any employees or ceased operations, please notify us immediately through [Write-To-Us](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/FeedbackSubscription/Index)√Ç¬†to avoid incurring late payment interest and composition amount.']

question: I currently submit CPF contributions using my own payroll software. How do I switch to CPF EZPay?
answer:
['If you are currently submitting CPF contributions within your payroll software, you are already registered for CPF EZPay as well. Simply login to CPF EZPay from our CPF website to submit your monthly CPF contributions using CPF EZPay.
Find out√Ç¬†[more](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/making-cpf-contributions/submitting-cpf-contributions-via-cpf-ezpay)√Ç¬†about the various ways you can submit your CPF contributions using CPF EZPay.']

question: Can CPF EZPay calculate the CPF contributions for Singapore Permanent Residents (SPRs)?
answer: ['CPF EZPay is able to calculate CPF contributions for SPRs. You will need to key in the **SPR Start Date** and select the **Type** (e.g. GG - Graduated or FG - full CPF contributions rates). This will allow CPF EZPay to track the SPR status of your employee and auto-update the CPF contribution to be paid (e.g. from SPR Year 1 to Year 2 or Year 2 to year 3).']

question: Is there a limit on the file size for each submission via CPF EZPay (FTP)?
answer: ['For better performance, we have limited the file size to 2 mega-bytes. You will not be able to send the file if it exceeds the file size limit.']

question: Is there a limit to the number of submissions I can perform each day using CPF EZPay?
answer:
['There are different limits to the number of CPF submissions that you can perform each day. Please select CPF EZPay or CPF EZPay (FTP) to view.
CPF EZPay
You can submit up to 99 submissions within the day. If you try to make additional submissions, our system will prompt you with the message √¢¬Ä¬úA file with the same advice code has already been submitted.√¢¬Ä¬ù
CPF EZPay (FTP)
Multiple file submissions within the same day are allowed, provided a different advice code is used in the submission file. If you are submitting a file using the same advice code or more than 99 files, you will be prompted with a message √¢¬Ä¬úA file with the same advice code has been already submitted. Please change the advice code and re-submit√¢¬Ä¬ù.
For more information on how to assign an advice code, please refer to [CPF EZPay user guide](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/CPFEZPayFTPUserGuide.pdf)(PDF, 3.7MB).']

question: What are Advice Codes and how do I use them when I upload my submission file via CPF EZPay (FTP)?
answer:
['If you are submitting more than one file within the same day for the same CPF Submission Number (CSN), you will need to assign a different Advice Code for each file. Advice Codes act as a file numbering system to differentiate files created for different groups of employees belonging to the same CSN.
To know more about CPF EZPay (FTP), you can refer to our [user guide (PDF, 3.7MB)](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/CPFEZPayFTPUserGuide.pdf).']

question: What is the difference between the Administrator and Editor?
answer:
['Unlike the Administrator, the Editor cannot update the company's contact information or add/delete staff accesses. The table below summarises the roles of the Administrator and Editor.
| | |
| --- | --- |
| **Function** | **Role** |
| **Administrator** | **Editor** |
| Update the company's contact information | Y | N |
| Add and Delete Administrator(s) /Editor(s) | Y | N |
| Submit CPF contributions on behalf of the company | Y | Y |
| View previously submitted CPF contribution details | Y | Y |']

question: What file types are acceptable for submission via CPF EZPay (FTP)? Why do I keep getting a file extension error when trying to perform submission?
answer:
['Only text files conforming to our√Ç¬†[FTP file specifications](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/FTPSpecifications_effective1Jan2022.pdf)√Ç¬†(effective 1 Jan 2022) (PDF, 0.3MB) which end with a ".dtl", ".txt" or ".dat" extension are acceptable. Please check that your file ends with one of these extensions.
If you encounter file extension error when trying to perform submission, please check to see if any of the folders within the path contains ".". The reason is because the system will treat anything behind "." as the extension of the file.
To know more about CPF EZPay (FTP), you can refer to our√Ç¬†[user guide](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/CPFEZPayFTPUserGuide.pdf) (PDF, 3.7MB).']

question: How do I know if I have completed my CPF submission?
answer:
['Once you have completed your submission, you will see an acknowledgement page called √¢¬Ä¬úCPF EZPay Acknowledgment√¢¬Ä¬ù. You can view or save this page by clicking on the printer icon which you will be prompted to download a PDF. You will not be able to save or print this acknowledgment page if you closed your internet browser.
You will also receive an email acknowledgement if your email address is registered in√Ç¬†[CPF EZPay](https://www2.cpf.gov.sg/ert/dsa/spcpSelection.action). To add or amend the email address registered for EZPay, your Administrator for CPF EZPay can perform the following steps:
1. Log in to√Ç¬†[CPF√Ç¬†EZPay](https://www2.cpf.gov.sg/ert/dsa/spcpSelection.action)
2. At√Ç¬†**Manage Records & Particulars**, select√Ç¬†**View / Update Particulars**.
3. Select√Ç¬†**Amend**√Ç¬†to make changes to email address and contact information.
4. Select√Ç¬†**Save**√Ç¬†changes.
5. Log out and log in again for the changes to take effect immediately.']

question: What browser settings are required for me to use CPF EZPay?
answer:
['Your browser√¢¬Ä¬ôs default settings should be sufficient to allow you to use CPF EZPay. If you are unable to access CPF EZPay, please check that you have the following features enabled:
* Cookies
* Java Script
* TLS (Transport Layer Security) Versions 1.0, 1.1 or 1.2']

question: What is CPF EZPay?
answer:
['CPF EZPay is a free service provided by CPF Board where employers can submit their employees√¢¬Ä¬ô CPF contribution details and make payment electronically.
Find out [how](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/making-cpf-contributions/submitting-cpf-contributions-via-cpf-ezpay) you can submit CPF contributions easily via CPF EZPay and make payment using [Direct Debit](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/making-cpf-contributions/payment-modes).
To find out more about how to use CPF EZPay, you may refer to the [User Guide](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/CPFEZPayQuickRefUserGuide.pdf) (PDF, 2.0MB) or watch the [Video Guide](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gHgRuuRNRbk) on YouTube.']

question: How can I check if my company has been successfully registered for CPF EZPay?
answer: ['You will be notified via your registered email address once your company has been successfully registered for CPF EZPay.']

question: Is it safe to submit my employee details through the internet using CPF EZPay?
answer:
['The information you submit is encrypted using 2048-bits SSL, which is a common standard used by major online merchants, financial institutions, and brokerages worldwide to transmit secured documents via the Internet.
Only designated staff assigned by you will be able to log in to use CPF EZPay. After each successful submission, an acknowledgement email will be sent to your designated email address. You can also log in to enquire about the submission status and view the Record of Payment online.
Therefore, it is safe to submit your employees√¢¬Ä¬ô details using CPF EZPay.']

question: If I have more than one CPF Submission Number (CSN), can I use CPF EZPay?
answer:
['You can use CPF EZPay if you have more than one CPF Submission Number(CSN). There is no limit on the number of CSNs.
However, you must apply for√Ç¬†[Direct Debit](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/faq/making-cpf-contributions/payment-modes/how-do-i-apply-for-direct-debit-to-pay-cpf)√Ç¬†for each CSN.']

question: When is the due date to submit CPF contributions?
answer: ['The due date for CPF contributions is on the last day of the calendar month. Enforcement action would be taken against employers who fail to pay by the 14th of the following month (or the next working day if the 14th falls on a Saturday, Sunday or Public Holiday). This includes imposing late payment interest charged at 1.5% per month commencing from the first day after the due date.']

question: How do I apply for Corppass access to submit CPF contributions?
answer:
['A UEN-registered entity can apply for Corppass access at the [Corppass portal](https://www.corppass.gov.sg/).
Before using CPF EZPay for the first time, you will need to perform a one-time setup in Corppass portal after you have obtained Corppass access. You can refer to this [guide](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/Guide%20to%20setup%20and%20assign%20CPF%20eService_2021.pdf) on how to set up and assign CPF EZPay in Corppass portal.']

question: Is there an electronic submission mode I can use if I don't have a Singpass account?
answer:
['You can use√Ç¬†**[CPF EZPay Mobile](/employer/making-cpf-contributions/submitting-cpf-contributions-via-cpf-ezpay-mobile)**√Ç¬†to submit CPF contributions for 10 or fewer employees and pay via PayNow QR.
If you need to manage more employees, you should use CPF EZPay for your CPF submissions. You are encouraged to [apply for Singpass](https://www.singpass.gov.sg/) or visit any of the√Ç¬†[Singpass counters located islandwide](https://www.singpass.gov.sg/home/ui/counter-locations)√Ç¬†in-person.
If you are a UEN-registered entity, you will need Corppass access and perform a one-time setup before using CPF EZPay. Please refer to this [guide](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/Guide%20to%20setup%20and%20assign%20CPF%20eService_2021.pdf) for the steps.']

question: Even though I have been granted access to all e-Services in Corppass, I am still unable to login to CPF EZPay. What should I do?
answer:
['Before you can access CPF EZPay, your Corppass Admin or Sub-Admin must set up and assign √¢¬Ä¬úCPF EZPay√¢¬Ä¬ù e-Service to your CPF Submission Number(s) in the Corppass portal.
This is required even if you are granted access to all e-Services in Corppass portal. This is because access for CPF submissions is controlled at CSN level for authorised users.
You can refer to our [guide](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/Guide%20to%20setup%20and%20assign%20CPF%20eService_2021.pdf) to learn how to set up and assign CPF EZPay in Corppass portal.']

question: How do I make CPF back payments for my employees?
answer:
['You can make back payments into your employees√¢¬Ä¬ô CPF accounts through CPF EZPay or CPF EZPay Mobile.
CPF EZPay
You can submit CPF contributions as per normal via CPF EZPay, but select the correct Month and Year for your back payments. Please note that changes made will be saved to your employee database in CPF EZPay for future CPF submissions.
If you do not wish to affect your employee database in CPF EZPay for future CPF submissions, you can make use of the Submit√Ç¬†**ad hoc**√Ç¬†CPF payments option to submit your back payments instead. Auto-computation is not available for this option. However, you can load employee details from submissions made up to six months ago.
Here√¢¬Ä¬ôs how to use the Submit√Ç¬†**ad hoc**√Ç¬†CPF payments option in CPF EZPay:
1. Select√Ç¬†[CPF EZPay](https://www2.cpf.gov.sg/ert).
2. Select√Ç¬†**For UEN-registered entities**√Ç¬†or√Ç¬†**For individuals trading under own name**√Ç¬†and login with your Singpass.
3. Key in your CPF Submission Number (CSN).
4. At√Ç¬†**Submit Contribution**, select√Ç¬†**CPF EZPay**.
5. Key in the√Ç¬†**Month**√Ç¬†and√Ç¬†**Year**.
6. Select√Ç¬†**Submit√Ç¬†ad hoc√Ç¬†CPF payments**√Ç¬†(For one-time CPF submission (no auto-computation), or other ad hoc payments e.g. late payment interest).
7. Enter the contribution details for the affected employee.
8. After completing all of the contribution details and the summary portion, click on√Ç¬†**Continue**.
9. Confirm submission by clicking on your pre-arranged payment mode with the Board (Direct Debit/PayNow QR).
CPF EZPay Mobile
You can also submit CPF contributions via CPF EZPay Mobile and make payment via PayNow QR by selecting the correct Month and Year for your back payments. You can refer to this[guide](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/CPFEZPayMobile.pdf)√Ç¬†on how you can make a submission.']

question: How can I submit CPF contributions for my employees?
answer:
['You can submit your CPF contributions easily using [CPF EZPay](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/making-cpf-contributions/submitting-cpf-contributions-via-cpf-ezpay) with Singpass. Enjoy hassle-free submission by making use of the auto-computation feature or set up an Electronic Standing Instruction (ESI) for recurring monthly submissions.
If you have 10 or fewer employees and would like to submit your CPF contributions on-the-go, you can do so using [CPF EZPay Mobile](/employer/making-cpf-contributions/submitting-cpf-contributions-via-cpf-ezpay-mobile). Simply download the app on your mobile phone to get started.']

question: Can I select my preferred deduction date now that the default direct deduction date is set at two working days after the submission date?
answer: ['You can select your preferred deduction date. Please click on the calendar icon under the Direct Debit option to change the date before submitting the contributions.']

question: How long will CPF Board take to process my application for CPF EZPay?
answer:
['The service standard for processing CPF EZPay applications is as follows:
| | |
| --- | --- |
| **Service** | **Processing Time** |
| [CPF EZPay](https://www2.cpf.gov.sg/ert/dsa/spcpSelection.action) | Three working days |']

question: How long does CPF Board takes to credit the payment for CPF contributions and late CPF interest?
answer:
['The service standards for crediting of payment for CPF contributions and late CPF interest are:
| | |
| --- | --- |
| **Service** | **Processing Time** |
| CPF contributions submission | Within three working days |']

question: What are the supported web browsers for CPF EZPay?
answer: ['You may refer to this [guide](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/InternetBrowsers_SupportingCPFEZPay.pdf) (PDF, 0.36MB) on the supported browsers for CPF EZPay and the instructions to check the version and update your web browser.']

question: How can I view my CPF contribution details in CPF EZPay?
answer:
['You can save a copy of the CPF contribution details by following these steps:
1. Select [CPF EZPay](https://www2.cpf.gov.sg/ert)
2. Select **For UEN-registered entities**√Ç¬†or **For individuals trading under own name** and login with your Singpass.
3. Key in your CPF Submission Number (CSN).
4. At **Manage Records & Particulars**, select **View / Amend / Delete Submission**
5. Click on the **Submission Date** to view the Contribution details.
6. You will be directed to the **View Employer Submission Page**.
7. To save this page, click on the√Ç¬†**Printer**√Ç¬†icon. You will be prompted to download a PDF file which you can save.
**IMPORTANT!** If you wish to print a copy of the contribution details only, please do not use the **Amend** submission function as it will result in the withdrawal of your submitted file.']

question: I am using a payroll software to compute CPF contributions, can I submit the file directly to CPF Board?
answer: ['You can upload the submission file for your CPF contributions directly via [CPF EZPay (FTP)](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/CPFEZPayFTPUserGuide.pdf)√Ç¬†(PDF, 3.7MB) if your file complies with our file specifications. If you are unsure, please check with your payroll software vendor for more information.']

question: How do I import my employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs details in CPF EZPay if I√¢¬Ä¬ôm using Microsoft Excel?
answer:
['Please follow these steps when importing your employees√¢¬Ä¬ô details from Microsoft Excel Template File for submission via CPF EZPay:
1. Log in to√Ç¬†**[CPF EZPay](https://www2.cpf.gov.sg/ert/dsa/spcpSelection.action)**
2. Select√Ç¬†**For UEN-registered entities**√Ç¬†or√Ç¬†**For individuals trading under own name**√Ç¬†and log in with your Singpass.
3. Key in your CPF Submission Number (CSN).
4. At√Ç¬†**Submit Contribution**, select√Ç¬†**CPF EZPay**.
5. At√Ç¬†**Contribution Details For**, key in the√Ç¬†**Month**√Ç¬†and√Ç¬†**Year**.
6. Select√Ç¬†**Submit via Employee Database**√Ç¬†and select√Ç¬†**Continue**.
7. Select√Ç¬†**Import Employee Details**.
8. Select**Import from MS Excel Template file**.
9. Click on√Ç¬†**Choose File**to select the file which you wish to import.
10. Next, select√Ç¬†**Import File**√Ç¬†and you will be directed to√Ç¬†**Preview of Imported Records**. Select√Ç¬†**Confirm & Save**.
11. A pop-up message√Ç¬†**"Importing this file will replace ALL employee details in your Employee Database. Do you want to continue"**√Ç¬†will be displayed.
12. Select√Ç¬†**OK**and you will be directed to the√Ç¬†**Update Employee Database Page**.
13. The confirmation message√Ç¬†**"File imported successfully. Please update the field "PR Start Date"**√Ç¬†**for all your Permanent Resident employees"**will be displayed on the same page. Please ensure that you have keyed in the PR Start Date for any Singapore Permanent Resident employees to ensure correct auto-computation of CPF contributions.
Note: To understand the fields inside the sample template, please click on the√Ç¬†![info icon](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/images/Info%20icon.jpg)√Ç¬†help icon. Please fill up all the mandatory fields marked with "\*" in our sample template and ensure that your file is saved as a .csv file. You may also cut and paste details from your payroll MS Excel file into our .csv template. To do so, please click on **Download Sample Template** to download our template, and copy the employee details from your existing spreadsheet into our template.']

question: I am submitting CPF contributions via CPF EZPay. How can I link up my CPF data for the Auto Inclusion Scheme (AIS) under IRAS?
answer: ['You can visit IRAS website to sign up for the [CPF Data Link-up Service](https://www.iras.gov.sg/taxes/individual-income-tax/employers/auto-inclusion-scheme-(ais)-for-employment-income/sign-up-for-cpf-data-link-up-service)']

question: If I have already made payment, can I amend or delete my submission?
answer:
['If you are making payment via:
Direct Debit
You can login to CPF EZPay > View / Amend / Delete Submission to amend or delete your submission. You can change CPF contribution amounts for employees, delete employee, or amend other payment amounts e.g. CPF Late Payment Interest.
However, you will not be able to amend the Ordinary Wages, Additional Wages or Update Staff Information such as Date of Birth. If you wish to change them, please delete the current submission and create a new submission instead.
Do remember to re-submit your CPF contributions after you have amended or deleted your submission. Any amended submission will remain in Draft mode and will not be sent for Direct Debit deduction until you complete the entire submission process again.
All CPF submissions made on a day are processed at 5:15pm on the same day and the submission status will be updated as "Processed". You can no longer amend or delete the submission after it has been processed.
You can no longer amend or delete the submission as your submission has been processed. All CPF submissions made on a day are processed at 5:15pm on the same day and the submission status will be updated as "Processed".
If you have underpaid CPF contributions, you may pay the difference using a Submit **ad hoc**√Ç¬†CPF payments√Ç¬†in [CPF EZPay](https://www2.cpf.gov.sg/ert/dsa/spcpSelection.action) for the affected employee(s) in the affected month(s). You should key in the CPF shortfall amount you wish to pay but still declare the full wages earned for the month.
If you have overpaid the CPF contributions or paid for the wrong employee(s), you may [apply for a refund](/employer/compliance-and-rectifications/applying-for-refund-of-cpf-contributions) immediately and no later than one year from the date of payment, subject to the availability of funds in the member's CPF account.
PayNow QR
You can no longer make amendments to the submission after proceeding to the payment page with the generated QR code.
If you have underpaid CPF contributions, you may pay the difference using a√Ç¬†Submit√Ç¬†**ad hoc**√Ç¬†CPF payments√Ç¬†in [CPF EZPay](https://www2.cpf.gov.sg/ert/dsa/spcpSelection.action) for the affected employee(s) in the affected month(s). Declare the full wages earned for the month and the CPF shortfall amount.
If you have overpaid the CPF contributions or paid for the wrong employee(s), you may [apply for a refund](/employer/compliance-and-rectifications/applying-for-refund-of-cpf-contributions) immediately and no later than one year from the date of payment, subject to the availability of funds in the member's CPF account.']

question: What are the changes to the CPF EZPay (FTP) Specifications from 26 September 2022?
answer:
['From 26 September 2022, the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) will cease the collection of Foreign Worker Levy (FWL) and any FWL late payment interest through CPF EZPay. This is in line with MOM√¢¬Ä¬ôs plans to consolidate levy payments under MOM. Find out more about [levy payment methods](http://mom.gov.sg/other-levy-payment-methods).
For employers making submissions via CPF EZPay (FTP), please take note of the changes to the [FTP Specifications from 26 September 2022](/content/dam/web/employer/making-cpf-contributions/documents/CPFEZPayFTPSpecifications.pdf) and ensure compliance. After the cut-off date, FTP submissions containing payment for FWL and/or FWL late payment interest will be rejected.']

question: How do I make additional or back pay CPF contributions for my employees if I am submitting CPF contributions via Electronic Standing Instructions (ESI)?
answer:
['On top of your existing Electronic Standing Instructions (ESI) arrangement, you can make additional or back payments of CPF contributions for your employees by performing an additional submissions via the steps below:
1. At ESI Main Menu, select **Perform Additional Submission**.
2. Select the **Month** and key in the **Year** you are submitting for and click **Continue** to proceed.
3. Enter the contribution details for the affected employee (key in only the shortfall CPF amount) but enter the full wages earned for the month.
4. After completing all the contribution details and the summary section (key in CPF late payment interest, if applicable), click on **Continue.**
5. Verify the contribution details and click **Direct Debit** to complete the payment.
6. You will see the online acknowledgement screen after the submission is completed successfully. An email will also be sent to your email address(es) registered with the Board.']

question: How do I pay CPF late payment interest if I am submitting CPF contributions via Electronic Standing Instructions (ESI)?
answer:
['For CPF contributions that are submitted via Electronic Standing Instructions (ESI), you can make payment for CPF late payment interest by performing an additional submission via the steps below:
1. At ESI Main Menu, select **Perform Additional Submission**.
2. Select the **Month** and key in the **Year** you are submitting for and click **Continue** to proceed.
3. Scroll down to the summary section and key in the outstanding CPF late payment interest amount under √¢¬Ä¬ò2. CPF Late Payment Interest√¢¬Ä¬ô. Click **Continue**.
4. Verify the payment details and click **Direct Debit** to complete the payment.
5. You will see the online acknowledgement screen after the submission is completed successfully. An email will also be sent to your email address(es) registered with the Board.']

question: The employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs name I submitted is different from the name in his/her NRIC, what should I do?
answer:
['CPF contribution will be credited to employee's CPF account based on NRIC despite the mismatched name. Any mismatch in the name and NRIC for new hires who are contributing their CPF for the first time with the employer will be flagged out once in the ROP. Employers are required to correct employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs name in the next CPF submission.
**If you have paid CPF contributions to the intended employee**
Please remember to update your employee's name as shown in his/her NRIC in your next CPF submission. Kindly note that matching is only done on the principal name, so you should not key in variants such as hanyu pinyin and aliases.
**If you have paid CPF contributions to the wrong employee**
Please request for a [refund](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/compliance-and-rectifications/applying-for-refund-of-cpf-contributions#section-header-1136742657) or an [adjustment](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/compliance-and-rectifications/applying-for-adjustment-of-cpf-contributions) of CPF contributions immediately.
Any errors in CPF contributions should be rectified early while the documentary evidence is fresh. Request for refund or adjustment of CPF contributions via [Online](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/login/other-employer-services-login) must be made **within one year from the date of payment of the CPF.** You can refer to the 'Payment Received on' field in the Record of Payment to determine the date of payment.']

question: How do I register or apply to use Provident and Tax (PAT)?
answer:
['To register or apply to use PAT:
1. Register at Provident and Tax [website](https://pat.com.sg/) with CrimsonLogic.
2. Apply for Direct Debit [online](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/faq/making-cpf-contributions/payment-modes/how-do-i-apply-for-direct-debit-to-pay-cpf) with us.
Once your application has been successfully processed, we will notify you on when you can start making submissions on PAT .
If you are already a PAT user but have a new Subsidiary, please follow these steps:
1. Apply for a CPF Submission Number [online](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Schemes/ApplyforCPFSubmissionNumber/Index) .
2. Apply for Direct Debit [online](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/faq/making-cpf-contributions/payment-modes/how-do-i-apply-for-direct-debit-to-pay-cpf).
After completing these steps, you will be able to use the PAT services for your new Subsidiary. For more information on the PAT services, you can visit CrimsonLogic√¢¬Ä¬ôs PAT [website](https://pat.com.sg/).']

question: How long does it take before I can use Provident and Tax (PAT) system for CPF contributions?
answer:
['Please continue with your existing submission mode√Ç¬†until you have received email notifications from CPF Board to confirm that your company can proceed to submit CPF contribution details electronically via Provident and Tax (PAT).
For tax filing via PAT, the Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS) will inform you about their trial run separately before your actual submission.']

question: What is Provident and Tax (PAT)?
answer: ['[Provident and Tax (PAT)](https://pat.com.sg/) is a platform offered by CrimsonLogic for employers to submit their employees' monthly CPF contributions to CPF Board and yearly income forms to Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS) online.']

question: If I submit my CPF contributions via CPF EZPay, can I switch from one payment mode to another at any one time?
answer: ['You can choose to pay via Direct Debit or PayNow QR at the point of submission.']

question: What are the benefits of using Direct Debit to pay for my CPF contributions?
answer:
['You will enjoy the following benefits if you pay CPF contributions via Direct Debit:
1. Full control of your payments - Payment is within your control, as you may set the payment deduction date after you have submitted your CPF contribution details.
2. Save time - You do not need to provide your payment details each time you pay CPF contributions.']

question: How do I apply for Direct Debit to pay my company's CPF contributions?
answer:
['If you have a bank account with any of the eGIRO√Ç¬†[participating banks](/employer/faq/making-cpf-contributions/payment-modes/who-are-the-egiro-banks-for-dda-online-appn), you should apply for DDA online. The processing takes only minutes. If you are using a corporate bank account, your approver must approve the eGIRO request within your bank√¢¬Ä¬ôs internet banking portal within 48 hours before the application expires. We√¢¬Ä¬ôll notify you once your application is processed.
To apply for DDA online, follow the following steps:
1. Login with your√Ç¬†[Singpass](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/Services/EmployerGiroApplication/CoverPage?scheme=BIZ)
2. Specify your designated bank for the payment through the online application.
3. Login to your bank√¢¬Ä¬ôs internet banking portal, select the bank account and approve the eGIRO request.
4. You will receive a notification when your application is successful.
If you do not have a bank account with any of the eGIRO participating banks, you can make payment via√Ç¬†[PayNow QR](/employer/faq/making-cpf-contributions/payment-modes/how-do-i-pay-cpf-using-paynow-corporate).']

question: What are the available payment modes for CPF contributions?
answer:
['Payments for CPF contributions can be made using any one of the modes listed below. Please note that CPF contribution details must be submitted together with payments for CPF contributions.
1. [Direct Debit](/employer/faq/making-cpf-contributions/payment-modes/how-do-i-apply-for-direct-debit-to-pay-cpf)√Ç¬†(Recommended)
2. PayNow QR (supports personal or corporate bank account of participating banks)
Find out more on these [payment modes](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/making-cpf-contributions/payment-modes) available to you.']

question: How do I change my company's Direct Debit account to pay CPF contribution?
answer:
['To change your Direct Debit account for CPF contributions, simply submit a [new application for Direct Debit Authorisation (DDA)](/employer/faq/making-cpf-contributions/payment-modes/how-do-i-apply-for-direct-debit-to-pay-cpf) for your new bank account.
CPF contributions will continue to be deducted from the existing bank account until the new Direct Debit Authorisation form has been approved. Once it is approved, the previous Direct Debit arrangement will then be terminated.
Please refrain from submitting a new online DDA application to change your bank account while the deduction for your current submission is pending. This is to avoid unsuccessful deduction which may incur late payment interest. If you wish to change the bank account for Direct Debit deduction, you should only submit the new online DDA application after the deduction is successful.']

question: What happens if the Direct Debit deduction is unsuccessful?
answer:
['The Direct Debit payment may be unsuccessful for various reasons, such as payment exceeding your bank's payment limits or due to insufficient funds. We will inform you of the unsuccessful Direct Debit deduction, and will make the deduction seven calendar days after the date of the first unsuccessful deduction. Late payment interest may be incurred.
Please make sure you maintain sufficient funds in your bank account or change your payment limits with your bank before the second deduction attempt. Some banks may charge an administrative fee for unsuccessful deductions.']

question: How do I terminate my Direct Debit arrangement for payment of CPF contributions?
answer:
['If you no longer wish to pay your CPF contributions by Direct Debit, please submit your request to√Ç¬†[terminate your direct debit arrangement](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/AuthenticationProviderSelection/SelectSPCPProvider?returnAction=%2feSvc%2fWeb%2fMiscellaneous%2fTerminationDirectDebit%2fCoverPage&theme=Employer).
After the CPF Board has processed the request, we will inform you accordingly. Please also notify your bank on the termination so that they can update their records.']

question: How long does it take to process applications relating to Direct Debit?
answer:
['Please refer to the table for our service standards for processing applications relating to Direct Debit.
| | |
| --- | --- |
| **Service** | **Processing Time** |
| Online Direct Debit Authorisation (DDA) for CPF EZPay | For personal bank account, the approval takes only minutes.For corporate bank account, the approver must approve the eGIRO request within the bank√¢¬Ä¬ôs internet banking portal within 48 hours before the application expires. |
| \*Termination of Direct Debit arrangement for CPF Contributions | One working day |
*\*Request to terminate Direct Debit arrangement will be processed if there is no Direct Debit payment due for deduction (i.e. no pending deductions). Otherwise, processing can only commence two working days after deduction date. Alternatively, you may terminate your Direct Debit arrangement with your bank directly and inform the Board by√Ç¬†[writing to us](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/FeedbackSubscription/Index).*']

question: How do I check the status of my Direct Debit application?
answer: ['If you have submitted the Direct Debit Authorisation (DDA) application online, you can check your application status [online](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/AuthenticationProviderSelection/SelectSPCPProvider?returnAction=%2feSvc%2fWeb%2fPortalServices%2fEmployerPortalServices&theme=Employer). We will also notify you of the status and effective date of the Direct Debit arrangement upon approval.']

question: How can I proceed to make payment if the PayNow QR code for paying my employees' CPF contributions expires?
answer:
['The PayNow QR code to pay your CPF contributions must be scanned before 11:59pm on the day of submission. If your QR code has expired, you will not be able to make the payment, and you will need to resubmit your CPF contributions and get a new PayNow QR code.
After your payment has been made, your payment status will be updated as "Paid" in CPF EZPay instantly.
Please make sure you have sufficient funds in your bank account before the payment is processed. If you have set a PayNow payment limit with your bank, do ensure that the limit is sufficient to pay your CPF contributions. Some banks may charge an administrative fee for unsuccessful payment attempts.
Please perform a new submission and scan the QR code to make payment within the same day.']

question: How do I pay CPF contributions using PayNow QR?
answer:
['PayNow QR is a quick way for you to make payment for CPF contributions by scanning a QR code, via existing mobile banking apps. PayNow QR allows you to use corporate or personal accounts to pay your CPF contributions. You would have to scan the PayNow QR code using a [PayNow participating bank√¢¬Ä¬ô](https://abs.org.sg/consumer-banking/pay-now)s app in order for the payment to be processed successfully. Any payment made without using the issued PayNow QR code (e.g. making payment directly to CPF Board√¢¬Ä¬ôs UEN or changing the details after scanning the PayNow QR code)√Ç¬†or multiple payments made using the same PayNow QR code will be refunded with the reference code √¢¬Ä¬úCPF√¢¬Ä¬ù.
The maximum amount you can transfer via PayNow QR is√Ç¬†$200,000, subject to daily and monthly limits set by your bank. If your total CPF submission amount exceeds $200,000, you will need to perform another submission via CPF EZPay. For example, if your total CPF submission amount is $300,000, you will need to make two separate CPF submissions via CPF EZPay consisting of $200,000 and $100,000 respectively.
Please make sure you have sufficient funds in your bank account before the payment is deducted. If you have set a PayNow payment limit with your bank, do ensure that the limit is sufficient to pay your CPF contributions. Some banks may charge an administrative fee for each unsuccessful payment attempt.
**Personal bank account**
On the day of submission, you must ensure that you scan the PayNow QR code and pay using your PayNow√Ç¬†participating bank's√Ç¬†app before it expires at 23:59 hrs. Once the QR code has expired, you will not be able to make the payment, and will need to resubmit your CPF contributions and get a new PayNow QR code.
After your payment has been made, your payment status will be updated as "Paid" in CPF EZPay almost instantly.
**Corporate bank account**
Two-level authorisation (Maker and Checker) is required for PayNow Corporate account users. Maker needs to scan the PayNow QR code to prepare the transaction before 23:59 hrs on the day of submission. Thereafter, the Checker needs to login to the banking app to approve the transaction. Though there is no time limit for approving the transaction, it is advisable for the Checker to approve the payment immediately to avoid incurring late payment interest.
If the Maker did not scan the PayNow QR code before it expires, you√¢¬Ä¬ôll need to resubmit your CPF contributions and get a new PayNow QR code.
After your payment has been approved, your payment status will be updated as "Paid" in CPF EZPay almost instantly.']

question: Who are the eGIRO participating banks for the Direct Debit Authorisation (DDA) online application?
answer:
['eGIRO (Electronic GIRO) is a joint initiative by The Association of Banks in Singapore (ABS), and Participating Banks, with the support of the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS), to digitise the GIRO application process and significantly reduce the turnaround time for setting up a GIRO arrangement.
Please see table below for the eGIRO participating banks for DDA online application. ABS is working with the industry to onboard more banks onto eGIRO service and we will update this table accordingly.
| | | |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **eGIRO Participating Banks** | **Personal Bank Account** | **Corporate Bank Account** |
| DBS Bank/POSB | Y | Y |
| OCBC Bank | Y | Y |
| UOB | Y | Y |
| The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited (HSBC) | Y | N |
| Standard Chartered Bank | Y | N |
| Maybank | Y | Y |
| Bank of China | Y | Y |
| Industrial and Commercial Bank of China√Ç¬†(ICBC) | Y | N |']

question: If I am paying via Direct Debit, when will CPF Board deduct from my bank account after my CPF submission?
answer:
['Direct Debit deduction will only take place after you have submitted your CPF contribution details. If you are submitting via CPF EZPay, you will see the deduction date in the "Deduction On" field below the "Direct Debit" button.
If you have set up Electronic Standing Instruction within CPF EZPay, the deduction date will be the 3rd working day from the 14th of the following month (or the next working day if the 14th falls on a Saturday, Sunday or Public Holiday).
Please remember to maintain sufficient funds for successful deduction. If your deduction fails, there will be a 2nd deduction seven calendar days later (or next working day if it falls on a public holiday). This may result in late CPF submission and incur late payment interest.']

question: I am making payment via PayNow QR, what does the different payment status under View/ Amend/ Delete Submission screen in CPF EZPay mean?
answer:
['If the PayNow payment status in CPF EZPay shows √¢¬Ä¬òPaid√¢¬Ä¬ô, it means that the payment was successful.
If the PayNow payment status shows √¢¬Ä¬òPending Payment√¢¬Ä¬ô, it means that payment has not been made.
* For personal bank accounts, the PayNow QR code to pay your CPF contributions must be scanned before 23:59 hrs on the day of submission. If your QR code has expired, you will not be able to make the payment, and you will need to resubmit your CPF contributions and get a new PayNow QR code.
* For corporate bank accounts, the maker needs to scan the PayNow QR code before 23:59 hrs on the day of submission. Thereafter, the Checker needs to login to the banking app to approve the transaction as soon as possible.
PayNow submissions with √¢¬Ä¬òPending Payment√¢¬Ä¬ô status cannot be deleted. The system will auto-update the √¢¬Ä¬òPending Payment√¢¬Ä¬ô status to √¢¬Ä¬òNot Paid√¢¬Ä¬ô after two months.']

question: What is the minimum age for your employees to qualify for CPF contributions?
answer: ['Your employees are required to pay CPF contributions as long as they are Singapore Citizens or Singapore Permanent Residents, and are employed in Singapore under a [contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service).']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for part-time, casual or temporary employees?
answer:
['CPF contributions are payable for part-time, casual or temporary employees who are:
* Singapore Citizens or Permanent Residents,
* Engaged under a√Ç¬†[contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service), and
* Earning total wages of more than $50 per month.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable by the holding company or the subsidiary company if my employee is seconded from the holding company to the subsidiary company?
answer: ['The employer who had entered into an employment contract with the employee is required to pay the CPF contributions.']

question: What is the definition of an employee?
answer:
['Under the CPF Act, an employee is defined as:
* A person who is employed in Singapore under a [contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service); or
* A Singapore Citizen who is employed under a contract of service or other agreement entered into in Singapore as a master, seaman or apprentice in any vessel.
Find out more information√Ç¬†on the√Ç¬†[different types of employees](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/employer-obligations/who-should-receive-cpf-contributions).']

question: Who is exempted from receiving CPF contributions?
answer:
['[Employees](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/employer-obligations/who-should-receive-cpf-contributions)√Ç¬†should receive CPF contributions from their employers. However, the following employees are exempted from receiving CPF contributions:
1. **Students who fulfil exemption criteria**. Find out more about√Ç¬†[who you need to pay CPF contributions for](/content/dam/web/employer/faq/employer-obligations/documents/Who_do_you_need_to_pay_cpf_for.pdf)√Ç¬†(PDF, 0.2MB) under the header √¢¬Ä¬úStudents√¢¬Ä¬ù.
2. **Foreigners**. Persons who are not Singapore Citizens or Permanent Residents.
3. **Domestic employees with employment not exceeding 14 hours in any week**. Examples include cooks, maids and gardeners.
4. **Employees of the United Nations (UN) Organisation, or any agency or institution of the United Nations Organisation stationed in Singapore**. Please refer to the√Ç¬†[UN website](https://www.un.org/depts/los/Links/UN-links.htm)√Ç¬†for the list of organisations that are part of the UN Organisation under the headers "United Nations Organs and Programmes" and "Specialized Agencies and other Organizations".
5. **Seamen who are Singapore Citizens and are employed**:
i. in a Swedish ship on terms and conditions of service applicable to Swedish seamen; or
ii. in a Norwegian ship on terms and conditions of service applicable to Norwegian seamen; or
iii. by the East Asiatic Co. Ltd. of Denmark on terms and conditions of the agreement between the Danish Shipowners√¢¬Ä¬ô Association and the Seamen√¢¬Ä¬ôs Union in Denmark.']

question: If my foreign employees request to contribute to CPF, can I make CPF contributions for them?
answer:
['CPF is a comprehensive social security system that is intended to support Singapore Citizens and Singapore Permanent Residents (SPRs). From 1 January 2003, CPF contributions are exempted for foreign employees as they may not retire here in Singapore. Therefore, CPF contributions are only payable for Singapore Citizens and SPRs.
For foreigners who wish to save voluntarily for their own retirement, they may instead consider [Supplementary Retirement Scheme (SRS](https://www.mof.gov.sg/schemes/individuals/supplementary-retirement-scheme)).']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for employees of General Conference Corporation of Seventh-Day Adventists?
answer: ['CPF contributions are exempted for employees who are employed by the General Conference Corporation of Seventh-Day Adventists under a contract of service or other agreement entered into outside Singapore and who are not domiciled in Singapore.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for Limited Liability Partners (LLP)?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable for partners of Limited Liability Partners (LLP) who are employed under a [contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service).']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for my employee who is seconded or posted to work overseas?
answer: ['CPF contributions are not payable for your employee who is seconded or posted to work overseas as wages given in respect of overseas employment do not attract CPF contributions.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for volunteers?
answer: ['CPF contributions are not payable if the volunteers are not employed under a [contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service).']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for my employee who is on overseas employment but working remotely from Singapore as a temporary arrangement due to COVID-19 situation?
answer:
['Similar to [IRAS tax concession](https://www.iras.gov.sg/news-events/singapore-budget/covid-19-support-measures-and-tax-guidance/tax-guidance/for-individuals/working-remotely-from-singapore-due-to-covid-19), CPF contributions are not payable up till 30 Jun 2021 if your employee has been working from Singapore remotely since 2020 due to COVID-19 travel restrictions, provided that all the conditions stated below are met.
**If the period of your employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs stay in Singapore did not extend beyond 31 Dec 2020**
The qualifying conditions are:
a. There is no change in the contractual terms governing employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs employment overseas before and after his/her return to Singapore; and
b. This is a temporary work arrangement due to COVID-19.
**If the period of your employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs stay in Singapore extend to 2021**
*(i) For the period up to 30 Jun 2021*
Besides conditions (a) and (b) above, the additional qualifying conditions are:
c. The work performed by employee during his/her stay in Singapore would have been performed overseas if not for the travel restrictions caused by COVID-19; and
d. Employee will leave Singapore as soon as he/she is able to do so.
*(ii) For the period from 1 Jul 2021*
Similar to other employees who are working in Singapore, CPF contributions are required on wages payable to employees who are working remotely in Singapore from 1 Jul 2021 onwards.
Nevertheless, you may [write to us](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/FeedbackSubscription/Index?utm_source=shortURL) for a review of the CPF treatment if the country where your employee is based has imposed a ban on the entry of travellers into the country or it is impossible for your employee to travel due to unavailability of flights or other modes of transport. You will have to declare that the four conditions as described above [i.e. (a) to (d)] are fulfilled and provide supporting documents on the travel ban.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for seaman?
answer:
['CPF contributions are payable for a master, a seaman or an apprentice in any vessel if he is a citizen of Singapore and employed under a [contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service) or other agreement entered into in Singapore.
However, CPF contributions are exempted for a seaman who is a Singapore Citizen and is employed:
1. in a Swedish ship on terms and conditions of service applicable to Swedish seamen; or
2. in a Norwegian ship on terms and conditions of service applicable to Norwegian seamen; or
3. by the East Asiatic Co. Ltd. of Denmark on terms and conditions of the agreement between the Danish Shipowners√¢¬Ä¬ô Association and the Seamen√¢¬Ä¬ôs Union in Denmark.
CPF contributions are not payable for a seaman who is a permanent resident of Singapore.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on wages given to my employee who has passed away?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on the wages payable to your employee who has passed away.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for church workers?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable for church workers who are employed under a [contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service).']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for my employee who is employed to work overseas?
answer: ['CPF contributions are not payable on wages given to your employee who is employed to work overseas.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for Shatec students engaged in trainings approved by Shatec Institutes?
answer: ['With effect from 1 March 2018, CPF contributions are payable for Shatec students employed under a [contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service).']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for my employee who went on absence without leave (AWOL)?
answer:
['CPF contribution are not payable if your employee is not entitled to any wages during the period he was absent without leave (AWOL).
CPF contributions are payable on the total wages given to him in that calendar month if he had worked certain days before AWOL.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for full-time National Servicemen (NSFs)?
answer: ['CPF contributions are not payable for full-time National Servicemen (NSFs) enlisted for national service under the Enlistment Act as they are not employed under a [contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service).']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for interns undergoing an internship programme?
answer:
['In general, CPF contributions are payable for all local employees, including interns, to enable Singapore Citizens and Singapore Permanent Residents to start early in building their retirement savings.
However, in consultation with the Ministry of Education, employers can be exempted from making CPF contributions on wages (e.g. allowance, bonus, overtime pay) for interns if they are students:
1. enrolled in an institution or programme subsidised by the MOE, and
2. employed for training approved by their educational institution.
This approach serves to prioritise internship opportunities for students whose courses of study are most aligned with national objectives. For such CPF-exempt internships (including any approved extensions), employers must obtain and retain documentations from the institutions.
If the internship is not endorsed by the educational institutions, CPF contributions remain payable similar to part-time and temporary employments.
Find out more about√Ç¬†[which classes of student employees are CPF exempted](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/content/dam/web/employer/faq/employer-obligations/documents/Who_do_you_need_to_pay_cpf_for.pdf)√Ç¬†(PDF, 0.2MB) under the header √¢¬Ä¬úStudents√¢¬Ä¬ù.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for my employee during his overseas training?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable during overseas training if your employee is employed in Singapore but is required to go overseas for the training period.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for Operationally Ready National Servicemen (NSmen) during NS training?
answer:
['Under the Enlistment Act, CPF contributions are payable for your employees who are Operationally Ready National Servicemen (NSmen) during their NS training, based on their usual civilian income.
You have to pay CPF contributions based on the total wages typically payable to them in each calendar month,√Ç¬†as though as they are not away for NS training. Besides basic salary and fixed allowance components of your employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs wages, the variable allowances (e.g. overtime pay and allowances) typically paid to the NSman on a monthly basis would also attract CPF contributions.
You have to bear the full employer's share of CPF contribution, and you are entitled to recover the full employee's share from their wages.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for locum doctors?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable for locum doctors employed under a [contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service).']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for my employee who is seconded or transferred from overseas to work in Singapore?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable for your employee who is a citizen or permanent resident of Singapore if he is working in Singapore and earning total wages of more than $50 a month.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for my employee who is on no pay leave?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on the total wages earned by your employee in each calendar month, less any no pay leave he has taken in that month.']

question: What is a contract of service?
answer:
['A contract of service is an agreement in which one person agrees to employ another as an employee, and the other person agrees to serve the employer as an employee. The agreement can be in writing, verbal, expressed or implied.
Please refer to the√Ç¬†[Ministry of Manpower website](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service)√Ç¬†for more information on a contract of service.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for my employee who is on overseas assignment?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable if your employee is employed in Singapore but required to go overseas for assignment, e.g. overseas business trip, meeting overseas clients, attending overseas seminars, conferences and training.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for my employee, who is under overseas employment, if he returns to Singapore for personal reasons and works during the Stay Home Notice (SHN) period?
answer: ['If your employee is returning to Singapore for personal reasons, e.g. to celebrate festive holidays with his family, and will be working remotely in Singapore for you during the Stay Home Notice (SHN) period, CPF contributions are not payable for him since working during the SHN period is a temporary work arrangement due to COVID-19 restrictions.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for law pupils?
answer:
['Based on the law practice training guidelines of the Singapore Institute of Legal Education (SILE), the factors in a Practice Training Contract do not point towards a [contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service). Generally, CPF contributions are not payable for law pupils, i.e. law graduates who are serving their practice service period.
However, if the law graduates enter into a contract of employment with the law firm, CPF contributions are payable on wages given to them.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for directors?
answer:
['CPF contributions are not payable on directors' fees voted to them at General Meetings.
However, if the directors of the company are also engaged under a [contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service), CPF contributions are payable on the wages received.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for consultants?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable for consultants who are employed under a [contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service).']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for my hawker assistant?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable for your hawker assistant who is employed under a [contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service).']

question: Are CPF contributions payable for partner or sole proprietor of a firm?
answer:
['CPF contributions are payable for partner who is employed under a [contract of service](https://www.mom.gov.sg/employment-practices/contract-of-service) with your firm. Otherwise, he is considered as a self-employed person (SEP) and cannot receive CPF contributions from the firm as an employee.
Sole proprietor of a firm is considered as an SEP. As such, a sole proprietor cannot receive CPF contributions from the firm as an employee.
Do note that an SEP earning an annual Net Trade Income (NTI) of more than $6,000 needs to pay compulsory MediSave contribution. NTI is your gross trade income minus all allowable business expenses, capital allowances and trade losses as determined by IRAS. Please visit the√Ç¬†[IRAS website](https://www.iras.gov.sg/taxes/individual-income-tax/self-employed-and-partnerships)√Ç¬†to read more on the definition of an SEP.']

question: How do I calculate CPF contributions on Additional Wages (AW) when an employee resigns?
answer:
['If your employee resigns in the current year, the Additional Wages (AW) ceiling has to be recalculated based on the actual Ordinary Wages (OW) subject to CPF, paid up till the last month of employment. For more information, please view√Ç¬†[Examples](/content/dam/web/employer/faq/employer-obligations/documents/Examples_on_Additional_Wage_Ceiling_Computation_Sep2023.pdf)√Ç¬†(PDF, 0.6MB) on the computation of the AW ceiling.
You should then pay any shortfall in CPF contributions together with your employee's contributions for his last month of employment. If there are any excess CPF contributions, you should submit a refund application√Ç¬†[online](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/eSvc/Web/AuthenticationProviderSelection/SelectSPCPProvider?returnAction=%2feSvc%2fWeb%2fPortalServices%2fEmployerPortalServices&theme=Employer).']

question: My employee joined my company in July 2021. Do I have to take into account the Additional Wages (AW) that were paid to him by his ex-company when I compute the AW ceiling?
answer: ['As employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs Additional Wage (AW) ceiling is computed on a per employer per year basis, you do not need to take into account of past AW paid to him if his ex-company is a different entity.']

question: Are CPF contributions rounded to the nearest dollar?
answer:
['The CPF contribution rates are used to determine the total CPF contributions and the employee's share of CPF contributions. To compute the employer's share of CPF contributions, you should first calculate the total CPF contributions and then subtract the employee's share of CPF contributions to get the employer's share.
The total contributions for the calendar month should be rounded off to the nearest dollar. An amount of 50 cents should be regarded as an additional dollar. The cents should be dropped for the employee's share of CPF contributions.
Please use our [CPF Contribution Calculator](https://www.cpf.gov.sg/employer/tools-and-services/calculators/cpf-contribution-calculator) to compute the CPF contribution amount.']

question: Are wages payable to an employee who is on maternity leave classified as Ordinary Wages (OW) or Additional Wages (AW)?
answer:
['The monthly wages payable to your female employee who is on maternity leave are Ordinary Wages (OW).
If there are any bonuses payable to her during her maternity leave period, they are classified as Additional Wages (AW).']

question: Are retrospective salary increments classified as Ordinary Wages (OW) or Additional Wages (AW)?
answer:
['Retrospective salary increments are increments which are decided later, but retrospectively applied from an earlier month. The back-dated amount will be considered as Additional Wages (AW).
If the salary increment was not applied retrospectively, but was paid late due to an administrative delay, it will be considered as Ordinary Wages (OW) and late payment interest may apply.
**Example:**
If your salary increment was decided only in April, but your employer decided to back-date the increment to commence from February, the salary increment for the period from February to March will be considered as AW for April.
However, if your salary increment was payable since February, but was not paid out until your employer realises the administrative error in April, your employer will have to compute the CPF shortfall for February and March and make the payment as soon as possible. Late payment interest will apply as the CPF contributions are late.']

question: What are Total Wages (TW)?
answer:
['Wages can be classified into Ordinary Wages (OW) or Additional Wages (AW). Total Wages (TW) is the sum of OW and AW.
CPF contributions are computed on TW payable to an employee in a calendar month, with different ceilings applied to OW and AW.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on Annual Wage Supplement (AWS)?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on Annual Wage Supplement (AWS) given to your employee.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on bonus?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on bonus given to your employee, e.g. retention Bonus, 13th month bonus, sign-on bonus, discretionary bonus.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on mobile phone subscription allowance or reimbursement?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on mobile phone subscription allowance. CPF contributions are not payable on mobile phone subscription reimbursement if your employee incurred the expenses solely for official purposes. Otherwise, CPF contributions are still payable.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on housing/rental subsidy?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on housing or rental subsidy given to your employee.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on payments given to my employee for meeting the Key Performance Indicators (KPI)?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on payments given to your employee for meeting the Key Performance Indicators.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on meal allowance or reimbursement?
answer:
['CPF contributions are payable on meal allowance given to your employee.
CPF contributions are not payable on meal reimbursement given to your employee for working beyond normal working hours, e.g. overtime and on non-working days. Otherwise, CPF contributions are still payable.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on probation period pay?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on probation period pay.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on tips?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on tips that you have collected and distributed to your employees.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on benefit in kind?
answer:
['CPF contributions are not payable on benefit given to your employee in kind, e.g. a commemorative watch or payment made directly by you to a service provider.
Such benefit in kind where no cash payment to your employee is involved would not be considered as wages because only remuneration in money granted in respect of employment attracts CPF contributions.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on bonus given to my employee by a third party e.g. my service partner?
answer:
['CPF contributions are payable on bonus given to your employee by a third party, e.g. your service partner, if the bonus is a reward for work done in respect of your employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs employment.
**Example**
Company A is a marketing company partnering various banks to help increase its sales for personal loans and credit cards. Upon achieving specific monthly targets, the banks will give bonuses to the employees of Company A as a reward. Company A receives these bonuses from the banks and disburses to its employees.
Company A is required to pay CPF contributions on the bonuses given to its employees as the cash payments are wages given in respect of their employment.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on gratuity and ex-gratia payments?
answer:
['CPF contributions are payable on gratuity and ex-gratia payments that are given in respect of your employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs employment. For example, if the payment is to:
* reward your employee's good performance,
* reward your employee for the completion of a contract/project,
* entice your employee to remain in employment, or
* recognise your employee's service with you.
CPF contributions are not payable on the gratuity and ex-gratia payments if they are compensations given for termination or loss of employment.
**Retirement gratuity given to retired employee who is subsequently re-employed**
CPF contributions are not payable on retirement gratuity if it is given to your employee without any condition, i.e. it is given regardless of whether he is subsequently re-employed by you under a new employment contract.
However, CPF contributions are payable if it is given on the condition that he takes up the new employment with you. This cash payment will be considered as wages as it is given in respect of his new employment.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on monetary donations given to my employee for bereavement?
answer: ['CPF contributions are not payable on monetary donations given to your employee for bereavement.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on reimbursements?
answer:
['CPF contributions are not payable on reimbursements incurred for official purposes. The reimbursement amount must not exceed the expenditure incurred.
Some examples are:
* Transport expenses incurred by your employees to travel to a client's office for a business meeting
* Meal expenses incurred by your employees for working overtime
* Laundry expenses for your uniformed employees.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on monetary wedding gift given to my employee?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on monetary wedding gift given to your employee.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on bonuses given to my employees for their employment in Singapore if they are currently posted overseas?
answer:
['CPF contributions are not payable for your employees posted to work overseas.
As such, CPF contributions are not required on bonuses paid when your employee is posted overseas. It does not matter if the bonus is granted on account of his√Ç¬†employment in Singapore prior to the overseas posting.
Similarly, if your employee is currently working in Singapore, any bonuses that becomes payable during this period would attract CPF contributions.
The above CPF treatments apply only if there is no change in employer, i.e. you are still the employer, despite the change in country of employment for your employee.
**Where the Singapore employer and the overseas employer are different legal entities**
CPF contributions are payable if:
a. Your employee has terminated the employment contract with you in Singapore and started a new employment with an overseas employer; and
b. The bonus is payable by you for your employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs√Ç¬†employment in Singapore.
CPF contributions are not payable if:
a. The employee has terminated the employment contract with the overseas employer and started a new employment with you in Singapore; and
b. The bonus is payable by the overseas company for√Ç¬†employment overseas.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on insurance payout given to my employee?
answer: ['CPF contributions are not payable on insurance payout made by insurer to your employee if he is the insured person and the payout is for his benefit.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on winter wear and luggage allowances given to my employee?
answer:
['CPF contributions are payable on winter wear and luggage allowances given to your employee.
However, CPF contributions are not payable on reimbursements given to your employee for expenses incurred on winter wear and luggage for official overseas trips. The reimbursement amount must not exceed the expenditure incurred.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable by the holding company or the subsidiary company if the employee is seconded from the former to latter?
answer: ['The employer who had entered into an employment contract with the employee is required to pay the CPF contributions.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on payouts from retirement savings held by a trust fund to my employee who is still in employment?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on the payouts from funds set aside for pensions or retirement given to your employee who is still in employment with you.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on cash benefits given to my employee when he leaves his employment?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on any cash benefits given in respect of your employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs employment as they constitute wages. As long as wages are payable, even if they are payable only after your employee has left employment, CPF contributions are required. Examples are bonuses, end of contract incentives, completion of contract bonuses.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on cash payment given to your employee for self-improvement courses?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on cash payment given to your employee for self-improvement courses.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on cash rewards given to my employees who report on safety lapses and incidents in the workplace?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on cash rewards given to your employees who report on safety lapses and incidents in the workplace if the employees are required to do so as part of the job scope. Otherwise, CPF contributions are not payable.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on encashment of leave?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on cash payment given to your employee for encashment of his leave.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on Monthly Variable Component (MVC)?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on the monthly variable component given to your employee.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on bursary and scholarship awards?
answer:
['CPF contributions are not payable on bursary and scholarship awards given to your employee if they are genuine pre-estimates or reimbursements of expenses incurred for official purpose, e.g. you send your employee for further studies as part of his training. The cash award may include reimbursement of course fee, book fee, overseas living expenses, air tickets etc.
If you are using genuine pre-estimates, you must be able to show that the amount given to your employee is reasonable, e.g. there is a sound methodology to derive the quantum such as basing on recent cost or past receipts for similar expenses. Do note that any overseas living allowance should be reasonable based on the country of study, and cannot be simply based on your employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs last drawn salary to qualify as a genuine pre-estimate. If you are giving reimbursements, the amount must not exceed the expenditure incurred.
If the cash payments are not genuine pre-estimates or reimbursements for official purpose(s), CPF contributions are payable.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on reimbursement of examination fee incurred by my employee?
answer:
['CPF contributions are payable on reimbursement of examination fees given to your employee if the examination is taken for his self-interest or personal development.
CPF contributions are not payable if the examination fees are incurred by your employee for official purposes, e.g., for employment-related training or certification. The reimbursement must not exceed the actual expenditure.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on cash payments given to my employee if they are not paid through the payroll system?
answer:
['CPF contributions are payable on wages given to your employee and not payable on non-wages, e.g. reimbursements incurred for official purposes.
The CPF treatment is the same regardless whether they are paid through the payroll system.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on profit sharing?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on profit sharing given to your employees.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on redundancy payment?
answer:
['CPF contributions are payable on redundancy payment given to your employee who is still under your employment but not required to report to work temporarily.
CPF contributions are not payable on termination benefits given for retrenchment or loss of employment.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on ang bao/red packet?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on the cash payment given to employee in the form of ang bao/red packet.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on Restrictive Covenant payment?
answer: ['CPF contributions are not payable on Restrictive Covenant payment given to your employee to comply with specific contractual obligations after he has left your employment, e.g. to restrain him from entering into an employment with another company in the same industry or to join your competitors after he left your employment.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on cash payments given to my employee for his personal car-related expenses?
answer:
['CPF contributions are payable on cash payments given for your employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs personal car-related expenses, e.g. car loan interest, car parking fee, Electronic Road Pricing (ERP) fee, petrol, road tax, insurance, repair, servicing fee.
However, CPF contributions are not payable on reimbursement of expenses incurred by your employee for official purpose, e.g. the company√¢¬Ä¬ôs car is used for work-related travel and you reimburse your employee the petrol expenses. The reimbursement amount must not exceed the expenditure incurred.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on encashment of flexible benefits?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on the cash payments given to your employee from unused flexible benefits.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on cash prizes given in contests?
answer: ['CPF contributions are not payable on cash prizes given to participants in contests where the cash payments are not given in respect of employment, e.g. Dinner and Dance, lucky draws, early bird draws.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on advance salary/loan given to my employee?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable in the month that the employee is entitled to the salary regardless of any loan or advance payment.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on personal car loan?
answer:
['CPF contributions are not payable on personal car loan given to your employee if it is not tied to his employment.
CPF contributions are payable if you agree that your employee need not pay back the loan or for the loan to be written off, e.g. given as a cash gift to your employee or you imposed conditions that are tied to employment (such as your employee must clinch a deal with a client or he has to work overtime for the next few months). In such cases, the cash payment is given in respect of employment.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on cash payments given to my employees for passing examinations?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on cash payments if passing examinations are part of your employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs official duties, e.g. you sent your employee to a course as part of your training programme and he is required to pass the examinations to get the qualification to perform his job. The cash payments are akin to other awards given to recognise or incentivise employees for good performance.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on cash payment given to my employee for child care expenses incurred by his children?
answer:
['CPF contributions are payable on the cash payment given to your employee for his children√¢¬Ä¬ôs child care or school expenses.
CPF contributions are not payable if you make the payment directly to the service provider, e.g. child care centre or school, as it will be considered as benefit-in-kind.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on death benefits given to my employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs next of kin?
answer: ['CPF contributions are not payable on death benefits given to your deceased employee's next of kin.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on stocks or shares offered to my employees?
answer:
['CPF contributions are payable if you give your employee any cash payment for them to purchase or subsidise their purchase of stocks or shares.
CPF contributions are not payable if the stocks or shares are given in kind to your employee (i.e. he receives the stocks or shares held in his name) or if the stocks or shares are discounted (i.e. he pays a lower price for the purchase but no cash payment is made to him). If the employee subsequently sells the stocks or shares which are held in his name, CPF contributions are not payable as the stocks and shares belong to him.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on donations given to my employee for bereavements?
answer: ['CPF contributions are not payable on donations given to your employees for bereavements.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on ex-gratia payment?
answer: ['Ex-gratia payment is a cash payment given in gratitude without any contractual or legal obligation. CPF contributions are payable on the ex-gratia cash payment that is given as a token of appreciation for your employee's past services/contributions to you. CPF contributions are not payable on the ex-gratia payment that is given as a compensation for your employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs loss of employment.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on garden leave?
answer: ['CPF contributions are payable on the wages given to your employee who is placed on garden leave.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on gift vouchers?
answer:
['CPF contributions are not payable on gift vouchers given to your employee if they are non-cash benefits, i.e. they are not legal tender or convertible into cash.
For example, money order or cash voucher which can be redeemed as cash is considered as cash benefit and will still attract CPF contributions.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on Gratuity & Achievement Award, and Programme Allowance given to my employees under the Precision Engineering WSQ Diploma programme training scheme?
answer:
['CPF contributions are not payable on the Gratuity & Achievement Award given for successful completion of the Precision Engineering WSQ Diploma programme training scheme.
CPF contributions are also not payable on the Programme Allowance given to your employees for attending training after working hours.']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on air passage?
answer:
['CPF contributions are not payable on air passage for official purposes, e.g. meeting overseas clients, attending seminars, conferences and training. The reimbursement amount must not exceed the expenditure incurred.
CPF contributions are payable on air passage that increases your employee√¢¬Ä¬ôs wages. Some examples are:
* Home leave passage (air passage provided by you for your employees to visit their home countries)
* Cash payment in lieu of home leave passage
* Air passage provided to your employee to commence work in Singapore
* Air passages provided to your employee's family members']

question: Are CPF contributions payable on honorarium?
